loans.name: Rodrigo Denys

texts.es: El Sr. Rodrigo  es cliente nuevo de la institución,  será su  primer crédito el es soltero vive en la casa de su Mama la Sra. Rosario ambos viven en la zona de el tejar de la ciudad de  La Paz, La Sra. rosario se dedica a la venta de medicamentos naturales y  productos  farmacéuticos , Y el Sr. Rodrigo se dedica  a la venta  CD   y DVD de música y películas en  las distintas ferias de la ciudad de La paz , el crédito   lo destinara para la compra de  un televisor, ya que será uno de sus instrumentos de trabajo, es una persona joven  con ganas de superación con el tiempo desea poder tener su internet propio, el cliente se siente beneficiado con el crédito Kiva y muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a new client of the institution, and this will be his first loan.  He is single, and he lives with his mother, Rosario.  They live in the weaving zone of the city of La Paz.

Rosario sells natural medications and pharmaceutical products.  Rodrigo sells CDs, music DVDs, and movies at the different fairs in the city of La Paz.

The loan is to buy a television because it will be one of his work tools.  He is a young man who is determined to succeed, and he wants to open his own Internet cafe in the future.

He feels he has benefited from the Kiva loan, and he is very grateful to the institution for the support they provided.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер житель города Куляб. Ему 22 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Его отец находится за границей, а сестра учится в Вузе. Сам Алишер предоставляет услугу, он таксист. В этой области он уже три года. Кредит берет для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Alisher lives in the town of Kulob. He is 22 years old and single. He lives in his parents’ home. His father [works] abroad, and his sister is in college. Alisher provides taxi services. He has been in this business for three years already. He is taking out a loan in order to have his car repaired.

loans.use: to get his car repaired

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 36 years old, a business lady, and she is married to Simon who is a village chief. They are blessed with three children. She has been distributing beverages to other retailers for the past three years with the monthly income of about KES 10,500 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Lucy will use the loan to buy a fridge for storing soft drinks and to add more soft drinks. With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand her business. 

She hopes to open a wholesale shop and be the main distributor around her village.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for storing soft drinks and to add more soft drinks.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 56 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Patricia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Patricia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a 35-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese. He has had a stationery shop for three years. His hardship is insufficient capital. His vision is to have a big stationery and secretarial shop, and to educate his children. Nelson needs the loan to buy stationery to sell.

loans.use: to buy stationery to sell

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Battulga is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. His wife is a chef in a small cafe, and his daughter goes to kindergarten. He started his taxi service business in 2007 using his own car. A few months ago, his engine broke and his business stopped. Now that his family's financial situation is getting worse, he is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car. He is a hard-working and diligent man who says, "It has been hard since my car broke, I have to do everything I can to make this right."

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina is 50 years old and a married mother of 6 children.


Sosefina owns and operates a business venture baking and selling bread in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Sosefina needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Sosefina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sosefina's second loan with SPBD. 

About SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is 34 years-old and married with three children, aged between ten months and ten years. He runs an electrical appliance store in Calabatown, a western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. One of his children is currently attending school. He has three relatives he takes care of at home. 

He's been in this business for ten years and sells DVDs, televisions, extensions, switches, bulbs, padlocks and cables at his store. He began his business because he wanted to generate enough income to support his family, His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is damage to his electrical appliances.

He requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy more electrical appliances. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children. In the future, he would like to be a supplier of electrical goods that he can offer at a better price. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more DVDs, televisions, extension and cables.

loans.name: Security Group

texts.en:
Pily, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children. One of them goes to school. She has had a retail shop for four years now. She starts work at 6:00 a.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more stock of wheat flour, beans, and household items. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase her stock of shop items like sugar, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, salt, and juice. Her dream is to one day be able to own a boutique.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Security," which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase stocks of shop items like sugar, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, salt, and juice

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is married with 3 children. 

Gina has a coco lumber sales business and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to pay for a business permit to the municipal hall. 

Gina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to pay for a business permit

loans.name: Samha

texts.en:
Samha is a 41-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Samha is requesting a loan of 800 JD to finance her son's education expenses.

Due to cultural issues, Samha did not wish to be photographed. The man in the photo is Samha's son.

loans.use: to finance her son's education expenses.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 27 years old and is married with four children under the age of 12.  

She has operated quarry business for one year whereby she mines stones and sell to the constructors. With this loan Virginia plans to hire more workers and lease a new quarry site.  

Her dream is to own multiple mining areas and give employment opportunities to her community.

loans.use: to hire more workers and lease new places for mining.

loans.name: Yesica Guadalupe

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Yesica. I have a small store in my home. I sell breakfast meals and other sweets according to my clients likes. I’ve had this business for three years. I’ve had earnings that have allowed me to, little by little, build my home and give my children an education. Currently, I want to make a small room in the house larger, so I can put tables and chairs there, and offer my clients a place to eat my tasty meals.

Loan Use: Purchase tortillas, cheese, eggs, beans, butter, and others.

Hola me llamo Yesica, tengo un pequeño negocio en mi casa, vendo desayunos y otras golosinas segun el gusto de mis clientes, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este negocio, con el que he tenido ganancias y poco a poco contruir mi casa y darles una educacion a mis hijos. Actualmente estoy queriendo ampliar una pequeña pieza de mi casa para colocar algunas sillas y mesas para atender a mis clientes y personas que quieran degustar mi rica comida.

loans.use: Compra de tortillas, quesillo, huevos, frijoles, mantequilla y otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
To buy: rice, oil, vegetable, soda drinks, and kitchen utensils

para comprar: arroz, aceite, legumbres, gaseosas y utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah N. N. is married with six children; five of her children have completed their college educations, while one is still in college. An active member of St. Ruth Women's Group, Hannah is a farmer and grows beans, maize and vegetables. She sells her farm produce to local residents, a business that serves as her main source of income. Lately, Hannah has been experiencing problems with the water supply in her farm. She wishes to buy a water tank for storing rainwater for both farming and domestic use and thus has applied a loan of USD 300. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Hannah would like to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope Onwuchukwa is a dealer in rice and provisions. She needs additional capital to boost her business. She feels sure that with a loan of US$ 750 she will be able to increase her turnover and thus her profit.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan owns his home on Alberto Ostria Street, # 1568, in the Tembladerani district of La Paz. He lives there with his wife and three children. He drives his taxi every afternoon and also runs a body shop from his home. He would use the loan for car maintenance and also to buy spare parts. He has been an IMPRO client since 2004; he opened his business with a loan from us and has noticeably bettered his station in life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Juan vive en casa propia en la Calle Alberto Ostria Nº 1568 de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; vive con su esposa y tiene tres hijos, trabaja con su taxi todas las tardes y también tiene su taller de chaperia ( body shop) el cual esta ubicado en el mismo domicilio. El crédito que solicita es para la reparación de su movilidad y compra de algunos repuestos. Es cliente antiguo de Impro desde el año 2004 y con nosotros comenzó su taller y mejoro notablemente su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Falealuga

texts.en:
Falealuga is a 29-year-old mother of one child. She is on the first step of supporting her family, and she wants to begin with a very good start.

She just joined the program recently, and she will start with a Pancake and Ice Cake business. She will be selling her stuff at the school and also to the women during the Bingo game.

Her husband is a Bus Driver, and he earns about two hundred tala a week. Falealuga is looking at a way of developing her family and she wants to continue with loans from SPBD for the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, a fryer and plastic cups for her cake business

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a new member, and is very happy with the financial support SPBD has provided for her and the family.  She’s a twenty nine year old mother of five children and has already planned their future and is trying hard to work towards achieving it.  Three of her children are now in primary school and the other two are not.  Her husband is self employed in their business, and also has a part time job as a bus driver when he’s needed.  Eseta has experienced a big change in their family, seeing her children happy and healthy, and is capable of doing much better if she keeps her business going well.  With her requested loan, she aims to buy more taro tops to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Tutashinda_A Group

texts.en: Amina, age 22, is a single mother of 2 children (ages 4 and 1). She is a food vendor, and sells various types of food items at her shop. She began this business in 2006 and now works from 10am to 11pm each day. She hopes for a loan to expand her business and will share this loan with her subgroup member Mariam H., who is also a food vendor.

loans.use: To buy food items for their businesses

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
T. Faizullo is 60 years old. He and his wife have raised 6 children. Four of them left for Russia to look for work. 

Faizullo runs a farm on which he produces wheat, onions and barley. There is also a vineyard and nutwood as well as the plantation of dog rose. Two of his children help their father in his farm. In addition, Faizullo also has livestock including a horse and twenty sheep in his farm.

Today Faizullo requests 3 000.00 Somoni (875.00 US Dollars) to purchase the fodder to breed cattle. This is the second loan he is applying for, the first of which was paid on time. Faizullo promises to pay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase fodder for breeding cattle

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana P. sells personal items (hair accessories, necklaces, bracelets, wallets) in the La Terminal market in León (Nicaragua). She started her business 8 years ago with a capital of C$ 500 (five hundred córdobas net) that she had been saving since she was young.

Mrs. P. had economic difficulties obtaining the products that she sells in the market from the beginning since she had to use the little money she made to buy groceries for her family and to pay her two children's school. It's important to highlight that she is a single mother, but that has not stopped her from getting loans from Ceprodel. These loans have helped her to improve her economic situation and to keep her modest home. She has obtained 13 previous loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Ana P. es a la venta de cosméticos personales (colas, collares, pulseras, cartera) en el mercado la Terminal del departamento de León en Nicaragua. Su negocio lo inicia desde hace 8 años con un bajo capital de C$ 500 (Quinientos córdobas netos) obtenidos por sus ahorros propios desde su juventud.

Desde que inicio su negocio ha atravesado por difíciles circunstancias económicas para adquirir sus productos debido a que el poco dinero que gana lo invierte en la compra de los alimentos para su hogar y pago del colegio de sus dos hijos. Es necesario destacar que es madre soltera pero a pesar de esto, ha adquirido créditos en Ceprodel los cuales le han apoyado para mejorar su situación económica y continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar. Su record crediticio es de 13 créditos con la institución.

loans.use: Compra de los cosméticos personales

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina Gonzáles is a woman worthy of being a role model as every day she sells, as a street vendor, in the streets of Villanueva, her candy and snack products to her customers.

She is a person characterized as being very hard working and in addition in spite of her difficult economic situation in which she has found herself for quite some time, she continues trying to better her standard of living and that of her children. Ceprodel has been a pillar in the improvement of her business by providing loans that have enable her to invest in purchasing candy to sell. She has a history of four loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalina Gonzáles es una dama digna de imitar debido a que todos los días vende ambulantemente en las calles de Villanueva sus productos de golosinas y comestibles ofreciéndolos a sus clientes.

Es una persona que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y además a pesar de su difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo la ha rodeado, continua esforzándose para mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus hijos. Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en el mejoramiento de su negocio por medio de los créditos que le ha otorgado habiéndolos invertido en la compra de las golosinas para comercializarlas. Actualmente su record crediticio es de cuatro créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria carries out her activities each day more animated and with more optimism now that she is experiencing the fruits of her constant labor. She dedicates herself to the fattening and trade of cattle and takes advantage of the lands around the stable Everyday she wakes up very early to feed the bulls and cows and she has decided in agreement with her husband to better the breed of her animals by buying a purebred..

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria acude a realizar sus actividades cada día más animada y con mucho optimismo ya que está, observando los frutos de su constante esfuerzo. Ella se dedica al engorde y comercio de ganado vacuno y así aprovecha la dicha de poseer tierras de cultivo ya que estas posibilitan la continuidad de su establo.Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para alimentar a sus toros y vacas y ha decidido en común acuerdo con su esposo mejorar la raza de sus pequeños inquilinos comprando un ejemplar de pura raza.

loans.use: To purchase a purebred bull.

loans.name: Isatu K.

texts.en: Isatu is 37 years old and married with three children.  Her husband works as a driver and his income is insufficient to meet the family expenses. Isatu sells yogurt in a Kabala market to supplement her husband's income.  With her previous loans, she increased her yogurt stock by two barrels. The demand for yogurt is especially high during the school period.  Isatu is requesting a loan of Le.1,200,000 to increase her stock and generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase more yogurt for resale

loans.name: Khudoynazar

texts.en: Z. Khudoynazar is 30 years old. He is married with three children. Khudoynazar’s children are young now, but he is already working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. His wife is a housekeeper and she takes care of their kids. Khudoynazar is a farmer. He has worked the land for six years. The business is stable and the main source of income of Khudoynazar’s family. Khudoynazar is growing onion, wheat, cucumber, potato and other vegetables, working the fields from early morning till late night. Five years ago Khudoynazar started from growing onion on a 0.10 Hectare plot. Today he is growing onion and other vegetables on a 1.20 Hectare plot. Khudoynazar requests $1000 US Dollars for the term of 10 months to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, and to pay salaries for hired seasonal workers. Khudoynazar thanks everyone for trusting and supporting him today. He promises to pay the loan in a timely manner. Be an important part of the growth of Khudoynazar’s business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, and the salaries for the hired seasonal workers.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 29-year-old, married woman. She started her business of selling clothes in 2006. Ever since, she has worked on a daily basis from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm at her business. Consequently, she earns a monthly profit of approximately $50 from her sales.

Salma now requests a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rehema's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 36 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 11, 8, 6, and 1. She has been a charcoal, firewood, and soup seller since February 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 50 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, firewood sales, tailoring, painting, and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Pierrine

texts.fr: Pierrine  C., 40 ans, mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre des thioubs (tissus teintés) et des ensembles. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Pierrine C., age 40, is married and has six children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara for three and a half years. She wants this loan to buy and resell “thioub” (dyed cloth) and some outfits. Her income allows her to help with family expenses.The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell dyed cloth and outfits

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban N., 48, is married and lives about 124 miles from the capital of Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. Living in the Kampong Cham, she and her husband typically make US$5 each day. She says every day she and her husband walk their bicycle to purchase recycling items from house to house in the village and sell them to the recycling plant. This couple together has seven children, three of who are married and no longer stay at home. Three other children are employed and only one is still a student. Besides their recycling business they also grow rice to earn a living as well, but their farming is just to support their family members.

Ban N. would like to take out a loan through Kiva via CREDIT, a local partner, of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport the recycling items. This will be an easier and faster way to transport the products. The rest of the money will be used to purchase fertilizers for her farm. For her future plans, she wants her children to complete at least high school and if they need to continue, she will strongly support them, even though she knows that she will spend a lot, as she wants them to get better jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and fertilisers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase various goods to stock a small store.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok K., 36, is married and lives with her three children in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making around $3.30 each day, while her husband is a horse-cart driver. Her husband makes about $10 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also been a factor in making the price of rice very high. Mok K. is asking for a loan of $750 to purchase a good horse for her husband. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a horse

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through primary education. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mary sells meat, fish, and "gari" (a delicacy made out of cassava which is pictured in the photograph with Mary) at Seaview near Elmina, which she has done since 2004. By doing so, Mary supports her husband in paying utility bills and other basic living expenses of the family. Mary is now requesting a loan to purchase more meat and fish so that she can satisfy her customers' increasing demands. With the expected profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land in order to build a house for their family.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional meat and fish

loans.name: Martha Aryera

texts.es: La señora Martha Aryera U. Tercero tiene la edad de 28 años,  habita en el barrio los Venegas ubicado en carretera hacia Masaya, junto a su esposo y hijos, el esposo trabaja para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar. Ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijas las cuales tiene cuatro y dos años de edad, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella trabaja como comerciante desde hace dos años, con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado crecer el inventario de su negocio en la venta de cosméticos que vende al contado como al crédito, esta es su segunda solicitud en Afodenic y ha sido de muchos beneficios en lo personal como en su negocio, ya que ha incrementado su inventario, con esta solicitud espera comprar cosméticos como muchos perfumenes y aprovechar la temporada de la amistad que se obsequian muchos regalos, espera poder obtener buenas ganancias y en un futuro proyectarse a tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Martha Aryera U. Tercero is 28 years old and she lives in the neighborhood of Venegas, which is loacted on the highway to Masaya. She lives with her husband and kids. Her husband works to support her with the household costs. They have two daughters to support, and they are four and two years old. Their plan for the future is to improve their families' living conditions. She has worked as a storekeeper for two years, and through her own efforts she has managed to create an inventory for her business selling cosmetics which she sells them on credit to her clients. This is her second loan application through Afodenic. It has helped her personally, as well as with her business as she has increased her inventory. With this application she hopes to buy cosmetics like perfumes and to use Valentine's Day to sell a lot of gifts. She hopes to be able to obtain good earnings and, in the future, have a store in her house.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and perfumes to increase her inventory/Comprar cosmeticos y perfumes para incrementar su inventario

loans.name: Yèrèdon Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf  femmes du  groupe Yèrèdon sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogamiques à l’exception d’une seule. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans,  3 enfants et vivent toutes  dans le quartier Bozo kin de Sansanding (4ème région administrative du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et dans la foire de Macina où elles se ravitaillent toutes en poisson.
Afin d’accroître leur fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande  de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, elle ont décidé de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire.
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter,  10 paniers de tomate fraîche, 1,5 tonne d’oignon frais, 5 bassines de poivron et de piment frais, 600kg de poisson fumé et de sardines séchées. Elles se ravitaillent une fois par semaine à la foire de Sansanding en légumes. Quant aux poissons à Macina. Les poissons sont revendus dans les foires de Siribala, Dougabougou et sur place à Sansanding ; les autres condiments sont écoulés à domicile et dans le marché de Sansanding au comptant à crédit et en détail à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 33.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
NB : Bana T. est absente sur la photo. Elle a accouché à la veille du financement d’où la présence de 8 femmes au lieu de 9.
texts.en:
The nine women of the Yèrèdon group are all married and live in monogamous families, except for one. They have an average age of 35 and on average, 3 children; they all live in the Bozo Kin neighborhood of Sansanding (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They met because of bonds of marriage, of being neighbors, and at the market of Macina where they all go to buy their fish.

So as to grow their working capital and satisfy the ever-growing demand of their clientele, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their 3 group loan.

This loan will be used to buy 10 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 1.5 tons of fresh onions, 5 basins of green peppers and fresh hot peppers, 600 kg of smoked fish and dried sardines. They do their buying once a week at the fair of Sansanding as far as vegetables go. As for the fish: in Macina. The fish are re-sold in the fairs of Siribala, Dougabougou, and right there in Sansanding; the other condiments are sold at home and in the market of Sansanding for cash or credit and retail to a clientele essentially composed of women.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 33,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for family expenses.

NB : Bana T. is absent from the photo. She gave birth the day before the photo was taken, so there are 8 women instead of 9.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments and fish

loans.name: Dumba's Group

texts.en:
N. Dumba is the leader of the Bwavumpologoma group in Ntenjeru. She is a strong business lady who sells produce of all kinds from the villages to people in the town centers, where the prices are favorable. She buys the produce from the farmers in the villages that barely have any means to transport their produce to the market as well as growing some of them herself, though what she has is never enough compared to what she needs for a single sale.

Whenever N. has a loan, even after having accumulated savings, she is then able to buy in bulk. At times she buys from a plantation and then gets the food slowly, depending on her market, since the foods she deals in are all perishables. She has been able to buy herself a motorcycle, has cows and goats at home and she would like another loan to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for sale

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфузе 29 лет, она не замужем. Торгует мелкими игрушками и материалами. Сейчас она торгует тапочками. Ее  родители раньше торговали вместо нее. Сейчас она сама научилась продавать , поэтому родители передали  свой бизнес. Она закончила 10 классов средней школы. Поступать в университет не решилась так как надо иметь большие деньги на поступление и за обучение. В Микроинвест обратилась что бы увеличить свой капитал и расширить ассортимент.
texts.en:
Dilfuza is 29 years old, she is not married. She sells small toys and other products. Right now she sells slippers. Previously her parents sold products with her. Now she has learned how to sell products on her own and her parents passed on their business to her. Dilfuza finished 10 school grades. She decided not to attend university because that would require a lot of money for admission and tuition. She has turned to MicroInvest to increase her capital and increase her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and product assortment

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: one son and four daughters. She says some of her children have completed school and are working. Others are still in the junior high school and the primary school.

Comfort lives with her children and husband in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband works at a sawmill company in their community. She is a trader. She trades in second-hand textiles – clothes for both sexes and also bed sheets.

She procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. Comfort says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for seven years and desires to expand her business. She is hoping to improve her standard of living and sponsor her children to higher levels of academia.

loans.use: To procure second-hand textiles

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: "It is so hard to work on the farm, especially if you don't have capital to make it grow. I have been a farmer for a long time already. I started as a tenant, just tilling the land of other people," says Mr. Warlito G., 32-year-old father of four children. "I need assistance in my business to properly manage my farm and provide for the needs of my family." Now, Warlito is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase ammonium nitrate fertilizer and seed. The loan will help him grow his business even more. In that way, he will have better income and be able to support his family well. CEVI gives their clients not just loans, it gives training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase ammonium nitrate fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús R. H. de 48 años de edad reside en La Libertad junto a sus dos hijas. Ella posee desde hace 14 años su negocio de comida y tortillas, el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. Teresa Solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar un microondas para su negocio, así también comprar granos básicos para la elaboración de los alimentos. Teresa espera mejorar las ventas y así mejorar las ganancias, con lo cual mejorara la situación económica a la que se enfrenta.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús R. H. is 48 years old and lives in La Libertad with her two daughters. For 14 years she has had her business selling food and tortillas, which is her only source of income for supporting her family. Teresa is requesting a loan for the purpose of buying a microwave for her business. She will also buy basic grains for making her foods. Teresa hopes to improve her sales and thereby her earnings, with which she will improve the economic situation she confronts.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de un microondas y granos básicos

loans.name: Muhamadayub

texts.en:
Muhamadayub K. is 36. He is married with 3 children. Muhamadayub says he comes from a humble family and, from a very young age, he helped his father in the fields, which is why he never finished his studies. Despite that, he feels fortunate to be with his wife, who helps him sell with their farming business. Muhamadayub cultivates tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and watermelons. He comments that he is very thankful for what he has and, thanks to the dedication and support from his family, he can have a dignified life and give a better life to his children. At this time, he is applying for a loan in order to buy more seeds and fertilizer which will help him cultivate more vegetables. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: God Is Good Group

texts.en: Yatta is a mother of 3 children and additional 2 extended family members. She sells retail goods (flour, oil, sugar, etc) within the Moulton corner, Browerville Community, especially at her house. She encourages her customers with smiles,  and dreams of seeing her business grow gradually. She says she is really interested in bringing all of her children up for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, oil, etc. for resale

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
C. Mukaram is divorced and has three children. After her husband left the family, Mukaram was forced to find ways to provide for her family. She did some market research and decided to take a risk and borrow some money to start a business selling warm clothing. She rented a large shipping container at the local city market and purchased coats, jackets and other winter clothing to offer for sale.

Mukaram has now been in business for 9 years, working hard to meet the needs of her customers. She always makes her buyers feel welcome as she gives each one her full attention and serves them politely and with respect. Her reasonable prices and variety of inventory appeal to many modest clients.

Mukaram has promptly repaid all 6 loans she has received from IMON International. She understands the value of lending services that have helped her business grow and become self-sustainable. Mukaram is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to increase her retail inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing that will be both durable and practical for a variety of customers. Having an assortment of inventory at exceptional prices will meet customer demand and draw many potential new clients to her business. In the future Mukaram would like to purchase another container and hire a person to help her with sales allowing her to generate additional profits to help finance her children’s education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will

loans.use: To buy new clothing for teenagers

loans.name: Tauese

texts.en: Tauese P. (0) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Faleseela. She is married and has seven adult children. Tauese owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 750 WST a month. Tauese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Tauese is now requesting a new loan of 2,750 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou F. es une femme mariée, mère de 5 enfants. Elle vend de l’arachide et en même temps du jus de fruit. Les revenus générés lui permettent de participer en partie aux charges de la famille
texts.en:
Aïssatou F. is a married woman and the mother of five children. She sells peanuts and, at the same time, fruit juices. The income generated enables her to cover part of the family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For selling peanuts and juices

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene vive en la avenida Francisco Areas Valencia de la zona  Mariscal Sucre en la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa la cual trabaja con como ayudante en la misma movilidad, y su pequeña hija. 

El trabaja como chofer propietario de servicio publico en su minibus en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará para la reparación del motor,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Costo de reparación del motor de su minibus.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.en:
Gilma T. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Gilma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Gilma owns & operates a business selling dried fish in the local community. Gilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Gilma is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
She is a young mother of four children, two boys and two girls between 1 and 12 years old, who is determined to improve their lives. Her name is Mary Joy P.. She is 32 years old and married to Lino P., who helps her run their native delicacies business. They live in the village of Tabao Rizal, San Enrique, Negros Occidental.

To achieve her dreams, she and her husband make and sell native Ilonggo rice and coconut-based sweets like “Bayi-bayi” and “ Kalamayhati” in their community and other neighboring towns. Mary Joy helps her husband pack and deliver the finished products to their regular customers. They also deliver in large quantities to several retailers located at the pier on a consignment basis.

A normal day in the P. household starts before dawn with the production of the Bayi-bayi and Kalamayhati, which are both made of rice flour, brown sugar and coconut milk. By 6:00 AM all of the sweets are individually wrapped and ready to be delivered.  After making the deliveries, they buy new ingredients and set up everything for the following day's routine.

Mary Joy is quite happy that many people find their sweets delicious and they now have many regular and loyal customers. She is able to supply all of the volume demanded of her product. But this was not the case in 2003 when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her product was becoming more popular each day but she realized that her capital was just not enough to buy all of the ingredients to make their delicacies. After she became a PD member, she was able to expand her business with each succeeding loan, which also increased in value as she proved her good credit record. Now her rolling capital allows her to earn at least PHP 20,000 income per month, which is a big help towards gradually achieving her dreams for her family.

She previously borrowed PHP 27,000 as additional working capital for her food vending business. She paid her all her weekly installments and fully paid her accounts in her specified loan term. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan the PHP 19,500 to purchase additional ingredients and working capital. The income from it will be used to improve and expand her business.

In the accompanying picture, Mary Joy is posing with a big batch of newly made "bayi-bayi" that has not yet been formed into tiny cakes and individually wrapped.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and as working capital

loans.name: Irma Ruth

texts.es: La señora se dedica a la venta D. comida  y bebidas, que ya lleva mas D. ocho años D. experiencia en su negocio, venD. comida D. toda variedad y sabor, que ya es conocida por la exquisites D. sus platos. La señora vive en casa D. sus suegros con su esposo y sus hijos el cual le ayudan a vender comida. el destino del credito es para poder comprar mas sillas y mesas para su puesto.
texts.en:
Irma Ruth has been selling food and beverages for more than eight years. She is known for offering a variety of exquisite and flavorful dishes. She lives in the home of her in-laws with her husband and children, who help with her business. Irma is requesting a loan to buy more tables and chairs for her diner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs for her business

loans.name: Shah Jan Group

texts.en:
Shah Jan is the group leader of Mary Jan Sediqa group. There are three members in this group. Shah Jan is a married woman with five children, three sons and two daughters. All her daughters are married and the sons are at school. Shah Jan wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new sewing machine for her business. 

Mary Jan wants to take a loan for her husband’s metal shop business. He wants to expand his business. 

Reza Gull wants to take a loan for her business which is the designing of chadari,  a kind of head cover for women in Afghanistan. She wants to increase the number of clients for her business. 
The women have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani. They say that this loan will be very useful because they will provide a chance for poor people in this country.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Ines Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Inés es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 22 años de edad, es casada, tiene 01 hijo que viven con ella. Estudió secundaria completa. 
Inés trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de productos regionales los cuales lleva a Arequipa a vender.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invirtió en la compra de queso y pan.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar mas mercadería, productos de la región (papa, chuño) y luego los venderá en Arequipa.
Su visión a futuro es, comprarse un trailer.
Lo que mas le gusta de su banco comunal son las charlas y conversar con las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Inés is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” (The Breezes of Río Blanco), which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province. She is 22 years old, married, and has one dependent child. Inés has a high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years. Inés buys regional products and travels to Arequipa to sell them. She says her first loan was in the amount of 500 soles and was used to buy cheese and bread.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy more merchandise, such as potatoes and chuño, to sell in Arequipa. In the future, she would like to buy a trailer. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the seminars and the discussions among the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes & chuño

loans.name: Katebo Basooka Kwavula Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
N. Annet is a determined lady. She is married with five children ranging in age from nine to 19 years old.  She takes care of seven dependents in Katebo. 

Annet is a farmer with seven years experience who, at the moment, is able to make 180,000 UGX as a profit per month. 

She is a hardworking lady and is happy that she has a ready market for her produce, hence is full of confidence in what she does. She works hard so that she can buy a truck to ease her own transportation needs, as well as to help educate her children to the highest level. 

She needs a loan to be able to diversify her farming activities and rear more animals. She will also buy more seedlings and animals for expansion.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings and animals like pigs and goats for farm expansion

loans.name: Carmelyn

texts.en:
Carmelyn L., age 27, grows rice and sells her harvest to earn additional income for her family. She has two children, ages 7 and 2. She uses the proceeds from her harvest to buy food and necessities for her famly. The farm is very important to her, especially because it is the only source of income for her family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy the farm supplies that she needs to grow her rice well. The loan will help, not just to improve her harvest, but to increase her family income as well.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Siempre Amigas” esta representado por la señora María del Carmen y conformada por 15 socios que van ingresando a un ciclo mas demostrando puntualidad y ganas D. trabajar para sacar a delante a sus familias y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación. Todos los miembros del grupo tienen sus propios negocios como la venta D. comida, ropa, cosméticos, pan, ferretería, venta D. zapatos, servicio D. limpieza, confección D. prendas D. vestir, abarrotes, pollo y al servicio profesional D. Psicología. Dentro del ámbito comercial la competencia es alta pero con su entusiasmo y experiencia las socias saben como salir adelante para mejorar sus ingresos e incrementar su capital D. trabajo. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. mercadería como ropa, zapatos y material D. ferretería, el resto D. los socios incrementara sus materias primas y el resto utilizará los fondos para herramientas D. trabajo. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya trabajaron con la institución demostrando capacidad para la administración D. los fondos otorgados y las ganas D. sacar adelante a sus familias con esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “Siempre Amigas” (Always Friends) is represented by Mrs. Maria del Carmen, and is composed of 15 members who are getting in to another loan cycle, having demonstrated punctuality and the will to work to help their families get ahead and give a better education to their children. All the members of this group have their own businesses, like selling food, clothing, cosmetics, bread, ironwork, and shoes, cleaning services, sewing clothing, groceries, chicken, and professional psychology services.

There is a high level of competition in these areas, but with their enthusiasm and experience these members know how to get ahead to increase their incomes and their working capital. The purpose of this loan is to increase their merchandise like clothing, shoes, and ironworking materials; the rest of the members will use the funds for the tools they need to work.

In regards to their experience with credit, they have already worked with this institution, demonstrating their capacity to administer funds and the will to help their families get ahead through effort and work.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.en:
J. Nurjamal is the leader of this group. Nurjamal works as an electrician. Her monthly salary is about 95 dollars. She realized that her salary would never be enough to provide her daughter with a quality education and happy childhood, and she started looking for extra sources of income. Besides, for the last several years she has been divorced. Finally, she entered the multilevel marketing company Oriflame, as a saleswoman. Due to having an open and amiable personality and communication skills, Nurjamal quickly attracted customers and reached a monthly salary of 230 dollars. Later, she entered another company, selling its products by means of multilevel marketing, and she now receives 25% from the sales. Thus, she has accomplished her aim of additional earnings, enabling her daughter to go to a good high school and get a good education. She has also been able to make a repair to her flat and even go to a resort for two weeks of rest last year. Nurjamal has applied for this loan as she needs funds to buy kitchen furniture.

Nurjamal’s partners:

K. Aizada, age 30, is married. She is raising one daughter. Aizada's husband works as an operator at a gas station, while Aizada stays home and looks after cattle. Aizada has applied for this loan to purchase cattle and send them to pasture.

A. Zarema, age 39, has one son. Her husband is a builder. Zarema works as a leading specialist in the Migration and Employment Service of the Kyrgyz Republic. She has applied for this loan to install some furniture at home. Zarema’s dream is to send her son to study abroad.

M. Mairamkul, age 47, is the mother of two children. Her husband works as a driver for a gold mining company. Mairamkul works as a school teacher. She teaches chemistry. Mairamkul hopes to obtain this loan in order to make some repairs at home. Her children have grown up, and Mairamkul hopes to help them find good jobs and get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.zstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy kitchen furniture for home use

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca is 41 years old and lives with her husband and youngest son.  Her other two children are grown up and live on their own.  Blanca learned her trade on her own, and as her neighborhood did not have a corner store to supply the community with basic items she decided to open one.  Currently, Blanca's corner store is one of the best stocked and attracts many clients due to it's central location and proximity to a popular spa.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar, noodles, flower, meat, oil and other products for her store.
texts.en:
Blanca is 41 years old and lives with her husband and youngest son. Her other two children are grown up and live on their own. Blanca learned her trade on her own, and as her neighborhood did not have a corner store to supply the community with basic items she decided to open one. Currently, Blanca's corner store is one of the best stocked and attracts many clients due to it's central location and proximity to a popular spa. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, noodles, flower, meat, oil and other products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, noodels, flower, meat, oil

loans.name: Leak

texts.en: Miss. Leak L. (shown in the photo), 23, is single, lives with her parents and brothers and sisters in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Leak has been a silk weaver for eight years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Leak is requesting her first loan in the amount of $900 to purchase silk material for her weaving business. She also will use a part of her loan to help her father to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed for his farm.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and help her father to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed for his farm.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Mrs. Samnang M., who is 26 years old, is a villager in Kdei Tnaot village in the Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vet Sam, is a laborer in the local village. However hard they try to work, they cannot earn enough income. Thus, in order to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Samnang M. decided to request a loan to buy a pig and a cow for breeding. She is the mother of a child who is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a mother pig, and a cow for breeding

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en: Nonita G. is from the village of Tagibo, Iligan City. She is 41 years old. Nonita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nonita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nonita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Nonita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nonita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nonita from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa I. sells provisions at Abura. Hawa has received a senior high education. She is divorced and stays with her three children. Her loan will be used to buy extra provisions to fill her shop. She is responsible for paying utility bills and accommodations. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to complete her house.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions to fill her shop.

loans.name: Ricchariy Llaqta Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Ricchariy Llaqta” se reúnen cada treinta días en la casa del socio Gregorio en la comunidad D. Choquecancha del distrito D. Lares D. la provincia D. calca. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 4 y está conformado por  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La palabra quechua “Ricchariy Llaqta” que traducido al castellano significa “Pueblo Despierta”.   
	
Julia, tiene 37 años, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad D. Choquecancha. 

Julia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Ricchariy Llaqta”  somos 10  integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi actividad económica. Julia venD. artesanía en la comunidad D. Choquecancha y requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana,  anilina e hilos. 
 
Sus principales  actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios son;  venta D.  comida, venta D. artesanía y otros socios brindan servicios como albañiles. Su actividad económica complementaria es la ganadería y la agricultura, ellos venden sus productos en las ferias D. la ciudades D. Calca, Lares y por el valle. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank “Ricchariy Llaqta” get together every month in the the house of one of their members, Gregorio, located in the Choquecancha community in the Lares district of the Calca department. The community bank is currently in its fourth cycle and is maD. up of hard working and enterprising people who look for opportunities to get ahead in every moment, and to give their children a better future with their daily efforts. The quecha word “Ricchariy Llaqta” means "Awakened People". Julia is 37 years old, has two children and lives in the Choquecancha community. She was chosen out of the 10 members of her community bank “Ricchariy Llaqta” to give an account of her business. Julia sells handicrafts in Choquecancha and needs a loan to purchase materials such as wool, aniline and thread. The bank's members mainly work selling food and handicrafts and bricklaying. Others work with livestock or in agriculture, and sell their products in fairs in the valley and in the cities of Calca and Lares. The members are very grateful for the valuable loan granted to them by Kiva and pledge to re-pay their installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool, aniline and thread

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Noemi, ella tiene 22 años la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 2 añitos; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura y la ganadería, la socia también se dedica a criar animales menores (cuyes, conejos y aves de corral, gallinas, pollos). Nuestra socia también se dedica a la artesanía, ella teje a mano brazaletes y aquí está tejiendo precisamente uno de estas pulseras hechas de lana. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mayor número de animales menores y una pequeña vaquita. 

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Noemi belongs to the Colquecancha communal bank; she lives in the Raqchi community in Urubamba province, Cusco. She is 22 years old, lives with her partner and has a little one only 2 years old. She alternates her housework with agriculture and cattle farming. She also raises smaller animals (guinea pigs, rabbits, and fowl: hens and chickens). She also does handicrafts: she weaves bracelets by hand, and in the above picture she is intricately weaving a bracelet of wool. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of more small animals and a small calf. Noemi thanks everyone who is making her dream possible and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small animals and a calf

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 44 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de  su esposo Florentino (55) y a sus 3 hijos de los 5 que tiene, pues sus hijos mayores trabajan y viven independientes.Se dedica al cultivo de papa, de diferentes variedades, pues en el lugar donde vive por la altura, sólo produce tubérculos, que cuida con esmero, por eso es considerada una de las mejores productoras de este producto, y  asegura que  su cosecha es exitosa, porque siempre labora junto a su esposo. Además  cría animales como carneros, vacas, caballos y cerdos, que vende cuando necesita salir de algún apuro económico, y  lo que más le gusta de la chacra es cosechar con esmero y cuidar de sus animales, mientras comen a lo largo de los verdes pastizales. Además considera que su oficio es muy  rentable, y para el futuro, quiere seguir sembrando, pero en mayor cantidad para lograr  disfrutar de mejores ganancias.Esta es la cuarta vez, que tiene un préstamo con MFP y le gusta laborar en su banco comunal, porque ya conoce la metodología de su  trabajo y lo que más le gusta es participar de las charlas educativas en las que aprende bastante.Gloria tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono que necesita para proteger sus cultivos de papa de las constantes amenazas, como las plagas, que muchas veces echan a perder sus producciones.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Florentio (age 55) and three of their five children. The older children work and live independently. Gloria grows potatoes of different varieties since the place where she is lives is located in high altitude. She only produces tubers and provides them great care, which is why she is considered one of the best producers of this product. To ensure that her harvest is successful, she always works together with her husband. Gloria also raises animals such as sheep, cows, horses, and pigs and sells them as needed based on her financial needs. What she enjoys most is raising her crops and taking care of her animals by allowing them to feed on green pastures. She considers her work to be very profitable and wants to continue farming in the future, but in larger quantities so that she can enjoy greater income.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her Communal Bank because she is familiar with its work methodology and likes participating in the educational seminars. Gloria plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of several sacks of compost that are needed to protect her potato crops from constant threats, such as pests, that can ruin her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: Queennie Anne

texts.en:
Queennie Anne L. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 20 years old. Queennie Anne is single and has 2 young children. To make a living, Queennie Anne runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Queennie Anne has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Queennie Anne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Queennie Anne is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Queennie Anne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiri 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Tiessiri 2 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Tiendo, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont ’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le gombo. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MARIA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
La production  est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA environ en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Tiessiri 2 are married women who average 38 years of age and five children.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in Tiendo, a village in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of winter.  The crops are peanuts, pearl millet, corn, and okra.  The group members are on their third farm loan, and the preceding loans have been repaid. With this new loan, MARIA D. intends to buy supplies (before prices rise) and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of labor for maintaining one hectare of peanuts.  After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of women and men in the cities of Dioïla and Fana. The group members plan on making an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA, approximately, at the end of the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for supplies, equipment, and manual labor

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace M. is a 28-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a tricycle (a motorcycle with a passenger side-car attachment) and by vending fish. She lives in Sitio Bool, Cartagena, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental.  Mary Grace has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

Mary Grace uses the tricycle in her fish vending business to reach more customers, but on days when she stays in town, her husband drives the tricycle and transports passengers around town for a fee.  By maximizing her assets and working hard in her business activities, Mary Grace is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9000. 

Mary Grace is now borrowing PHP 29500 so she can replace the side car of her tricycle.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mary Grace aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

-------------------------------------------------------
About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of new sidecar of motorcycle

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es: El señor Norlan José tiene 32 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. El señor tiene un negocio de carpintería y artesanía. El es una persona muy responsable, Norlan se levanta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. El señor ya tiene 3 años de tener este negocio. Por lo que inicio con esfuerzos propios, resulto muy difícil  ya que tiene ciertos problemas de salud  ya que su mismo trabajo de la carpintería le provoca alergia, pero debido a su misma necesidad ha salido adelante. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertirle más a su negocio y de esta manera obtener más ganancias. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
32-year old Sr. Norlan José is married and has two children. He has run a carpentry and craft business for three years. He is a very responsible person getting up at 7 in the morning and working until 6 at night. He set up his business through his own hard work, but it has been very difficult because he has a health problem caused by allergies from working with wood. However, he has had to overcome them in order to carry on working. Norlan is seeking a loan so he can invest in his business and earn more money. His dream has always been to build a house of his own.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Paul Kituli

texts.en:
Paul Kituli is a 45-year-old restaurant proprietor in Maweni, Mombasa. He is married to Monica Mwenda, who supports him in their business, and they are blessed with four children.

Paul is requesting his second loan from KADET to purchase additional foodstuffs for his restaurant. He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his restaurant.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business and be able to satisfactorily support his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs for his restaurant

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe JIGUISSEME sont mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers  en générale, tel la vente de légumes  avec  MARIAM S., la  vente de pagnes, de  poisson fumé etc.
MARIAM S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  une quantité importante de légumes de différentes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne essentiellement  dans les villages voisins, auprès des producteurs et effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA  qui  sera utilisé  dans les dépenses quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en: The six women of the JIGUISSEME group are married and are, on average, 33 years old with 3 children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).  They have had eight loans with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and all preceding loans have been repaid.  This group of women is active in the retail commerce of various items, such as the  vegetables sold by MARIAM S., pagnes (a colorful West African cloth), smoked fish etc.  MARIAM S. plans to buy a considerable quantity of different types of vegetables with her loan. She gets her stock primarily from producers in neighboring villages and sells them for retail prices, on credit or in cash, to a clientele composed of women and men.  She hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA which will be used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Eziyya

texts.en:
