Eziyya is a 65-year-old woman from Jenin. Her husband owns a blacksmith workshop.  The 15-year-old workshop is the family's source of income. The workshop produces windows, doors, water tanks, etc.

Eziyya came to FATEN and took a $2,000 loan so that her husband could purchase a new lathing machine to replace the old one and increase the productivity of the workshop. 

Eziyya appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase a lathing machine

loans.name: Jackline Chelangat

texts.en:
Jackline Chelangat M. is 32-years-old. She is a married and a mother of four children between the ages of three and 15. She is a business lady who sells cloths and shoes on a busy street in Silibwet town on the outskirts of Narok. She has been running this business for the last two years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her first loan. She is planning to increase her stock by buying more clothes, as there will be great demand because of the upcoming Christmas season. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to rent a permanent shop where she can sell her clothes and shoes. She plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. 

Her future dream is that she will be able to build her own house and run the shop from her own premises. Jackline believes she is hard working, and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Aisha has a business selling charcoal, which she has been doing for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal and for another business.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Aisha hopes to own a plot of land.

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and for another business

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Y P. is a 52-year-old single mother who currently lives in the Dangkor District of Phnom Penh in Cambodia. Her husband died of senility years ago. She is the mother of four children. Two of her children are married, and the other two are single. She has a life partner who works in different jobs, and they have a regular salary per month.
Y P. is a housewife. She always works on daily activities such as caring for her children, making food, cleaning her house, and managing other property in her house. Besides working at home, Y P. buys animals from villagers, fattens them for a while, and then sells them for a profit. Since the animal-selling business is the main source of income for the family, Y P. has requested a loan as capital to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.use: To buy an extra cow to sell

loans.name: Magnita

texts.es:
Magnita tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el sector Nuevo Mocce, uno de los barrios que conforman la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona bastante comercial ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de verduras en un puesto de venta ubicado en el interior del mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque. Ella adquiere su mercadería en el mercado de la ciudad de Moshoqueque y la ofrece diariamente al público en general que llega a ese centro de abastos. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la calidad de verduras que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda.

Magnita desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda que actualmente posee, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Magnita, 26, is single living with her family in the Nuevo Mocce sector, one of the neighborhoods that make up the city of Lambayeque, quite a commercial zone located over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last three years she has had a vegetable stand inside Lambayeque’s market.  She gets her merchandise at the market in the city of Moshoqueque and sells daily to the general public that comes by this foodstuffs market.  The business is well received because of the quality of the vegetables she offers and the good customer service she provides.

Magnita wants to acquire more merchandise to expand the business and meet current customer demand.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El señor Lucio Z. Calderón es de Jejui - Choré, con casa propia,  esta casado con la señora Narcisa Melgarejo Rivarola. 
 
       Es propietario de una despensa con 5  años de funcionamiento, que es atendida por su señora, también habilito sección de carnicería, el señor tiene una motocicleta en el cual realiza ventas de artículos de medicamentos, tiene clientela formada, es un señor muy trabajador y muy responsable.
                  Gracias a los créditos que el cliente recibió de la Fundación, su negocio esta creciendo cada día más y esta muy agradecido por los beneficios obtenidos.
Solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderias varias para su negocio especiamente bebidas y carne.
texts.en: Mr Lucio Z. Calderón is from Jejui - Choré. He has his own home and is married to Mrs Narcisa Melgarejo Rivarola. He owns a food store that has been operating for 5 years and is attended by his wife. He also has a butcher's shop. He has a motorcycle with which he sells medicinal items. He has a customer base. He is a very hard-working and responsible man. Thanks to the loans that he has received from the Fundacion, his business is growing more every day and he is very grateful for the benefits that he receives. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of various merchandise for his business, especially drinks and meat.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise, especially drinks, meat and others

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.en:
Nurjamal J. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).  She is 37 and married to a construction worker. She has two sons and a daughter. The first son and the daughter attend school and the second son is preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Nurjamal breeds livestock and sells milk. In this way she earns 2,800 KGS per month. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase coal for heating during the winter season. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase coal

loans.name: Djiguisseme  (L’Espoir) [Hope] Group

texts.fr:
Djiguisseme  est un regroupement de femmes du premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne  40 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les légumes, les condiments, des poissons fumés et séchés, la restauration, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Sineni D. est un membre du groupe qui fait de la restauration et la vente de légumes. Elle prépare du riz, des pâtes alimentaires et de la viande dans un restaurant aménager non loin de son domicile matin et soir. Les ingrédients sont achetés au grand marché de Koutiala et Sineni est très sollicitée. Quand aux légumes, ils sont achetés à Koutiala  et environs et revendus à Bamako au fur et à mesure que la quantité achetée s’épuise. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Sineni D.  compte réaliser 190 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
“Djiguisseme [hope]” is the name of a group of women from the first district of Koutiala, all of whom live in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and other family members. They are on the average 40 years old;  all are married,  with at least six children each. The group members sell various items, such as vegetables, condiments, smoked and dried fish, cooked dishes, etc.

In order to expand their business, three years ago the group members decided to participate in the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth group loan, and all prior loans have been duly repaid.

Sineni D.,  one of the  group members, cooks food for sale and also sells vegetables.  She cooks rice, pasta and meat in a diner near her home, mornings and evenings. She buys her ingredients at the big market of Koutiala, and her business is very popular. As to the vegetables, they are bought in Koutiala and in nearby areas and resold in Bamako little by little, until the stock is exhausted. While other members of this group plan to achieve a monthly income of 160,000 West African Francs after this loan, Sineni D. plans to earn 190,000. Apart from repaying the loan, the group members will use part of their revenues towards everyday family expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 56 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dionisia de 56 años y su querido hijo Edgar de 8 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con muchas ganas de trabajar Manuel sale todos los días a cultivar sus tierras, él tiene  principalmente sembríos de papa, arveja y maíz, productos que son rápidamente comprados en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, debido a la buena calidad que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 31 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigarlas, para evitar que la plaga de insectos dañe sus plantaciones, además por que es malo para la salud.  En adelante, espera que su producción mejore, ya que de eso dependen sus ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que produzcan más.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 56, is a friendly hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home with his wife Dionisia (age 56) and beloved son Edgar (age 8) for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. With great enthusiasm for his work, Manuel goes out every day to cultivate his fields. He grow mainly potatoes, peas, and corn, products that sell quickly at the market in the city of Tarma. His crops are of high quality. What he enjoys most about his work is cultivating the land. Manuel has been farming for 31 years and considers the most difficult part to be fumigation in order to prevent insects from damaging his plants. The chemicals can be bad for his health. Going forward, Manuel hopes to improve his production since he must rely on it for his income.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Manuel is very happy to obtain these funds and willing to submit all of his payments on time. He is well-liked in his Communal Bank. The loan of 1300 PEN that he requested will be used to buy more compost for his fields since he wants to produce more.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta A. is from the town of Guibang, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 53 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Greta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling different vegetables in the local community. Greta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Greta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Greta has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Greta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Greta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Amalia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Amalia tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Viven en el distrito de Patapo, una zona urbana cerca de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque.  Gana su vida dirigiendo una tienda donde vende abarrotes, golosinas, helados, bebidas y comidas rápidas.  Cuenta con más de un año de experiencia en este rubro.  Su tienda está ubicada en una zona estratégica en frente del parque de Patapo y, por eso, tiene una clientela constante.

Brinda productos y comidas que son muy requeridas por sus clientes. Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que con el transcurrir del tiempo, la demanda se ha aumentado ostensiblemente. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Esta inversión le permitirá a la postre incrementar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Amalia is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children.  They live in Patapo district: an urban area near Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Amalia earns her living running a store where she sells groceries, candies, iced treats, drinks and fast food.  She has more than one year's experience in this field.  Her store is located in a strategic area opposite Patapo Park.  This means that she constantly has customers.

Amalia provides products and food that are very much in demand with her customers.  She would like to increase her working capital since, over time, demand has risen ostensibly.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This investment will allow her to increase her profits and thereby improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria Rosa M. B. tiene 28 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los  hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener huertos de mora de excelente calida.

Le gusta caminar con la familia por la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Rosa M. B. is 28 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN' community bank is located in Guanto Cruz community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton.  The 22 members of this group work in agriculture, growing blackberries and corn.  They also raise farmyard animals and dairy cows for making cheese.

Maria is a farmer who grows blackberries and corn.  She also raises farmyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her produce in Guaranda market.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to have top-quality blackberry orchards.

Maria likes walking with her family around her community.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for her animals

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van T. T. L. is 30 years old. She lives with her family in Dai Bi village, where business activity is well developed. Seeing that a breakfast service would be successful, Ms. Van decided to open a small restaurant in which she serves fast food such as noodles, bread, and a few kinds of cake. Her restaurant attracts the most residents in the village and provides her with a profit of 120,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). The income helps her pay for her family's daily spending.

Ms Van became a client of SEDA (Small Enterprise Development Assistance) in 2004 and has used loans effectively in expanding her business. She is requesting a new loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese dongs (VND) in this loan cycL. to buy more sets of tables and chairs to create more seating for customers.

loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs for restaurant

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey V., 41, is widowed and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. V. is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of about 4.33 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 46 USD on food and 12 USD on the other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase corn to grow for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase corn to grow for sale

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Asunta; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de papa y menestras como quinua, trigo y cebada y también tiene una tierra de cultivo donde siembra habas y arvejas y luego lo vende en forma independiente llevando a lugares como Puerto Maldonado, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de menestras y papas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papa y menestras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “MATEO PUMACAHUA” communal bank. This bank is located in the Chinchero district, in the Urubamba province and in the Cusco department. 

This member’s name is Asunta. She is 50 years old and married. She has four children. She alternates her daily activities with a business buying and selling potatoes and grains like quinoa, wheat and barley. She also has a plot of land where she grows beans and peas. She later sells them independently, by taking them to places like Puerto Maldonado. With this business, she is able to help her children move forward. Asunta wants to expand her grain and potato business. She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale potatoes and grains.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy wholesale potatoes and grains.

loans.name: Gulsagyira's Group

texts.en: Gulsagyira is the leader of this group. She is 62 and married to a pensioner. Together with her husband, she has raised a son and a daughter. Both children are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money for the family budget, Gulsagyira cultivates strawberries and her husband breeds cattle. The family’s monthly profit is 4,000 soms. With money received from the loan, the family plans to purchase a bull-calf for breeding; for this purpose, Gulsagyira applied for the loan. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land in order to increase the area for growing strawberries. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement sope serigne babacar sy a été créé le 14 mai 2010.IL est composé de 18 membres issus de la meme commune.

Madame Aida debout à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupement.Elle est âgée de 41 ans ,elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants.

sa principale activité est le commerce de tissus  et de parfums.D'ailleurs elle dispose d'une bonne expérience 
de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiqué un peu plus d'un an.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus,du parfum et de la pâte qu'elle va revendre.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group Sope Serigne Babacar Sy was created on May 14, 2010. It is composed of 18 members who all come from the same township. 

Madame Aida, standing on the far right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 41, married, and the mother of five children.  

Her main business is selling lengths of cloth and perfumes. In fact, she has good experience as she has been in this business for a little more than one year. Her loan will permit her to buy cloth, perfumes and peanut butter for resale. 

Her goal is to ensure that she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cloth, perfume, and peanut butter.

loans.name: Palm Oil Sellers Association Group

texts.en:
Emmar is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in the eastern city of Kenema, this 40-year-old is married to a carpenter and they have 1 child. Emmar has been a professional businesswoman for 20 years now. She sells palm-oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil). Emmar is going to use her share of the loan to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her business. 

This will be the first loan that Emmar and her group members have received from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, each and every member of the group will be able to buy more goods to add to their businesses. In this way, their businesses will grow in size and quality. Sales and profit will thus increase and, consequently, these borrowers’ standards of living will also improve.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her business

loans.name: Marco Alexander

texts.es: Marco Alexander  nació en la ciudad de Arequipa (Perú) y tiene 37 años de edad. Actualmente, Marco Alexander  vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con sus cinco hijos. Marco Alexander  es músico de profesión y es especialista en percusión, el también tiene un pequeño grupo musical llamado “Son Bahía” y anima fiestas patronales, matrimonios y otros eventos. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Marco Alexander y su esposa julia desean abrir un pequeño cafetín en la ciudad de espinar y desean el crédito para implementar el local y desean comprar vajillas como por ejemplo platos, cuchillos, tazas, vasos, copas y otras cosas más. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Marco Alexander was born in the city of Arequipa (Peru) and he is 37 years old. Currently Marco Alexander lives in the city of Cusco together with his five children. Marco Alexander is a musician by profession, specializing in percussion. He also has a small group band named "Son Bahia" and they play on feast days, weddings, and other events. He has been in business for 25 years and it has gone very well given the determination he invests in his work. Marco Alexander and his wife, Julia, want to open a small cafeteria in the city of Espina. They want the loan to set up the store and to purchase implements such as plates, knives, cups, glasses, wine glasses, and other items. He is a responsible and hardworking person and it was for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to participate in their communal bank, named "Mosoc Killa", a member of Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase kitchen implements such as plates, knives, cups, glasses, wine glasses, and other items.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan trabaja en la policía nacional y también trabaja como guardia de seguridad privada. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (cemento, arena, ladrillos, fierro, estuco, etc.) ya que construirá tres habitaciones en la planta alta de su casa. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado  y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Juan works for the national police and also works as a private security guard. He needs the loan to buy construction materials (cement, sand, bricks, iron, stucco, etc) since he will build three rooms on the upstairs level of his house. He lives in his own house located in the Pasankeri area in the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children. This is the first time he has obtained a loan with IMPRO and through the Kiva channels.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron, bricks and other materials to build three rooms in his house.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. Mrs. Chin is married to Navuth, age 35. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have given birth to two children: all of the children are single. The rainy season is approaching and it is the best time to plant crops.  Therefore, Mrs. Chin would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting. Mrs. Chin and her husband were shown in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Mariana es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus calles y arquitectura, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Mariana tiene 44 años, es soltera, vive con su hermana y cuida a sus 3 sobrinos, dos de ellos están en el colegio y su último sobrino en la escuela, la casa en la que habita es propia.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de pantalones, vende recorriendo la ciudad dos días a la semana y ha iniciado este negocio con su primer crédito. 

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  y lo va a invertir  en la compra de más pantalones para incrementar su negocio.

Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariana is a member of the Communal Bank “San Pablo”. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful streets and architecture. The city offers a wide variety of cuisines and its people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Sra. Mariana is 44 years old, single, and lives with her sister. She takes care of her three nephews and nieces. Two of them are in high school and the youngest one is in elementary school. She owns the home in which they live.

Mariana sells trousers by traveling throughout the city twice a week. She started this business using her first loan.

Mariana is now receiving her third loan from the Communal Bank. She will invest in the purchase of more trousers so that she can increase her business. Her goal is to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to buy trousers to sell.

loans.name: Duo Santa Fe Ocaña Group

texts.es: Duo Santa Fe Ocaña. Lauro, de 51 años de edad el se dedica a al cultivo y venta de flores,desde hace 15 años el nos cuenta que esta muy contento porque dia en dia a prosperado con sus siembra,el es lider de este duo y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono para sus flores y semillas para poder tener otras bariedades de flores y poder venderlos a un mejor precio, el sueño de el es agrandar mas su siembra y a un corto plazo exportar sus flores al extranjero.
texts.en:
Lauro is 51 years old and has been in the business of cultivating and selling flowers for 15 years. He says that he is very pleased because he has prospered with his plantings day after day. Lauro is the leader of this group and is requesting a loan to buy compost for his flowers and seeds so that he can have other varieties of flowers. This will allow him to sell at a better price.

His dream is to increase his plantings, but his long-term goal is to export his flowers abroad.

loans.use: to buy compost and flower seeds.

loans.name: Misericorde Gg Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISERICORDE GG est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Ayegou Pascal est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ayegou Pascal est âgé de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayegou Pascal est marié à une revendeuse du nom de du nom de Véronique. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Ayegou Pascal et sa femme. Ayegou Pascal n'a fréquenté que le secondaire.Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Ayegou Pascal fait le maraichage.Ayegou Pascal mène cette activité depuis six ans. Ayegou Pascal s’approvisionne en engrais, en insecticide et en graines dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ayegou Pascal sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISERICORDE GG, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group MISERICORDE GG (“mercy”) consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group is Ayegou Pascal, seen with his hand raised in the photo. Ayegou Pascal is 29 years old and married to a reseller named Veronique. They have three dependent children who go to school. Ayegou Pascal attended high school. The couple handle together the various family responsibilities. 

Ayegou Pascal supports himself and his family through market gardening, an activity he has been practicing for six years. He buys fertilizers, insecticides and seeds at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy his customers and increase his revenue and profits, Ayegou Pascal is seeking a first group loan together with the other members of MISERICORDE GG.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for his market gardening activity

loans.name: Florecilda Aracely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor y Paz se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Florecilda, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 15 y 13 años de edad, todos estudian en universidad el mayor y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos venden calzado de todo tipo para lo cual los fines de semana instalan dos puestos uno en Calderón y otro en la ciudad de Santa Ana, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que mientras ella se encarga de vender con uno de sus hijos en Calderón su esposo en la madrugada parte hasta Santa Ana con otro de sus hijos para así aprovechar los días de feria en estos lugares que es cuando más ventas realizan. Ellos comprar en Guayaquil a comerciantes mayoristas que le dejan a muy buen precio. Llevan en este negocio 20 años y les ha ido muy bien a pesar de la competencia.
 
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y zapatillas de hombres y de damas. Lleva 7 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece la institución. 

Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de Portoviejo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Amor y Paz' (Love and Peace) community bank meet in Calderón parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  Most people in this area farm, raise animals and sell their products.

Here we meet 41-year-old Florecilda who is married and has three children who are 19, 15 and 13 years old.  They are all studying.  Her eldest is at university and the younger children are in high school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Florecilda and her husband work in commerce.  They both sell all kinds of footwear.  On weekends, they set up two stalls: one in Calderón and the other in the town of Santa Ana.  Our friend tells us that while she sells with one of her children on the stall in Calderón, her husband sets off early in the morning for Santa Ana with another of their children.  They do this so that they can make the most of the market days in these places which is when they make most sales.    They buy their merchandise from wholesalers in Guayaquil who offer them a very good price.  They have been in this business for twenty years and they have done very well in spite of the competition.

Florecilda will use this loan to buy men's and women's shoes and sneakers.  She has been working with her community bank for seven loan cycles and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution offers.  Her dream is to have premises in the center of Portoviejo.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes and sneakers

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of 5 hard working ladies. Rose is 21 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spear parts for resale, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward, 28 years old, is a hardworking man living in Hoima, Uganda, in a rented house. He has operated a produce business for 2 years. He started with capital of 300,000 UGX but now has 3,000,000 UGX as his working capital. Edward needs a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans

loans.name: Khách

texts.en:
Khách is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, Khách owns and operates a manufacturing business.  The main source of income for this business comes from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  Khách has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Khách joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help her improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Khách has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,736,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  

Khách is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND, which will be used to purchase machinery to expand her business.  This loan will be Khách’s sixth loan from SEDA.  Khách plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.



About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.





Khách là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Khách Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Khách thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Khách kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Khách đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Khách đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Khách dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase machinery to expand her business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel (pictured above on a motorcycle) is aged 43 and married with four children, three of whom are still in school. He has been in farming for 13 years and employs one farmhand, producing milk and tea and selling both to the local market. He also runs a motocycle transport business, which provides additional income.

Joel has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He says the loan will help him improve his income and his family living standards. He is optimistic the poultry business will continue to grow and even boost his transport which he runs alongside farming and provide income to educate the three children still schooling.

He mentions poor weather conditions and inflation on farming as the major challenges to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Ada works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Ada is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetable to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Ada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is married and she's 46 years of age with 9 children.

Naomi owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Naomi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Naomi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Naomi's 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, instant soups, coffee, and other products.

loans.name: Emerita De Jesús

texts.es: Emerita de Jesús es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa (pantalones, camisas, falda, camisetas) y calzado desde hace 3 años. El crédito que solicita es de autoestima el cual utilizara para componerse la dentadura y realizarse unos exámenes.
texts.en: Emerita de Jesús is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has been selling clothing (pants, shirts, skirts, t-shirts) and shoes.  She will use the money from this loan to pay for personal dental work and have some tests done.

loans.use: to have dental work done

loans.name: Fedinard

texts.en:
Fedinard is 59 years old businessman. He is married with three children. He has been selling plastic ware as a primary business and farming as a secondary business for the past seven years. With a monthly income of Kes  13,000 he supports his family.

He is applying for his third loan with Kiva partner KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. He plans to use the loan to buy more plastic ware plus seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profits from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture fully into farming.

loans.use: to buy more plasticware plus seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La socia Nancy; continua con la crianza de animales menores, como  cuyes, ovejas, chanchos, vacas. y tambien con la agricultura, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo de maíz, y en esta ocasión la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animale smenores como cuyes y en la cosecha del maíz para ello la socia contratara obreros para que le ayuden con esta cosecha y luego poder vender la cosecha de maíz. LA SOCIA SOLICIATE L PRESTAMO PARA LA COSECHA DE MAIZ Y COMPRA DE CUYES.
texts.en:
The member Nancy continues with the raising of small animals such as guinea pigs, sheep, pigs, cows, and also in agriculture.

The member has land for growing corn and at this time she is asking for a loan in order to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and to pay the workers she contracts to help in the harvesting of corn and later she can sell the harvested corns.

The member is asking for a loan in order to harvest corn and to buy guinea pigs.

loans.use: to pay the workers to harvest the corn and to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Duterimbere Cb Group

texts.en: Duterimbere means "let's grow" in English. The group is led by Marie Claire, aged 30. She is married with four children aged between one and six. Marie Claire sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. Only two of her children go to school. All the group members run different business types, such as retail, service, transportation and many more. The group members have the same vision of uplifting their business and changing the lives of their community. With the loan, Marie Claire would like to buy more bananas and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Zulfa

texts.en:
Zulfa is a 21-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her parents in a rural area of Morogoro District in Tanzania. Zulfa is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who helps students learn about various life skills, including self-esteem. 

For a living she sells ladies clothes known locally as Khanga and Vitenge. The income supports her and her siblings. She uses some of her profits to help vulnerable children. 

She requests a Kiva loan in order to expand her business. Zulfa has a dream of having a big shop of clothes and saving more money for the future.

loans.use: to expand her business of women's clothes.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Это Фотима. Она из района Дангара. Фотима семейная женщина. У нее 5 детей. 1 сын и 4 дочери. Сыну 14 лет. Дочкам 13, 11, 6 и 1 лет. Фотима счастливая жена и мать. У нее есть маленький бизнес. Фотима дома предоставляет услуги портнихи уже более 3 года. Она шьет женскую одежду на заказ у себя дома. Фотима предоставляя услуги портнихи, зарабатывает на жизнь, и это деятельность является основной источником дохода. Ее швейная машинка устарела и Фотима решила приобрести новую, чтобы не потерять источник дохода. Фотима обратилась к Вам за кредитом, потому что она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Вы можете поддержать ее!
texts.en:
This is Fotima. She is from the Dangara district. Fotima is a family woman. She has four children - one son and three daughters. Her son is fourteen years old, and her daughters are thirteen, eleven, six, and one. Fotima is a happy wife and mother.

She has a small business. Fotima has been offering tailoring services from home for more than three years. She makes women's clothes to order at home. Fotima earns a living by offering tailoring services, and this business is a main source of income. Her sewing machine has become obsolete and Fotima has decided to obtain a new one so that she will not lose her source of income. 

Fotima appeals to you for a loan because she believes in you and your support. You are able to support her!

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Loacted within the Central Piata (Market) in Balti one can find anything their heart desire and attracts people from all over the north of Moldova. Balti is the 2nd biggest city in Moldova or also called the capitol of the North and this is where one can find Valentina I.. She is 48 years old, married with two kids and has worked her stall by herself for the past four years.  Her husband and older son work half the year in Moscow as construction workers.

Valentina likes to think of Balti as a fashionable city, and this reflects in the cloths which she sells.  Geared towards many ages with her eclectic range of clothing she tries to caters to the students who attend the local university to older professional working women into her stall.  She noticed when she started her business that there were too many other stalls just selling jeans and sweaters and she had to be different and diversify in order to succeed.  

Her goal for the future is to one day move to a better location within the market.  Her current stand is located in an unpaved and over crowded section. For now, she would like to secure a loan through Kiva to purchase jackets for the coming winter.  Last year she had to wait to buy jackets till her fall clothing sold to raise the capitol necessary and it was one of the worst winters people could remember, the temperature dropped as low as -30 Celsius. This year she would like to be prepared and beat the competition by buying the jackets early.

loans.use: To purchase 30 jackets for retail.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is married and has two children that attend school. She also takes care of her sister and her child. She is educated up to level 12 and she has taken business management and loan use training through Rural Agency for Development (Rafode). She started her used clothing business in 2000 with capital of $200. The business has grown since then under her management.

She is seeking a loan to expand her business by opening branches in other market areas surrounding Kisumu.

She intends to use the profit to take care of the family and furnish her house.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Juanita Sonia

texts.en:
Juanita is an enterprising married mother of two with high hopes of moving up in the world. Her husband is a soldier and a little while ago they received credit to purchase a home. The family's debt increased with the mortgage and the costs of her children's education, and they needed to earn extra income to cover the costs. Four years ago, Juanita decided to start her own business selling chemical cleaning products, milk products and mango desserts. The love of her family and faith in her husband has been a big motivator.

Currently, Juanita's business has grown a lot, and she needs a $50 loan to help her buy merchandise to meet the demands of her customers and continue to grow her business. She plans to repay the loan within three to six months. With your help Juanita can do great things. She and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Juanita es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, ella es casada y tiene una hija de 15 años y un hijo de 7. Su esposo es soldador y hace poco obtuvo un crédito que le permitió adquirir una casa, el pago de la hipoteca y los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, incrementaron los deudas familiares y para obtener un ingreso extra, hace cuatro años, Juanita decidió iniciar su propio negocio, vendiendo productos químicos, lácteos y postres de mango. El amor a su familia y el fiel compromiso con su esposo la han motivado todo este tiempo.

Actualmente, el negocio de Juanita ha crecido mucho, por lo que necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 50 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Juanita puede hacer grandes cosas, no lo dudes más y contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy cleaning products, milk products and desserts to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio

Mrs. María sells traditional dishes such as fish soup, chicken stew, and beef entrails stew, which she serves in a store she rents in her local municipal market. She began to sell these dishes on the sidewalk of a main street. Then, she was given the chance to rent this space and that is how she was able to improve her business.

Uso of Loan

She needs the credit to purchase a showcase where she can exhibit her products in a better way; people will be able to see the delicious dishes María prepares. She is convinced that by preparing traditional meals of the area, she will have more clients and, therefore, a greater need for supplies in order to meet the production demands.

Personal Information

María is 51 years old, has two children who study and help her in the food sales. Her house is made of cane and she also counts on her brother’s support who lives with her.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

L Sra. Maria tiene a la venta platos típicos como sopa de pescado, estofado de pollo y estofado de vísceras de vaca que expende en un local que arrienda en un mercado municipal de su sector. Ella comenzó a vender dichos platos en una acera de una calle principal luego tuvo la oportunidad de alquilar un puesto el mercado y fue así que pudo mejorar su negocio

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar un vitrina donde podrá exhibir de mejor manera sus producto y así las personas puedan observar mejor los deliciosos platos que Maria prepara. Además ella esta convencida que preparando otras delicias típicas de la zona tendrá mas clientela y por ello también necesita comprar mas mercadería para aumentar su producción

Información Personal

Maria tiene 51 años de edad y dos hijos quienes estudia y además le ayudan en la venta de la comida, su casa es de caña y cuenta también con el apoyo del hermano que vive con ella

loans.use: Purchase a showcase to exhibit her products.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ami K. was born in 1977 in Tsévié, a territory of Zio. She is married and mother to four children. Her husband is a farmer in the town of Yoto and contributes rarely to the costs of the household. Mrs. K. runs a restaurant that she has managed for three years. Very enterprising, she is building her small business and delivers quality service to a client base which grows larger and larger. Honest and hardworking, she capably managed and promptly repaid the two previous loans she received. Today she seeks a loan of $850, which will allow her to buy grains to strengthen her sales of pasta and other foods. She will also be able to improve her revenues and sustain the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva volunteer.

Madame K. Ami est née en 1977 à Tsévié (Préfecture du Zio). Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son mari est cultivateur dans la préfecture de Yoto et contribue rarement aux charges du ménage. Madame K. Ami gère un restaurant qu’elle tient depuis 3 ans. Très entreprenante, elle développe sa petite activité et rend un service de qualité à sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus grande. Honnête et rigoureuse, elle a su gérer et rembourser promptement les deux précédents crédits qu’elle avait obtenus. Elle sollicite ce jour un crédit de $850 qui lui servira à acheter des céréales en vue de renforcer ses activité de vente de boule de pâte et autres. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Buying grains to strengthen the sales of pasta and other foods at her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
Cipriano Ortiz worked for many years as a bricklayer. Unfortunately, this occupation did not provide him with a steady enough income given the work was intermittent and he was for many long periods without a job. For this reason, he began seeking some type of enterprise where he could generate quicker earnings and move merchandise in short periods of time. He began selling clothing and bedspreads by traveling to San Juan de los Lagos Jalisco, a city where clothing is manufactured at wholesale, to purchase his inventory at lower prices. He then resells his goods in Victoria at a good profit.

Since winter has now arrived, Cipriano considers changing the type of clothing he is offering. Therefore, he is asking for a $650USD loan, to be paid back over a period of six months, with which he can purchase more merchandise (such as winter clothing and bedspreads) that many people will be looking for now that cold weather is arriving. With your help, Cipriano’s family will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cipriano Ortiz trabajó durante muchos años como albañil y desgraciadamente este negocio no le daba lo suficiente para vivir, constantemente se quedaba sin trabajo y las temporadas eran muy largas. Fue por es oque comenzó a buscar un comercio en el que las ganancias se vieran reflejadas más rápidas y que el movimiento de mercancía fuera en poco tiempo. Es por eso que comenzó a vender ropa y colchas. Y lo que hace es ir a San Juan de los Lagos Jalisco, que es una ciudad en dónde se fabrica ropa por mayoreo y por lo tanto los precios son más bajos que en Victoria y al revenderla le obtiene una buena ganancia.

Sin embargo la temporada de invierno ya llegó y por lo tanto Cipriano considera que es momento de cambiar el tipo de ropa. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía como ropa de invierno y colchas que mucha gente está comprando puesto que los fríos ya están llegando. Con tu ayuda la familia de Cipriano podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to sell over the winter season.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng V. T., 41, works with her husband on their farmland growing rice and typically earns on average around US$ 6 each day in revenue. She has three children. One of them is employed at a garment factory and the other two are enrolled in school. Mrs. Heng V. T. hopes to use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She believes this loan will enable her to expand her crops and to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
"I have been married for five years and live with my family in the small town of Arifwala, Pakistan. I have three children: two girls and one boy. None of my kids is of school-going age yet. I am borrowing for the first time in my loan group. I stitch clothes for my neighborhood clients. My husband trades used items and his brother is a butcher. I need this loan for my husband’s brother; he needs to buy some animals for his shop. He will give me a reasonable share of the profit out of his business.

I am the leader of a few other women from my neighborhood. Naseem B. will invest her share of the loan in their family’s grocery store and auto workshop. Kalsoom B.‘s husband drives a horse cart and now they need to buy a new horse for their cart. Sughran B. needs a loan to buy a rickshaw for her husband. Saeeda B. requires this loan to buy construction supplies for their business. There is no one here who could lend to us."

loans.use: Expand our butcher shop

loans.name: Seynabou A.

texts.fr:
Madame Seynabou A. F., 44 and married, is a member of the Khodoba Village Bank since 6 and half years. Madame F. is asking for a loan to grow her business selling fruit (Organges, watermelon, tangerines, etc.). She is hoping that the money she earns from growing her business will help her manage maintenance costs and improve her boutique's infra-structure.

Seynabou is one of the best clients within Caurie's Khodoba Village Bank, maintaining a solid reimbursement history. This will be her 8th loan with a term of 6 months and 1 payment at the end of the loan term.

Mme Seynabou A. F. est âgée de 44 ans, mariée. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de Khodoba depuis six ans et demis. Afin d'aider à l’entretien de son foyer, elle souhaite renforcer son commerce de fruits (Orange, pastèque, mandarine, clémentine, etc.). Elle fait partie des meilleurs clientes de son groupe. Elle sollicite un 8ème prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a great, hardworking woman. Her love and devotion for her husband and six-year-old son, Jesus, drive her to continue working hard, dedicating her time to making bags, which she has been doing for over two years now. During that time she has been able to expand her small workshop and progressively increase her business. This young mother's greatest desire is to build her own home so that she has safe place to raise her young son and the other children that she and her husband hope to have in the future. However, in order to do this, Elizabeth needs additional funds for her job.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth es una gran mujer y muy trabajadora, su gran amor y entrega por su esposo y su pequeño niño Jesús de 6 añitos de edad la motivan a seguir esforzándose en su noble oficio de confección de bolsas.Viene dedicándose a esta labor hace más de 2 años, en ese periodo logró ampliar su tallercito y crecer progresivamente con su negocio.El deseo más grande que tiene esta joven madre es construir su propia morada, con el fin de tener un lugar seguro donde cobijar a su pequeño niño y a los hijos que más adelante pretenden traer al mundo. Y para concretar este fin necesita elevar su capital de trabajo.

loans.use: Additional funds in order to increase production.

loans.name: Zayda

texts.es:
Zayda is very talented at making beautiful embroidered costumes in different styles, but always with her own personal touch. It all began 10 years ago when she decided to use her skills to earn a living and to support her family. Zayda inherited her skills from her mother who instilled in her from a young age the value of hard work. Through her hard work and daily efforts she is able to contribute to her children’s upbringing. To continue with her work and to increase production, Zayda needs to purchase additional supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Zayda posee gran talento para realizar bellos trabajos de bordado de trajes típicos de diversos estilos y siempre con su toque distintivo. Todo comenzó hace 10 años cuando decidió crear una fuente generadora de ingresos para su familia a través de su habilidad. Ella heredó estas habilidades de su madre que desde niña le inculcó el valor del trabajo.Gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo diario puede contribuir notablemente con el desarrollo de los suyos y para continuar con su labor desea adqurir mayor cantidad de insumos a fin de elevar su producción.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to continue embroidering traditional costumes

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Neema M.. She is married, and has three children aged 4, 9, and 13. In 2007, Neema established her general store business. Neema requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soda, water, juice, oil, sugar, and soap in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. This serves as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soda, water, juice, oil, sugar and soap in bulk.

loans.name: Saiali.

texts.ru:
Saiali G. is 36 years old and is married with 3 children. She is involved in the sewing of the traditional dress. Saiali works from home, and lives in the city of Vahdat. For the past time being she has had a lot of orders and has many students, therefore she needs to buy another sewing machine. For this reason she has planned to receive a loan. This loan will help her increase production and increase revenue for her business. She plans to extinguish the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Гаюрова Сайали 36 лет , замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Шьет на дому. Живет в городе Вахдат. Последнее время у нее много заказов и много учеников, поэтому ей требуется купить швейную машину дополнительно. Для этого она решила получить кредит . Это поможет ей увеличить объем продукции и увеличить доход своего дела. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Mr. Amadou W. is 41 years old and lives with his two children in his father’s house with his extended family in the Massablacoura quarter in the city of Bougouni (Bougoni Prefecture in Mali). Coming from a Diawanbe family (an ethnic group which is very skilled in business in West Africa), he never went to school because his father was always moving. After a period of apprenticeship in the techniques of business, he decided to start a business selling hooved animals, notably cattle. Mr. W. has been doing this for 15 years and is an expert in this field. In order to obtain additional financial help, he visited the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where he just got his first individual loan. With this loan he plans to buy 15 head of cattle. He buys cattle in the villages surrounding Bougouni from cattle farmers, but he also goes to the main livestock markets in the region (Siékorolé, Niéna, Koumantou, Massigui, Bougouni, etc.). His client base is comprised mostly of butchers from the market in Bougouni, but also families who are holding ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, funerals). He hopes to make a profit of 60,000 FCFA (about $142) per cycle which will be used to pay the interest on the loan, reinvested in his business, and used to take care of his family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Amadou W. est âgé de 41 ans et vit avec ses 2 enfants chez son père dans une grande famille élargie au quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni.(Préfecture de Bougouni République du Mali) Ussie d’une famille Diawanbé (ethnie très habile dans les négoces en Afrique de l’Ouest) il ne fréquenta pas l’école en raison des déplacements fréquents de son père. Après une phase d’apprentissage des techniques de commerce et de négoce, il décida de méner l’activité d’achat vente d’animaux sur pied notamment des bouefs. Monsieur W. exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans et a une maîtrise parfaite de activité. Afin d’obtenir une ressource financière complémentaire il démarcha l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso où il vient d’avoir son premier prêt indivuduel. Avec ce pret il compte acheter 15 bouefs. Il s’approvisionne en boeufs dans les villages environnants de la ville de Bougouni auprès des éléveurs mais fréquente aussi les principaux marchés à bétail de la localité (Siékorolé,Niéna,Koumantou,Massigui, Bougouni etc). Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de bouchers exerçant au marché de Bougouni mais aussi de familles ayant des céremonies (Mariage, Bapteme ou déccès). Il espère réaliser un bénéfice par cycle de 60.000FCFA qui servira à payer les intêrets de prêt, renforcer le fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Papa Mamadou

texts.fr: papa mamadou traoré est un jeune célibataire qui vit au quartier cité senghor .il gère une salle de jeu depuis plus de trois ans .c'est dans le but  de renforcer son matériel de travail qu'il sollicite ce pret .
texts.en:
Papa Mamadou Traoré is a single young man living in the Cité Senghor neighborhood. He has been managing an arcade for over three years. He is seeking this loan to improve his business equipment.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Arcade equipment

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is 20 years old. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and two children.  She is the proprietor of a retail shop adjacent to her home. In her shop, she sells essential items such as bread, flour, cooking oil, sugar, kerosene, and soap. She has applied for a loan of US $500 to enable her to increase her stock and obtain supplies that sell quickly in her community.

loans.use: Increase stock of supplies.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich N. is a villager in Angk Prasath Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Mak Chan, are poultry breeders who raise ducks. Since this business is going well, they want to expand it, so Mrs. Pich N. decided to ask for a loan to buy two-hundred more ducks for breeding. Mrs. Pich N. is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of four years old. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two-hundred more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Meletia H.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 52-year-old Meletia K. from Mbeya. She is a widow with 4 children, between the ages of 20 and 30. Meletia has been running a genge business since 1992. Her business is to purchase commodities wholesale and sell them retail to people around the area.

She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Meletia currently earns about $80 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $650 in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and fish. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Meletia thanks you for your support!

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and fish

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander, who lives with his elderly mother, started his upholstery business five years ago after losing his job. He enjoys working with his hands and enabling people to have nice furniture, and earns an average monthly income of over $300.

Alexander is now requesting a loan to purchase materials he needs in his business. Acquiring these necessary materials quickly will help him to complete orders in a timely fashion and be paid promptly. Alexander’s goal is to develop his business further in order to have a stable personal income.

loans.use: To purchase upholstery materials.

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr:
Mr Koami D. est un fournisseur de graviers né le 30 Août 1977 à Togblé. Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il exerce cette activité depuis sept (07) ans. Ses principaux clients sont les entreprises de constructions auxquelles il livre tous ses stocks. Toutefois sa capacité financière ne lui permet pas de satisfaire tous ses clients suivant leur demande et à temps.
C’est pour cela qui sollicite un financement pour augmenter sa capacité d’extraction. Ce financement va lui permettre d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Koami D. was born in Togblé on August 30, 1977. He's married and the father of 5 children. He's been selling gravel for seven years. His main customers are construction enterprises, to which he deliver all his stocks. However, his financial capability does not enable him to meet customer demand in time. This is why he is seeking a loan to bolster his extraction capacity. This loan will enable him to increase his revenue and his profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extraction and sale of gravel

loans.name: Soktieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Soktieng L., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sopheak Mom, 28, live aL. the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 2002 and have two sons who are still very young.

Soktieng has been selling longans (a local fruit) since 2002. She buys them from villagers in the village where she lives and sells them at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been an electrician in a company in Phnom Penh since he married. Soktieng is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase longans to resale.

loans.use: To purchase longans

loans.name: Holnazar

texts.ru: Ходжаев Холназар проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 29 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование. По профессии экономист. Но работает артистом. Выступает на свадьбах , исполняя национальные песни. Кроме того имеет торговую точку , где продает разный товар. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и специализироваться на определенном виде товара. Это даст возможность найти свою нишу на рынке. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Holnazar H. lives in Kulyab. He is 29 years old and is married with 2 children. He has a university degree in Economics but he makes a living as an actor. He performs at weddings singing traditional songs. In addition, he has a vending point where he sells different products. Holnazar would like to get a loan in order to increase cash flow, find his own niche and specialize in selling one type of goods. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is a widow. She has two grown-up children and grandchildren. She owns a small business that sells women's clothing at the central market in Melitopol city. Her monthly gross income is 15,000 UAH.

Alexandra has been in this business for 13 years. She likes selling clothing and says that this is what she can do best. Alexandra is a hard-working and very entrepreneurial person. She is always looking for new types of clothing to sell. Alexandra has many repeat clients who enjoy buying things from her.

Alexandra would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to make additional profit and help her children and grandchildren financially.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
D. Françoise est âgée de 55 ans et elle est originaire de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Françoise est mère de cinq (5) enfants dont trois (3) garçons et deux (2) filles, tous majeurs. Françoise vit avec trois de ses petits fils dans sa propre maison à Kowegbo un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Françoise vendait des liqueurs (boissons alcoolisées) au marché Tokpa (marché international du Bénin); mais par la suite, Françoise a abandonné le marché et a créé une petite boutique de divers (bombons, biscuits,  sucre, pâtes alimentaires, savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) et de liqueurs (boissons alcoolisées) à un carrefour situé à près de 1 Km de son domicile. Françoise veut agrandir et diversifier ses activités. C'est dans cette optique que Françoise sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé pour pouvoir renforcer ces activités.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Françoise D., 55, comes from Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. Françoise is the mother of 5 children, 3 sons and 2 daughters, all adults. Françoise lives with three of her grand-sons in her own home in Kowegbo, a working-class neighborhood of the town of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin.

Françoise used to sell alcoholic drinks at the Tokpa market (the international market of Bénin); however, later, she left the market and opened up a little variety store selling candy, cookies sugar, pasta, detergents, dishwashing liquid, toilet soap, etc., but also alcoholic drinks on a crossroads situated about 1 km from her home.

Françoise wants to expand and diversify her business. It is with this in mind that she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to bolster her businesses.

The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for re-sale

loans.name: Aleman Group

texts.es: El banco comunal alemán  es un grupo nuevo que se ha formado con socias que ya han trabajado en anteriores bancos comunales, de manera que son personas con ganas de trabajar y ayudar al crecimiento de sus patrimonios en sus hogares.
