El crédito que han obtenido es para invertirlo en sus negocios y obtener mayores ventas y ganancias, los componentes del banco comunal se dedican a la venta de comida, venta de pan, y otros a la venta de cosméticos.Otras actividades a las que se dedica el grupo son: VENTA DE ROPA, EMPLEADO, MOTO TAXISTA, VENTA DE ROPA, PANADERIA, COMERCIANTE, VENTA DE COMIDA Y ASADITO, VENTA DE COMIDA, VENTA DE PAN, VENTA DE COMIDA, EMPLEADO, SECRETARIA, PANADERIA y EMPLEADA.
texts.en:
The German communal bank is a new group that has formed with partners who have already worked in previous communal banks, so that they are people with the desire to work and to help grow the wealth of their homes. The credit they have obtained is for investing in their businesses and to obtain greater sales and earnings. The components of the communal bank are selling food, bread and cosmetics. Other activities to which the group is dedicated are: selling clothing, employment, Moto taxi driver, bakery, retailer, selling and roasting food, and secretary.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Ehsanullah

texts.en:
Ehsanullah R. has an electronics shop in Jalalabad city. He is married and has 2 children. He is an educated man and a very hard worker. He has a building that is located in a good area near the street.  He tried many times to increase his income but he could not because he didn't have enough tools at his shop. When he found AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) and asked about this loan process he was really very happy. 
Now he wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis to expand his business. He wants to buy more tools for his shop and support his family to provide a better future. 
He is happy with all members of his family and he would like to thank Kiva and AFS for a successful loan process in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. He wants to say a special thank you to lenders who are supporters of this process and wants to continue his partnership in the future.

loans.use: Buy more tools

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús R. G., de 42 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. El posee un negocio de reparación de relojes, dicho negocio tiene muchos años de poseerlo y es a través de este como la familia a logrado  sostenerse desde ya hace mucho tiempo. Manuel solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener el dinero para comprar más brazaletes para relojes, batería y otros repuestos especiales.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús R. G., 42, lives in Santa Tecla with his wife and two young children. He has a watch repair business that he has had for many years, and that has supported the family for a long time. Manuel is requesting a loan in order to get money to buy more watch bands, batteries, and other specialized supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of watch repair supplies and tools

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Snežana

texts.en: Snežana J. was born in 1977 and comes from Srebrenica. She lives there with her child and husband. Her husband works outside of Bosnia-Herzegovina. Snežana owns a boutique and works there every day. She repaid one loan by WWI and requested a new one in the amount of 700 KM. She will invest this loan in her clothes business. This business keeps Snežana busy and helps her to increase her household income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Eldith

texts.en:
Eldith R. A. is a member of the communal bank “Cesar Vallejo” and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She sells clothing and shoes, most of which are ordered in advance by her customers, and also jewelry, cosmetics and perfumes.

Eldith has been working with Manuela Ramos for 11 years and used her first loan to purchase cigarettes for sale. When this business did not go well, Eldith switched to her current enterprise of selling clothing and shoes. During the day, Eldith has a job caring for the three-year-old twins of a neighbor. In the evenings, she heads out to sell her goods in nearby neighborhoods where she has regular clients who have known her a long time. Eldith will use this loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles to invest in more goods for her business.

Eldith is married but separated and has three adult children. Two of her sons still live at home but have their own jobs and no longer depend on their mother. Eldith very much enjoys working. Loans from Manuela Ramos have helped her to advance her business, which dropped off during a recent period when Eldith was ill, but has since been recovering well.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Aina

texts.en: Aina sells clothes and is also a fashion designer. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. She is 28 years old and married with five children. Aina hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lotoi

texts.en: Lotoi S. (0) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Samatau Fou 4. She is married and has five school-aged children. Lotoi owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. Lotoi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Lotoi is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will again be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sababu Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed K., Jaminatu K. and Mumunatu B.. They are local entrepreneurs based in Waterloo, a small town 20 miles from Freetown city. They named their group Sababu. They are requesting a loan of LE 500,000 for each of them to help them expand their businesses. This loan will be the first these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. 

Mohamed K. (left and also attached is a picture of his business) is the leader of Sababu group. Mohamed is 35 years old. He was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children together. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School II and the other is in Class V. Mohamed sells ready-to-wear-clothes. He has been in this business since 2000. With the help of this loan, he will be able to expand his business by traveling to neighboring Guinea to buy more clothes at a cheaper rate to add into his shop. In this way, he will be able to meet the growing demand of his customers, make higher profits and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Genecith

texts.es:
La señora Genecith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y 03 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella. 

Genecith es una mujer muy trabajadora, decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Genecith, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs.Genecith belongs to the communal bank of Picota, District of Picota, Province of Picota, and Department of San Martin. She lives with her significant other. She is thirty seven years old and has three dependant children. Genecith is a very hard working woman who decided to begin her own business selling groceries, and with the earnings she’ll increase the economic earnings in her home. Now she has fixed clientele that come to her store daily to make purchases because she has all the products a housekeeper needs. She also personally deals with all her clients using her natural charisma. With the loan of $1,025 USD she will purchase rice and sugar in sacks; crackers, noodles and salt in packages; milk and preserved fish in boxes along with a variety of brands, eggs and articles of personal hygiene to continue giving the best service to her clients. Genecith wants very much to continue working and is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for their support of women like her and the opportunity to develop and move into the middle class.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchace Groceries to Increase Stock

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Cette femme vend uniquement des oeufs de poule dans sa maison à Kégué à Lomé. Elle a épousé un électricien bâtiment ; ces temps-ci les revenus du mari n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins financiers du foyer ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’est lancée l’année dernière dans le commerce d’œufs. Depuis 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité, cette dame arrive à aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs 02 enfants. Elle vend en gros mais aussi en détail, et approvisionne les bars et restaurants du quartier. Elle a besoin en ce moment d’acheter 100 plateaux d’œufs ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES.

loans.use: achat de plateaux d'oeufs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 52 años, vive con su pareja (José), quien es mecánico, y con sus 2 hijos; Jhony de 28 y Khaty de 22. Su hija mayor (Jessica) de 27 años, ya conformó su propia familia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la atención de su bodega, la cual implementó en su propia casa. Rosa abre su tienda a las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche, tiempo en el cual obtiene muy buenos ingresos, ya que siempre trata de abastecer su tienda con las necesidades de su clientela. En muchas ocasiones cuando sale a comprar mercadería o por alguna urgencia, su hija Jessica es quien la ayuda con la atención, ya que no puede cerrar su bodega porque es muy concurrida, lo que le produce buenos ingresos económicos. Por tal motivo, Rosa está pensando en ampliar y para la próxima época escolar (marzo y abril) vender materiales de librería y así lograr que en el futuro su tienda sea más grande y muy bien surtida.

Rosa es la presidenta de su banco comunal llamado “Cristo Morado” y siempre ha organizado muy bien a su grupo, siendo más que un grupo, una gran familia. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará arroz, azúcar y 10 cajas de bebidas, además de útiles escolares para el periodo escolar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52, and she lives with her life partner, José. He is a mechanic. She also lives with her two children. Jhony is 28, and Khaty is 22. Her oldest daughter, Jessica, is 27 and has her own family. For 12 years she has worked in her mini-market. She set it up in her own house. Rosa opens her store at six in the morning, and it is open until eight or nine at night. During that time she gets very good earnings. She always tries to stock her store with her customers’ necessities. Many times when she has to leave to buy merchandise or for something urgent, her daughter, Jessica, helps take care of the store. She cannot close her store because it is very busy. It produces good income. That is why Rosa is thinking of expanding her store for the next school season (March and April) and selling bookstore materials. In the future she would have a larger, better stocked store. Rosa is the president of her communal bank, Cristo Morado. She has always organized her group well. They are more than a group, they are a big family. With the money she is asking for she will buy rice, sugar, ten boxes of drinks, and school supplies for the school period.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Rice is one of the major crops sowed in Agusan Del Sur. Alicia is one of those who cultivate their land for rice crops. She is a 55-year-old married woman. She has seven kids and her eldest is 29 years old. She admits that right now, she lacks the capacity to fund her farm. Her farm, according to her, really needs to be supplied with farm inputs. She is requesting to borrow 12,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, a Kiva partner. Alicia sees this opportunity as a big factor in her aim to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Don Mario vive en la comunidad de Villa Tumavi a 15 Km. de la localidad de El Torno su actividad principal el transporte debiendo recorrero diariamente mas de 120 KM (distancia a la ciudad de Santa Cruz); es divorciado y tiene a su cargo a sus dos hijos, los cuales están en edad colegial, recibe colaboración de sus padres.
texts.en:
Don Mario lives in the community of Villa Tumavi, which is 15 km from the town of El Torno. His main business activity is providing transportation services. On a daily basis, Don Mario travels more than 120 km (the distance required to reach the city of Santa Cruz). He is divorced and has two children who are of college age. They receive assistance from both of their parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry A. G. es un señor de 39 años de edad el cual vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra muy sobre la carretera cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde hace 4 años que don Henry se dedica a la cría y venta de Tilapia, tiene un lugar adecuado para tal fin; comenta que el negocio  ha ido creciendo poco a poco y que en estos momentos le va muy bien, ya que  su producto es muy  aceptado en su comunidad. 

Debido a que tiene bastante demanda de tilapia don Henry desea solicitar un micro crédito por ¢ 670,000 (seiscientos setenta  mil colones) para comprar crías, alimento, entre otros insumos que necesita; ya que quiere agrandar su negocio, brindar un mejor servicio, y por supuesto mejora la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Don Henry es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Henry A. G. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the community of Hernández located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. This community is in a mountainous area that experiences great humidity. It is on the road that is closest to the northern border of the country. The principal economic activities of the region are livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of basic grains, tubers, and oranges.

Don Henry has been raising and selling tilapia for four years. He has a place set aside specifically for this purpose. His business has been growing steadily and is doing very well at the moment since his products are widely accepted in the community.

Because the demand for tilapia is growing, Don Henry is requesting a microloan of 670,000 colones in order to buy hatchlings, fish food, and other necessary supplies. His goals are to expand his business, provide better service, and improve the quality of life for his family.

Don Henry is a member of the United Community Credit Enterprise for Development, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and he hopes to grow personally and financially. He would like to offer his thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that enable him to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tilapia hatchlings, fish food, and other supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima - Juli” desD. hace 15 años atrás, del distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 55 años D. edad, cunta con estudios primarios completos, es casada y tiene 8 hijos (1 D. ellos vive con ella y 7 tienen familia).
Antonia se dedica a la artesanìa y paralelamente da pensiòn en su casa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà bayeta y lana.
Su sueño para el futuro es ayudar a sus hijos a poner una tienda D. artesanías. 
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
For fifteen years, Antonia has been a member of the “Santa Rosa D. Lima - Juli” Communal Bank in the Juli disctrict of Chucuito province in the Puno region. She is 55 years old, married, finished her primary education, and has 8 children (one of whom lives with her and seven who have their own families).

Antonia makes handicrafts and also rents out rooms in her home. She reports that she used her first loan from Manuela Ramos (for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles) as working capital. She is currently requesting a loan for 500 nuevos soles to purchase cloth and wool.

Her dream for the future is to help her children and to open a handicrafts store.

Her favorite things about participating in her communal bank are saving money and meeting with other members.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth and wool

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.en:
Bahadur H. is applying for his second loan from Kiva. Previously he made window grilles, but now he makes fire furnaces, which work with gas and wood. He needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary materials for making the furnace and improving his business. 

"HAPPY CHRISTMAS!"

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for making furnaces

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es:
la sra. Rosa Marlene V. tiene 40 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene su propio negocio que es una pulperia. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, tiene muchos clientes fijos, es muy amable con todos sus clientes por eso es que la prefieren a ella.
en estos momentos necesita capital para poder comprar mas productos y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia, para poder cumplir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
dice sentirse muy feliz ya que todo le ha salido muy bien.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Marlene V. is 40 years old and sells popular consumer products from her own business. Her store is located in her home. She has many regular customers who prefer to buy from her because she is very friendly with them.

At the moment, Rosa needs capital in order to buy more products and restock her store so that she will be able to fulfill all of her customers’ demands. She says she is very happy because everything is going well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est âgée de 59 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Depuis 3 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY. Son crédit lui permet de développer un petit commerce de fruits. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son commerce lui permet de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou N. is a 59-year old woman who is married and has eight children. For the past three and a half years she has been a member of the village bank in TOULY. Her loan will allow her to develp a small fruit business. The profits she makes from the business will allow her to contribute to the improvement in her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her income-generating activity

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cochapamba se encuentra formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que siempre buscan la manera de salir adelante y ven en cada oportunidad una forma para seguir creciendo personalmente y a nivel familiar, este banco está ubicado  en la comunidad Cochapamba en  la parroquia El Valle al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad muy reconocida por su producción de maíz  y su atractivo turística la laguna llena de Totora.

Rosa B. es socia del Banco Comunal Cochapamba se caracteriza por ser una mujer  muy colaboradora y sociable manteniendo  una gran amistad con todas sus amigas del banco comunal con apenas veinte y tres años vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de cinco años, su pareja trabaja de lunes a viernes en la construcción y los fines de semana hace fletes en su camioneta, gracias al esfuerzo mancomunado lograron construir su casa propia.

Ella  se dedica a la cría y venta  de pollos pelados bajo pedido y ganado vacuno,  lleva dos   años realizando esta actividad para ello los compra en crías los tiene un tiempo y ya grandes los vende en la feria libre o a sus vecinos de la comunidad.

Rosa  tiene cuatro años trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación y fue Gladys Arpi otra socia del bankito quien la incentivó a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho para terminar su casa y  con el nuevo préstamo va a comprar más pollos, ganado y alimento para seguir e incrementar  su negocio para hacer realidad su  gran sueño de salir adelante y entregarle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Cochapamba communal bank is made up of a group of enterprising women who are always looking for ways to succeed in life and who see in every opportunity a way to continue growing both personally and at their family level. This bank is in the community of Cochapamba, El Valle parish, in the southeast part of Cuenca. This area is well-known for its corn production and its tourist attraction: its lake full of bullrushes. Rosa B. is a member of the Cochapamba communal bank. She is a very sociable and cooperative woman; she maintains deep friendships with the other members of th bank. She is just 23 years old and lives with her life partner and her 5 -year-old son. Her husband works in construction Monday through Friday and on weekends he makes deliveries in his van. Thanks to their joint effort, they have managed to build their own home. She raises and sells dressed chickens on order and cattle. She has been in this line of work for two years. She buys them when they are chicks, raises them for a period of time and, once grown, sells them in the free markets or to her neighbors. Rosa has been working with loans from the foundation and it was Gladys Arpi, another member of the bank, that motivated her to be part of this group of enterprising women. She tells us that the loans have been of great use to her because she was able to finish her house and the new loan will allow her to buy more chickens, cattle and feed to continue and grow her business. Her greatest wish is to succeed and give the best to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, cattle and animal feed.

loans.name: Sop

texts.en:
Because of income, Mrs. Sop S., age 58, sells both used and new clothes at the local busy market. From that she is able to feed her family. She doesn’t have a life partner as her husband divorced her when her child was very small. Now her child is grown and can support the family by selling a few groceries. 

Recently Sop S. sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers and she wants to replenish her stock but she lacks capital. She is therefore asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Piniki

texts.en:
Piniki L. is 26 and married with 1 child (2 years-old).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Piniki has 3 years of experience in this business.  Piniki needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Piniki joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Piniki's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Piniki L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Julia Nora

texts.es: Doña Julia vive en el bario Hugo Chavez, tiene 44 años de edaad, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace varios años logro poner con ahorros y dinero de envió que su esposo manda desde el salvador, por la difícil crisis del país, no encontró trabajo el cual emigro al Salvador y de esta manera poder apoyar a sus siete hijos de los cuales solo tres trabajan y los demás estudian y son muchos gastos. Su casa aun no la han logrado terminar por completo, es de concreto y zinc forrado y las divisiones aun son de plástico negro y de tierra, pero por razones de dinero no han logrado hacer las mejoras. Con este financiamiento lograra aumentar el inventario de su venta como: granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, productos enlatados, cereales, gaseosas, para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y con las ganancias ahorrar para poder de esta manera hacer las mejoras de su casa, que es lo que mas desea para sus hijos un techo digno.
texts.en:
Doña Julia lives in the neighbourhood of Hugo Chavez. She is 44 years old and runs a convenience store which she was able to start several years ago with her own savings and money sent to her from El Salvador by her husband. Because of the difficult crisis in the country, he wasn't able to find work so emigrated to El Salvador and in this way was able to support their seven children. Only three of them are working; the others are in school and have many expenses. They still haven't managed to complete their house which is made of concrete and zinc sheeting. The inside walls are still made of black plastic and earth--they haven't managed to find the money to improve them. With this loan Julia will increase the stock in her store. She plans to buy basic grains, milk products, candy, canned goods, cereals, and soft drinks, all of which are regularly asked for by her customers. She will save the profits and use the money to make improvements to the house. Her greatest wish is to have a decent home for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic grains, milk products, candy etc

loans.name: Mohammad Ali

texts.en: Mohammad Ali is a 22-year-old engaged man who is living with his family until he gets married. He lives in Bin Jbeil, southern Lebanon. During the day, he operates a butcher shop. He has been operating his meat trading business since 2006 and has steadily expanded his business. At the beginning, his working capital was low which didn’t allow him to purchase a lot of meat to sell, but through his hard work and determination, as well as his previous two loans, he was able to diversify his merchandise. Today he requested a loan in order to purchase meat for his shop, as well as furnish his new home so that by the time he gets married, all is ready. Mohammad Ali has great communication skills and is a very hard working person.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. YURI,  la socia tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el apoyo a su conyugue que tiene un taller mecánico y prestan todo tipo de  servicio en el taller está ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastían. La socia solicita el préstamo para ayudar en el taller a comprar algunas herramientas.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yuri belongs to the community bank “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción”. She lives in the Anta district in the province of Anta, in the department of Cusco. Yuri is 34 years old and lives with her partner and three children. She attends to her home duties with the help of her husband, who runs an auto repair that offers a complete range of services in the San Sebastian district. Yuri is applying for a loan to help purchase some tools for the auto repair. She is very grateful for the valuable support offered by Kiva and pledges to complete all her repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for an auto repair

loans.name: Vesitacion

texts.en: Vesitacion P., 55 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in selling spices and vegetables. She lives on Aglipay St., Bais City, Negros Oriental with her husband and their six children who are between 12 and 32 years old. Vesitacion is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business selling spices and vegetables, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 45,000. Vesitacion is now borrowing Php 19,500 so that she can continue her selling of spices and vegetables. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Vesitacion aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Estrellas De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Los socios D. esta Alcancía Comunal se dedican a diferentes negocios que les permiten contribuir con la economía en  casa. Teresa trabaja vendiendo ropa hace varios años además venD. ropa a pedidos con sus ingresos aporta con los gastos familiares.

Graciela es concesionaria en un club español hace 11 años, con varios años D. trabajo pudo comprar algunos artefactos que le permiten mejorar su negocio, pero eso no es suficiente así que con el préstamo desea adquirir otros artefactos que necesita para atender a sus clientes. El esfuerzo y la dedicación que ponen en su trabajo hace que los socios se sientan satisfechos ya que su objetivo es el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
The members of this community bank are involved in different businesses which allows them to contribute to their household economies. Teresa has been selling clothes for years, and she also sells clothes upon request. Her earnings proviD. for her household costs. Graciela is a concessionaire at a Spanish club, where she has been for 11 years. Through years of work, she has been able to buy some appliances that have let her improve her business, but it has not been sufficient, so with this loan she hopes to add other appliances that she needs so as to better serve her customers. The effort and the dedication that they give to their work make the members feel satisfied since their goal is the well being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda F. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Erlinda is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Winner Plus Group

texts.en:
“Winner Plus” is a group of 18 owners of small businesses. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.  The group is chaired by Brigitte.

Brigitte sells second-hand clothing and shoes.  She became a micro entrepreneur in 2008. Her business is located in the middle area of Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. 

She has received already one loan from the microfinance institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid it. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy a bundle of second-hand clothing in order to resell it and increase her working capital. Currently she earns a profit of $240 per week. Brigitte is 37 years old, married and the mother of four children aged 3 to 14. Three of them attend school. Her dream is to someday open a transportation enterprise.

loans.use: purchasing a bundle of second hand-clothing to resell in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta G. is a 57-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a farming business. She lives in Sitio Ko-ol, Barangay Cabadiangan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP3,000. 

Violeta is now borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital. This will be her 13TH loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Violeta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
800.00
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

El  socio es el Sr. Juan; el socio tiene 35 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, el socio se dedica al transporte de personas en su moto taxi; El socio trabaja con su propia moto taxi prestando los servicios de transporte. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de nuevo toldo para su moto taxi.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; he lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Juan is 35-years-old. He lives with his partner and has 3 children. He's a taxi driver. He works with his own taxi, offering transportation services. He's requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a new roof for his taxi. He's grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a new roof for his taxi

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard has been practising mixed farming for the last seven years and has employed one farmhand. His mixed farm, which is in Nyamira town, western Kenya, produces maize, milk, coffee and tomatoes which he sells at the local market. He also earns income from his shop and restaurant business in the same location. Benard is 29 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 5 school-aged children.

Benard has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo  to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that he will use the proceeds from this loan to pay school fees for his children. He also hopes to provide enough milk for domestic consumption. His biggest challenge has been pests and diseases which affect his crops and animals.

In five years' time, he hopes to have acquired another piece of land and expand his farm by acquiring more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia M.'s main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 52 years old, married and has seven grown-up children. She is from the village of District II. Sofia has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Sofia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sofia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise. Sofia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Baatarzorig

texts.en:
Baatarzorig C. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Hentiy Province, Mongolia. His two daughters both attend local primary school. Baatarzorig and his wife own a raw materials business in their town where they buy raw materials locally and sell the materials both at the market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and in Nalaih city, in the remote district of Ulaanbaabar, for a profit.

He started his business in 2000 with working capital of 150,000 MNT and has built a stable operation. After years of successful operations he has managed to increase his working capital to a level exceeding 4,000,000 MNT today. Baatarzorig has gained much experience and knowledge over the years, and he hopes to use this experience and knowledge to keep his business growing.

His earnings have enabled him to renovate his house and purchase new furniture. In addition, he has used his earnings to build a new garage which is used for storage of his raw materials. With profits from his enterprise, he has also been able to greatly improve his family's standard of living. Baatazorig is a very helpful and hardworking man who is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials such as sheep and goat's skin, leather and wool, etc. in order to ultimately increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Munhshur

texts.en: Munhshur D. is a 22 year old young lady who lives with her mother and sister in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in their relative's yard. Her mother has been working as a servant in the health organization for many years while her sister currently attends a local school. Muhnshur operates a consumer goods retailing business in a rented stall at the central market of province. She began her business in 2007 with working capital of 400,000 MNT in order to support and improve her family's standard of living. Since then, she has found much success with her new business and her working capital has grown to exceed 1,000,000 MNT today. She would like to grow her business and increase her product line for the future. Moreover she hopes to save money so that her sister can study at university. Munhshur is a modest lady and is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more inventory for her retail trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Angelita's Group

texts.en: Angelita M.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She is 54 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Disimuray, Cauayan City, Isabela. Angelita has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Angelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase breeding livestock. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. Angelita is the leader of an eight member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Emillyn

texts.en: Emillyn, age 30, is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 in order to buy beauty products for her beauty salon. She has been operating the beauty salon for seven years in a busy part of Nairobi. Her clients are ladies. Her desire is to own a production company and she plans to employ many people in her company over the next five years. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has learnt business management. Emillyn is unmarried but looks forward to having her own family someday. She is focused, a go-getter, and a good leader.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Bayar

texts.en:
Bayar is 26 years old and lives with his wife and infant daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They don’t have their own house but they live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent on his parents' land. He has a second-hand microbus (people carrier or van) and got a contract with the transportation authority to carry people on remote bus routes. He has been running his transportation business since 2006.  His wife Solongo works with him as a cashier.

Bayar is a very hardworking and optimistic person whose goal is to extend his business and provide for the necessary expenses of his family.  He also wants to have his own plot of land and a house to live in.

Last year he took a loan from our institution to renew his minivan. This is his second Kiva loan through Credit Mongol and this time he is requesting a loan to purchase some spare parts to repair and service his vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase some spare parts to repair and service his vehicle.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Las Lomas, una localidad situada en la región Piura y ubicada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida y chicha de jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desde épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial de harina de maíz), ella prepara los alimentos y la bebida en su domicilio y la ofrece en venta en su domicilio los días viernes, sábados y domingos. El negocio tiene buena acogida por la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas y a que  la chicha es bastante consumida en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores de su localidad tienen por costumbre consumir chicha antes de iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos para seguir preparando comida y chicha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira is a 38 year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the agricultural district of Las Lomas which is located in Piura region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Rosa makes and sells meals and 'chicha de jora' (a traditional drink from this country which has been made since ancient times from a special type of corn flour).  She prepares the meals and drink in her home and offers them for sale in her home on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.  Her business is very popular because of the good taste of her meals and because 'chicha' is widely consumed in the area, above all during celebrations and festivities.  In addition, the workers in her town are in the habit of drinking 'chicha' before they start work since they believe that it gives them energy.

Rosa would like to expand her business by acquiring more supplies so that she can continue preparing her meals and 'chicha'.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will allow her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To expand her business by acquiring more supplies so that she can continue preparing meals and 'chicha'

loans.name: Liz Danisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liz Danisa; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa interior al por mayor como polos y medias, la socia reparte a las diferentes tiendas que venden la ropa interior, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la tienda de venta de ropa interior. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa interior al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Liz Danisa is a member of the communal bank, "Jose Carlos Mariategui." The bank is located in the Urubamba district of Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Liz Danisa is a 33-year-old single mother of four children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothing such as polo shirts and stockings at wholesale. She delivers her goods to different clothing stores and would like to grow and improve her clothing sales business. Liz Danisa has requested this loan in order to purchase clothing at wholesale.

She is glad to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man living with his parents and four siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a concrete carpenter for more than five years. In 2008, he started to work as a freelance carpenter for different construction projects. He works with his father and one brother to keep the family’s financial status in good shape. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase some wood so he can enlarge his business by increasing his income.

loans.use: To purchase some wood for his work

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
la sra. Karla M. es una mujer muy responsable, honrada y dedicada a su trabajo propio, el cual es la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, vende su producto a varios negocios de su misma comunidad ya que le hacen pedidos todas las semanas y tambien hace entregas en la frontera del Espino, ahi tiene una gran cantidad de  
personas que le compran sus rosquillas, esto hace que su negocio tenga muy buena demanda.
Karla todos los dias se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para poder sacer todos los pedidos que le hacen durante todas las semanas, cuenta con el apoyo de su mama para la elaboracion de las rosquillas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, queso y manteca para tener una mayor produccion de rosquillas y asi tener mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Karla M. is a very responsible and honest woman who is dedicated to her work of making and selling cookies. She sells her product to various businesses in her community that place orders every week. Karla also makes deliveries along the Espino border where there are a great number of people who buy cookies, creating great demand for her business.

Karla wakes up every day at 3am so that she can move forward with all of the orders that she must complete throughout the week. She has the help of her mother with making the cookies. This loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, cheese, and butter so that she can increase her production of cookies and generate more income needed to move her family forward.

loans.use: Purchase corn, cheese, butter, and firewood

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Cuando el esposo D. la Sra. Rogelia quedo sin trabajo ella vio la necesidad D. apoyarlo y la mejor manera D. hacerlo fue empezar a ahorrar para poner un negocio su mama le ofreció un kiosco que tenia ahí empezó con la venta D. ropa  compro varias prendas  que empezó a ofrecer  ala gente que pasaba por el lugar así D. a pocos fue aumentando su capital  ahora es conocida y muchas personas le hacen pedidos  también les da a sus clientes facilidades D. pago D. esa manera gana mas clientes ahora quiere incursionar en
 la venta D. sandalias en esta época D. verano  hay mucha demanda D. ese producto justamente es para eso que usara el préstamo D. EDAPROSPO,  también esta próxima a trasladar su negocio a su propia casa para lo cual esta acondicionando un local apropiado.Como parte del grupo “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO”  esta logrando muchas cosas y eso la hace sentir bien y con ganas D. seguir trabajando.

* Rogelia es la primera D. las sentadas con polo naranja.
texts.en:
When her husband lost his job, Sra. Rogelia saw the need to help him. The best way was to begin saving so that she could start a business. Her mother gave her a kiosk where she could start selling clothes. Rogelia bought various garments and began offering them to people who passed by her establishment. Her capital gradually increased and now she is well-known. Many customers place orders with her, and since she offers payment options, she has been able to gain even more customers.

Rogelia now wants to venture into selling sandals for the summer season since there is great demand for these products. It is precisely for this purpose which she will use her loan from EDAPROSPO. In addition, she plans to move her business to her home since it is equipped to house a store. As a member of the group “Mujeres Rumbo al Progreso” (Women Toward Progress), Rogelia has accomplished many things and feels good about being able to continue working.

*Rogelia is the first woman seated wearing an orange polo shirt.

loans.use: Purchase sandals for summer

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Salim has operated a business selling charcoal for the past seven years, selling at retail to his neighbors and passersby. Salim faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

Salim plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo L. M. es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace 4 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, en este momento el desea remodelar la cocina ya que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado el cual necesita unas mejoras para que se vea en mejores condiciones. Para esto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Pablo L. M. is a very hard-working man who acquired a publicly-subsidized house four years ago.  Right now, he would like to remodel his kitchen since it has deteriorated over time.  He needs to make some improvements in order to restore it to a good condition.  For this, he needs to buy building supplies and hire laborers to carry out the work.

loans.use: to remodel his kitchen

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Duong V. has been a high-skill construction foreman for over five years and lives with other family members in a small house located in the rural area of Siem Reap, a province of Cambodia. His wife sells a few types of dessert from home to earn an income. They have six children, four of whom are married.  Two of their children own a boat that they use to provide a taxi service along the river to help support the family. Duong V. will use his loan to buy wooden poles for building a house.

loans.use: to buy wooden poles for building a house.

loans.name: 79 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Nụ N. Thị is a 22 year-old female who lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 79 Quảng Hưng (18-05-79 Quảng Hưng).

Nụ is married and has one infant-aged child. To making a living, she owns and operates a general store. Nu’s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

Nụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nu is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. This is her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nụ plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  H. Thị Liên is an 18 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

2.  N. Thị Tâm  is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene  43 años de edad es madre soltera de  una pequeña niña. Esperanza vive en su propia casa en el pueblo joven (comunidad de personas de condición pobre, cuyas casas están en desarrollo)  9 de Octubre de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Esperanza  tiene una peluquería que funciona en su domicilio, ubicado cerca al mercado de la comunidad, lo que es un beneficio para ella puesto que le genera una buena afluencia de clientes y ya cuenta con clientes fijos. 

Además los fines de semana desde el jueves hasta el domingo, Esperanza,  trabaja en una peluquería  en el centro de la ciudad, este es un ingreso adicional para ella. Sus 10 años de experiencia le han dado a Esperanza frutos en su labor.

Esperanza solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles que invertirá  en comprar mercadería como tintes y cremas  para el cabello, líquido para ondulación  y cosméticos.

Esperanza es un cliente que siempre ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa, ella comenzó con pequeños créditos, cuya buena administración le sirvió para capitalizar su negocio y este préstamo le servirá para atender la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 43 years old and she is a single mother of a little girl. Esperanza lives in her own home in the new district (a community of poor people whose homes are being constructed) of 9 de Octubre in the city of Chiclayo. 

Esperanza has a beauty salon that she has in her house. It is located near the community market which is an advantage for her because it generates an affluence of clients and she also has steady clients.

On the weekends, from Thursday to Sunday, Esperanza works at a beauty salon in the city's downtown. This is an additional source of income for her. Her 10 years' experience have helped her see the fruits of her labor.

Esperanza is a client who has always worked with Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). She started with small loans and through sound administration they have helped her business succeed. This loan will help her meet the demand of her clients.

loans.use: to purchase hair dyes, skin lotions, and cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 51-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 26 and 24. She and her husband are both farmers. She helps till their land where they grow rice crops. According to Gloria, she has been engaged in farming for 20 years. She earns about 4,000 PHP per month from farming. Gloria also raises pigs in her backyard.

Gloria's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and pig feed. In the future, she hopes to have her own capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 32 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta conserviciosólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, negocio que se encuentra en su domicilio, pero que también lo ofrece de casa en casa a sus vecinos desde hace varios años.  Estos productos es para que las personas mejoren su imagen perosnal, también labora en una ONG que es otroingresoque recibe para cubrir las  necesidades de su hogar.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de productos y les pueda seguir ofertando a sus clientes y para inmobiliario para exibir sus productos. Con los ingresos de la venta de todos sus productos de belleza cubriría el préstamo brindado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Rosa es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, alegre y responsable con laúnica idea de seguir superandose en la vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home.  The only service the house receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Rosa sells beauty products through a catalog.  Her business is located in her home but she has also been making sales door to door to her neighbors for several years.  She sells products which help people to improve their personal image.  Rosa also works for an NGO which is another source of income  she has for covering her household needs.

Rosa has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the money to buy a larger quantity of products that she will be able to continue offering to her customers.  She will also buy furniture for displaying her products.  With the income she makes from selling all her beauty products, Rosa will be able to repay her loan and improve her quality of life.  Rosa is very well known as a hard-working, cheerful and responsible woman whose only goal is to continue doing well in life.

loans.use: to buy furniture and more beauty products to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new clothes and buy pet animals such as canaries, pigeons, etc.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastián es una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su actividad económica. Hace más de 39 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de sastrería, el ha sabido administrar su negocio y la mayoría de sus clientes saben que el ofrece un excelente servicio con sus prendas. El empieza su labor desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche el confecciona pantalones, camisas, trajes uniformes entre otros. El crédito es para la compra de materia prima como telas, zipper, botones, hilos, agujas, tijeras entre otros.
texts.en: Sebastián is a very hard-working person who enjoys his work.  For more than 39 years he has been providing a tailoring service.  He has known how to run his business and most of his customers know that he offers an excellent service.  He starts working at 7.00am and works until 9.00pm, making pants, shirts, suits, uniforms, etc.  He will use this loan to buy raw materials such as fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, needles, scissors, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, needles, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 55 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es exportar los productos.

Le gusta escuchar musica y bailar.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 55 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) meet in the neighborhood of San Luis de Zapotal, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Oswaldo is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his products at the AGRIPAC commercial center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan he is requesting will be used for planting corn and rice. He plans to buy seeds and compost for his corn and rice crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops and the lack of money to pay for more workers. His dream is to export his products.

Oswaldo enjoys listening to music and dancing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost for planting corn and rice.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 20,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 52 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are in school. Merilyn is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 31 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farm.

Merilyn requested a 27,000 Philippine pesos loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Merilyn would like to build up and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina: de 60 años de edad ella se dedica a la elavoracin de tejidos a mano,desde hace 25 años ademas de de dicarse a esta actividad se dedica a la agricultura de ortalizas,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos a mano, ya que esta conciente de que le falta capital para trabajar.
texts.en:
Valentina is 60 years old and makes hand-woven articles. She has been in this business for 25 years. In addition, she grows vegetables.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for making hand-woven articles. Valentina is aware that she lacks capital for her work.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving.

loans.name: Mahoude Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUDE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Assiba Odile, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Assiba Odile est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de William. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Assiba Odile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Il y a près de huit ans que Assiba Odile mène  comme activité la vente de produits cosmétiques et des mèches dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Assiba Odile vend des chaussures, ce qui lui permet d'avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. Assiba Odile achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Assiba Odile désire obtenir un autre financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUDE.
texts.en:
The MAHOUDE group is made up of three people who live in the same area of Benin. The representative of this group, named Assiba Odile, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the third time that this group has requested financial support from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their business. 

Assiba Odile is married to a mechanic named William. The couple has three dependent children who live with them and are all in school. Assiba Odile lives together with her children and her husband. The couple works together to support their family. Assiba Odile has been conducting the business of selling cosmetic products and highlights in her neighborhood for nearly eight years. 

Alongside this business, Assiba Odile sells shoes, which allows her to have several sources of income. Assiba Odile buys her products in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and better respond to the needs of her customers, Assiba Odile would like to obtain another round of funding, together with the other members of MAHOUDE group.

loans.use: to buy highlights, cosmetics, and shoes

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old and lives with her three school-aged children in the province of Isabela. Maribel describes herself as being an exacting, punctual woman.



She works with the help of her husband in her store, a business she started twenty years ago. She is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP. The loan she’s requesting at present is to buy merchandise for her store. With this supply of merchandise she will increase sales and income at the same time. Her dream is to enlarge the store, implementing more services to obtain higher income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, spices and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom (in the photo) and her husband, Maly, live in a village along National Road Number 5, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: one son and three daughters. 

Mom sells grocery items at her home. Her husband is a construction worker. She is applying for her second loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Juan Cancio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD”; Las reuniones del banco son cada treinta días en el distrito de Wanchaq perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan, él nació en la ciudad de Chinchero, él tiene 58 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos para autos. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, Sr. Juan trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja ya que a la vez también cuenta con un taller de mecánica siendo el socio quien se ocupa de este negocio, el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su tienda de repuestos como accesorios de autos alfombras, siliconas, espejos, pistones, anillos, empaques, radiadores, embriagues, carburadores y otras cosas más.  

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the “Unión Fuerza y Amistad” communal bank which meets every thirty days in Wanchaq District which belongs to Cusco Province and Department.


Juan was born in the city of Chinchero; he’s 58 years old and is in a common law relationship and has two children.  He alternates his daily chores with a business selling car spare parts.  His business is located in his home.  He works together with his spouse because he also has a car repair shop that he takes care of himself.  He is a very cheerful person who very much wants to get ahead for his family.  He’s been in this business four years now and does very well thanks to the efforts he puts into his work.


He requests the loan to buy more merchandise for his spare parts business like car mats, silicone lubricants, mirrors, pistons, rings, seals, radiators, brakes, carburetors and other things.  He is happy with the loan and commits to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 31 years old, married and blessed with a five-year-old child.  He earns a living by providing transportation services, and has done well in a competitive environment by providing excellent customer service. He supplements his income by raising cows, and is applying for a loan for 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two new diary cows to add to his herd.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows to add to his herd.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 31 years old and wants a loan to buy cattle for reselling. Having been a cattle trader for 5 years, he believes this is the business that will enable him to educate his five children and help him build a permanent home. He faces hardships of high transport and fuel cost, and his dream is to expand to new markets. John needs the loan facility to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 51-year-old married man with five children. He is residing at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. 

Rogelio operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, planting and harvesting mangoes for sale to earn a living. He has been six years in this business. Each month, he earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

He requested a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Rogelio has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Rogelio wants to make improvements to his house and for his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, 38, is married to James and they are blessed with three children, who are school going. She operates a school in Githurai 44. She has been in this business for the last seven years and earns an income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) per month.

Lucia has a good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her third loan of 80,000 KES, which she plans to use to renovate the school and buy textbooks. She will use the extra profit to educate her children.

Lucia hopes to expand the business. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to renovate the school and buy textbooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the first fees of a new moto taxi

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix de 50 años de edad casado con Gregoria de 50 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos con los que viven  muy feliz en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Chuvivana del distrito de Sivia.  Félix es un hombre muy trabajador de personalidad sencilla y muy amable, Él se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga, del distrito de Sivia hacia el centro poblado de Chuvivana, pero en ocasiones también lo contratan para traér mercadería. Él garantiza un buen servicio, generalmente trabaja juntamente con un ayudante pero en otras ocasiones le acompaña su querida esposa. Él está contento con esta labor que realiza por que gracias al flete que pagan sus clientes viene creciendo paulatinamente. Félix  en un futuro desea mejorar personalmente, y abrir su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes ya que no tendría ningún inconveniente en el traslado de sus mercadería y así su esposa sería quien administre dicho negocio. Además la familia ya contaría con un ingreso más.
