Este será su segundo credito por lo que se compromete una vez más en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería para poder implementar su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Félix is 50 years old. He is married to Gregoria, also 50. From their marriage they have 2 children, with whom they live very happily in their own home located in the community of Chuvivana of the Sivia district.  Félix is a very hardworking man with a simple and very kind personality. He has a service transporting cargo from the district of Sivia to the  community of Chuvivana, but at times he is hired to bring merchandise. He guarantees good service and generally works with a helper, but at times works with his beloved wife. He is happy with the work he does because thanks to the shipping fee his customers pay him, his business is growing slowly. In the future, Félix wants to open his own business selling groceries, since he wouldn't have any trouble transporting his merchandise and his wife would manage the business. In addition, his family would have one more source of income.

This will be his second loan and he is once again committed to making his payments on time. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy merchandise to stock his new business.

loans.use: to buy various products to stock his small grocery store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 60-year-old married woman. She lives in Cabalayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Norma plants, harvests. and sells bananas for a living. She has been in the business for 20 years and earns 5,000 a month. She has requested a loan of 20,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2007, Norma joined GDMPC to seek assistance to improve her business. She hopes to improve their living condition and to put aside a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Elena de 59 años de edad es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, ella es viuda y tiene 04 hijos independientes. Para salir adelante Elena se ha dedicado a distintas actividades comerciales, como a la venta de abarrotes y de útiles escolares, actualmente brinda servicio de cocina, la cual lleva trabajando de esta manera más 07 años, gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su nieto con su educación. El deseo de Elena es de habilitar un espacio en su vivienda donde, pueda ofrecer bebidas como gaseosas, agua mineral y cervezas pues así asegura tendrá mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para gastos de medicamentos para su nieto ya que se encuentra delicado de salud.  Elena agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en:
Elena, 59, is a responsible, hardworking woman.  She’s a widow and has four independent children.  To get ahead, Elena has worked in a variety of commercial activities like selling groceries and school supplies.  She currently works as a cook and has been working at this for seven years.  Thanks to her effort and work she’s managed to improve her house and support her grandson’s education.  

Elena would like to equip a room in her house to sell beverages like soft-drinks, mineral water and beer because she’s sure to have more profits that way.  On his occasion, she asked for the loan to buy medicine for her grandson who is currently in delicate health.  Elena thanks Kiva lenders for supporting people like her.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her grandson.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus, father of 1, is a  retail businessman plying his trade in Bushenyi. 
He has been bearing a hand in this trade for close to 2 years.
This is quite a short time but he is upbeat about his future prospects.
At his shop, he sells general merchandise retail stock such as maize flour, soft drinks, rice, beans, peas, soap, sugar, etc
He says he will bank on this kiva loan to purchase more maize flour, soft drinks, bread, rice, beans, etc to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, soft drinks, bread, rice, beans, etc to resell

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BIDOSSESSI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Jeanne, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 34 ans est mariée à un mécanicien nommé Franck. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Jeanne et son mari. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Jeanne vend des divers (sucre, lait, biscuits) et des vivres depuis dix ans. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mercy wants to start a retail shop, which sells household products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has two children that attend school. She is educated up to level 12. She has been trained in business management and loan use by the Rural Agency for Development (Rafode). She started her restaurant business in 2003 and she has managed the business successfully to date.

She is seeking a loan to buy restaurant equipment which will enable her prepare a variety of food to cater to all her customer’s tastes.

She will use the profit to buy medical insurance for the family and buy a cow for her father at home.

loans.use: Buy restaurant equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old and has a small shop to sell spare parts in the industrial city of Kirkuk. He supports a big family including his father and mother. This is his first loan from AL-Aman. He wants to borrow $1200 to purchase more goods to sell in Kirkuk. He wants to develop himself and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: José De Jesús

texts.es:
José de Jesús is from the town of Linares, Nuevo León. He is married and has six children, all between the ages of 1 and 12 years old. His mother liked to raise quail and she came to have as many as 40 of them. People began to ask her for eggs and the birds themselves, so she decided to formalize her business. Soon after, she asked José to run it for her. With the help of his wife and his two oldest sons, he has been able to make the business successful. He now has Japanese quail and demand is high. He has also started making and selling jam, which has brought in many clients due to the good quality of the product.

So that he might continue growing his business, José is requesting a loan of $375.00. He will use it to buy labels and jars to improve the appearance of the products he sells. He will return the loan in a period of 6 months. Be a part of this business and decide to help this family. They are very thankful for the support you are able to give them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

José de Jesús es originario de la localidad de Linares, Nuevo León, está casado y tiene seis hijos entre 1 y 12 años de edad. A su madre le gustaba criar codornices y llego a tener hasta 40, después comenzaron a solicitarle huevos y aves, así que decidió formalizar su negocio y al poco tiempo le pidió a José que se hiciera cargo, con la ayuda de su esposa y sus dos hijos mayores él ha logrado sacar adelante este negocio, ahora tiene un criadero de codorniz japonesa con una alta demanda. También ha iniciado con la elaboración y venta de conserva, donde gracias a la calidad de sus productos ha logrado ganar muchos clientes.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de etiquetas y envases para mejorar la imagen de los productos que comercializa, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de este negocio y decídete a ayudar a esta familia ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve the appearance of his products

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita O. is a mother of four and she is forty years old. She runs a food stall business and she sells at the new market from Monday to Saturday. With her husband working as a taxi driver, she decided to have this food stall business in order to help her husband in terms of income for their family.

Anita earns more than three hundred tala profit a week from her business. From this she supports her children’s school and other family needs as well as her loan payment. She is so pleased to have S.P.B.D. to back up her small business' financial needs and she is looking forward to more loans in order to improve her business and her family as well.

loans.use: To buy mutton flaps, turkey tails, tomato sauce, foil, plastic plates, and other supplies for her food stall

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Mrs. Sambath Y., 25, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works in her rice paddy growing rice crops, while her husband works as a fisherman, earning collectively around $8.20 per day in revenue. This couple hopes the loan of $1000 will help them purchase a boat for their fishery and the leftover of the money is to buy cows and pigs to breed, so that they can generate additional profits in the next six to seven months.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and livestock to breed

loans.name: Finè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Finè O. is married and the mother of four children. Her principal business venture is selling cooked food (a restaurant serving African cuisine). She needs to be able to stock grains and other foodstuffs for use in her little restaurant. To resolve the problems she encounters in managing her restaurant, she is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that she can satisfy her customers' needs in a timely manner. This loan will allow her to buy bags of corn, vegetables, and condiments to have on hand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 35, Madame O. Finè est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de denrées alimentaires (restaurant à la cuisine africaine). Son programme à travers ce projet est de s’approvisionner en produits alimentaires et céréales pour son restaurant. Pour résoudre un certain nombre de problèmes qu’elle rencontre dans l’exercice de son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 afin de pouvoir satisfaire dans les délais les commandes de ses clients. Ceci lui permettra de s’approvisionner en sacs de maïs, légumes, et autres condiments.

loans.use:
Buying food ingredients for her little restaurant

Approvisionnement en produit alimentaire pour son restaurant

loans.name: Kirinyabigo Ii(C) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Madina is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She sells used clothes for a living. She wants to use the extra profit to pay school fees for her child.

Alice offers tailoring services and wants to use the loan to buy more sewing machines.

Madina sells new clothes and intends to increase her stock with the loan.

Betty has a retail shop business.

Hellen is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to purchase more chicks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is 23 years of age, married and has a young child. She works as a hostess in Rostipollos (a restaurant) helping to organize fun games for kids around the piñatas. Her husband works as a cable TV installer and both their incomes help them to maintain their small home. Times are tough even with two incomes because the Nicaraguan economy is currently going through a difficult cycle.

Ana Maria and her husband are not able to afford taking their child to Rostipollos to celebrate his birthday, but they wish to make their home as comfortable as possible for him. Ana would like to repaint the interior with colors that would match her boys´ eyes and to repair the leaking roof with new zinc plates.

With the microloan they are requesting they hope to be able to improve the living conditions in their humble home

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Amador is a butcher and he has an established post in the market in the city of La Merced. Each morning he offers a great variety of meat after going to make sure that the meat gets its quality certificate and can be distributed. He has a rented space and paying this does not help him to achieve his dream of buying his own small house, as the rent is very high. He would like a post so that he will soon be able to achieve his much anticipated dream.

Translated from Spanish by Li z Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

AMADOR, es carnicero y su puesto está establecido en el mercado de ciudad de La Merced, en el que todas las mañanas oferta una gran variedad de carnes después de ir al camal en el que se encargan de certificar la calidad y su distribución. Él se desemP. en un espacio alquilado y el pago del mismo no lo ayuda a alcanzar el sueño de adquirir una pequeña casita ya que el costo del alquiler en este mercado es muy elevado, desea comprar un puesto de ventas para desempeñarse de mejor manera a fin de alcanzar en poco tiempo su ansiado sueño.

loans.use: To buy a space to sell/Compra de un espacio de ventas.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Driven by her desires to get ahead and her great desire to continue with the family business, Elsa decided to dedicate herself to the making of wool sweaters by machine. With the support of her parents and siblings, they have formed a small company that now has prospered quite a bit. Right now they are focusing on making school sweaters and when that season ends they will focus on making sweaters for women and men of diverse styles. She is always aware of the latest styles and designs and wants to take advantage of this period that has just recently started to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Movida por los deseos de superación y el gran deseo de continuar con el negocio familiar, Elsa, decidió dedicarse a la confección de chompas de lana a máquina. Con apoyo de sus padres y hermanos han formado una microempresa que hoy ha prosperado bastante y se dedican ahora a la confección de chompas escolares, cuando esta temporada acaba se dedicarán a la confección de chompas para damas y caballeros de diversos modelos y siempre pendiente de las ultimas tendencias y diseños, quiere aprovechar esta época que hace poco ha dado inicio y aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase her production

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29 year-old Emelda M.. She is married, and has two children ages 3 and 8. In 2000, Emelda established her butcher shop business. Emelda requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of beef in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFIA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beef in bulk.

loans.name: Gumchagul

texts.ru:
Gumchagul R. livest in the area Rudaki. She works in one of the dining rooms/restaurants of the city Dushanbe. She is the cook there. She wishes to receive a loan to update her stock in the kitchen. She also wants to buy products that would not spoil, such as flour, sugar, etc. This will help to improve the quality of the service and to involve new clients. Gumchagul is not married, and lives with her elderly mother and young son. She is the main supporter of her family, but not looking at her hardships she is very kind and happy.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Рахимова Гумчагуль проживает в районе Рудаки. Работает в одной из столовых города Душанбе. Работает поваром. Хочет получить кредит и обновить инвентарь на кухне. Кроме того хочет закупить непортящиеся продукты. Такие как мука , сахар и др. Это поможет улучшить качество обслуживания и привлечь новых клиентов. Гумчагуль не замужем. Живет со своей старой мамаой и маленьким сыном. Она одна является кормильцем семьи , но не смотря на это она очень добрая и веселая .

loans.use: To buy products and create an inventory

loans.name: Mediha

texts.en:
Mediha is a 30-year-old woman living in Gračanica. She is married and has one 3-year-old daughter. Her husband works in construction and finds work when he can during the summer season. He typically doesn't work in the winter, so they try to save what he makes in the summer to last them the whole year. Other than his salary they do not have many other sources of income right now.

This is Meiha’s first loan with Žene za Žene, which she has requested in the amount of 1200 KM (US$ 975). She plans to use this money towards cultivating her fields for growing more eggplants, a very popular vegetable here in Bosnia. She will need to purchase some pesticides to protect her plants over the next months, and also hopes to buy a sprinkler system for the fields. Mediha is pictured here by her land, part of which is already sown. She hopes to make a good profit here and use their earnings to make finishing touches on the home she and her husband have built for their family.

loans.use: To use towards cultivating field for eggplants

loans.name: Francisco Roberti

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco Guzman devotes himself to the sale of general medicine; he has his own pharmacy which is located at his residence in the municipality of El Viejo, in the city of Chinandega. This gentleman has been characterized as being a great father because he has managed to provide and education for his three school age children.

Currently he is seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan for the purpose of acquiring supplies and continuing to offer products to his customers. This loan will not only benefit both his business and family but allow him to continue providing an education for his small ones.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el señor Francisco G. es a la venta de medicamentos generales teniendo su propia farmacia el cual atiende en su casa de habitación en el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Este caballero se ha caracterizado por ser un excelente padre ya que ha logrado mantener los estudios a sus tres pequeños hijos en edad escolar.

Actualmente busca un apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el propósito de adquirir la mercadería y continuar ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes. Con este credito se beneficia tanto su negocio como su familia porque se le permite continuar con el mantenimiento de los estudios de sus pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase pharmaceuticals

loans.name: 23 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de Villa Exaltación  a éste pertenece, la asociación “23 de marzo”, integrada 17 mujeres ansiosas de progresar en sus pequeños negocios.
La mayoría en el grupo son casadas y afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus parejas en la economía del hogar, ya que tienen un promedio de 4 niños , muchas de ellas por distintos motivos, se separaron de su pareja y tuvieron  que hacerse cargo de su familia por lo que necesitan mayores recursos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. La actividad principal en la asociación “23 de marzo” es la costura de edredones, sabanas y también la confección de camisas, ropa deportiva y otros, estas prendas las comercializan al  Perú, las venden al por mayor. Ellas precisan capital para comprar materia prima en mayor cantidad de ésta manera aumentar su producción y generar mayores ganancias para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
In the city of El Alto there you will find a central region called Villa Exaltacion and belonging to this region is the Association "23 Marzo" and it is composed of 12 women dreaming of making their small business grow. The majority of the group are married and they indicate that they need to help their partners with the household finances. They average 4 children per family and many of the women, for various reasons, have separated from their partner and had to care for the family themselves and are faced with the need for greater resources to cover their children's necessities. The primary goal of Association "23 Marzo" is the production of bed linens and bedding sets as well as the production of shirts, sports attire among other items. These things are sold in Peru and they also sell their items wholesale. They hope to acquire with their new capital materials in greater quantities to increase their production and generate greater earnings for the good of their family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials in greater quantities.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa J. sells women's shirts at the market. She has done this for many years. Her shirts are very good and cheap and that's why she has many clients. She has always wanted to expand her business, and now she can by borrowing money.

loans.use: Purchasing women's shirts for sale.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira G. is a widow with three children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Khodjali region. Elmira is settled in the Absheron region.

Elmira has a business and needs 970 AZN to buy wares to improve the business.

loans.use: To buy wares

loans.name: En

texts.en: En N., 58, is a widow who lives with two of her children in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She is a butcher who makes $5 a day.  She is also supported by her children, who work in garment factories.  She would like to take out a loan of $500 to purchase more pigs for her business. (She pictured with her daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase pigs for her shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph K. N. is forty-three years old, married and a father with five children, who are currently all in school. He is a very hard working young man and artisan who designs and manufactures baking bowls for bread and trunks to store goods, etc. Joseph has been in this business for the past 20 years in the community market of Babiani, where he lives with his family.

Coal pots are used in many Ghanaians' homes as cooking burners are expensive to buy. Trunks are mostly purchased by parents who have their wards in the boarding house because it is safe and secure to keep your goods in them. Joseph said business is doing very well due to the strategic location he founds himself in the market but he is refusing to be complacent. Joseph is worried about the frequent increases in the price of raw materials retarding his business progress. However, he is convinced that with the loan he can buy stock of materials like steel, paints, rods, metals and others to increase his inventory. He believes this would help him even in the face of high prices in the cost of raw materials.

Joseph is pleading for your assistance to realize his dream for giving his children a better education for their future prospects. He also believes the loan would help him to buy machines for the cutting of the metals, to ease the stress he goes through. His picture was taken when he was selling one of his trunks made for his customer.

loans.use: Joseph wants the loan to buy materials like steel, paints, and brushes

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir K. is a member of Kisakya mukama in Kikajjo.  He is a 27-year-old, single man who operates a motorcycle (bodaboda) business.  In fact, he notes that he has been in this line of business for 2 years from the Namasuba stage.  Moreover, he explains that he takes care of his elderly grandparents, who were kind enough to care for him after he lost his parents at a very young age. 

This is the second loan he has sought with his group, and he plans to use the loan proceeds to repair his motorcycle.  He dreams of owning more motorcycles, which will enable him to improve his standard of living.  In the future, he plans to marry a woman, but only if he has achieved something in life, such as buying a plot of land and constructing a house to provide shelter for his future wife and kids.

loans.use: To improve his business by repairing his motorcycle

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia O. sells beef. She purchases cattle, slaughters them and sells the meat products. She hopes to be able meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more cattle to process and sell. Patricia is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Ulcha

texts.ru: Ульча женщина в возросте 51 год , замужем ,имеет пятерых детей.Сама Ульча полностью занимается откормом и продажей скота.У неё сейчас пять коров, которые дают молоко.Ульча сама мастерица производства домашнего кефира. У неё очень много клиентов.Ульча узнав от соседей, что можно в кредит увеличить скот, она решила обратится в Микроинвест.При мониторинге было выявлено, что все данные соответствуют явному и Ульча имеет положительный моральный облик, который подходит по критериям клиентов Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Ulcha is 51 years old, married and has five children. She is involved solely in raising and selling livestock. She now has five dairy cows that supply milk. Ulcha is an expert at cooking home-made kefir. She has many customers. Having learnt from neighbors that she can obtain a loan in order to increase her livestock headcount, Ulcha reached out to MicroInvest. Business monitoring showed all given facts to be true, and Ulcha has a positive image, suitable to MicroInvest client criteria.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Zenzontle Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  María Teresa L., Milagros de los Angeles F., Alma Nubia C. L. y Elba Rosa S..

El grupo solidario Zenzontle está  conformado por las señores: Doña María Teresa L. quien tiene una minipulpería en su casa, con el crédito logró comprar más productos para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Ella es mujer sola con dos hijas, estas le ayudan en el negocio y así ella puede salir a comprar al mercado. Piensa que con el crédito logrará tener una pulpería más grande.
Doña Milagros de los Angeles, es una madre soltera que vive con sus dos hijos jóvenes, ellos le ayudan en su negocio que es la elaboración de hamacas, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y ella se lo ha enseñado a sus hijos. Sueña con tener un buen taller y darle estudios secundarios a sus hijos.
Doña Alama Nubia C. L. tiene una pequeña panadería en su casa, ella procesa el pan y lo vende en su casa, entrega a varios clientes que le compran al por mayor, con sus tres hijos varones ella no contrata ayudantes porque aprovecha la mano de obra familiar, sus hijos son jóvenes que estudian y ayudan en el negocio. Su esposo trabaja en taller de calzado y le ayuda a los gastos del hogar.Espera con el crédito comprar materia prima como harina, azúcar y leña para el horno.
 Doña Elba Rosa S. es la coordinadora del grupo, ella tiene una pulpería en su casa, ofrece productos de primera necesidad , compra los productos en el mercado. Ella tiene dos hijas, una de ellas cursa el ultimo año de la universidad y la otra de 16 años que terminará el bachillerato. Con mucho sacrificio ha logrado que sus hijas estudien porque su esposo la abandonó y ella ha tenido que suplir todas las necesidades.
Viven en condiciones de vida humildes, llegaron a trabajar con Adim por una promoción que se hizo en la comarca y les gustó la forma de trabajar porque ellas no tienen garantías que dar para un crédito y en Adim se les dio confianza.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: María Teresa L., Milagros de los Angeles F., Alma Nubia C. L. and Elba Rosa S.. María Teresa L. is part of the supportive group, Zenzontle. She has a mini market in her house. With a loan she was able to buy more products to meet her customers’ needs. She is single and has two daughters. They help her with the business so that she can go shopping at the market. With this loan she thinks she will be able to have a bigger store. Milagros de los Angeles is a single mother who lives with her two adolescent children. They help her with her business of making hammocks. She learned this trade from her parents, and she is teaching her children. She dreams of having a good shop and giving her children a high school education. Alama Nubia C. L. has a small bakery in her house. She makes and sells the bread in her house. She sells to customers who buy wholesale. With three sons, she does not hire helpers. She takes advantage of the familial helping hands. Her sons go to school and help with the business. Her husband works in a shoe shop and helps with household expenses. With the loan she will buy flour, sugar and wood for the stove. Elba Rosa S. is the coordinator of the group. She has a store in her house. She sells basic necessities, which she buys at the market. She has two daughters. One is in her last year at the University. The other, 16, will be finishing high school. It took great sacrifice to be able to educate her daughters because her husband abandoned her. She was responsible for supplying them with all of the necessities. Their living conditions are humble. They came to work with Adim through a promotion done in the region. They liked the way Adim works. They do not have collateral for a loan, but Adim had faith in them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products like: grains, dairy products, bread, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат, женщина, которая кредитуется второй раз.Она замужем, имеет троих детей. Саломат  живёт в городе Костакозе, занимается продажей детской одежды по районам: Мастча, Канибадам, Лохути.Она утверждает , что в этих районах потребность большая и продажа идёт хорошо.Следующий займ она хочет потратить на завоз летнего ассортимента товара.На снимке Саломат в день выдачи.Первый свой кредит она погасила пунктуально без нарушений.Саломат рада сотрудничать с Микроинвест для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Salomat is a woman who is taking out a loan for the second time. She is married and has three children. Salomat lives in Kostakoz and sells children’s clothing in the regions: Mastcha, Kanibadam, Lohuti. She insists that in these regions demand is high and sales are going well. She would like to use her next loan to purchase a summer assortment of products. In the photo is Salomat on the day that she received her loan. She paid off her first loan on time without any violations. Salomat is happy to work with MicroInvest in order to grow her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Tuzinduke Group

texts.en:
Khadija has owned a small shop in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She belongs to Tuzinduke group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 530. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Khadija is 36 years old, married, and has six children: ages 10, 9, 7, 6, 5 and 3. She also cares for three additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Ashura, who has her own small business (working as a dressmaker) in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more items to add her current stock

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia J. is currently in the business of selling dresses at the shop and is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. Alia is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a pastor. She has 1 child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a bus to carry passengers from town to town. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Résidente à baguida qui est une petite ville non loin de Lomé, cette femme a entamé en 2008 le commerce des habits, elle a appris la couture ce qui lui permet de confectionner des habits pour les revendre, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente des ustensiles de cusine, vu la manière dont ce commerce est rentable, elle voudrait l’agrandir et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 37 pièces de tissus, 17 habits pour dame, 10 boubous pour homme et quelques ustensiles de cuisine.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
A resident of Baguida, a small city not far from Lomé, this woman started working in the clothing business in 2008. She learned how to sew, enabling her to make and sell clothing. She has included with this business the sale of kitchen utensils. Given how profitable the business is, she would like to expand and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 37 bolts of cloth, 17 outfits for women, 10 boubous (long, flowing garments) for men, and some kitchen utensils. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and outfits

loans.name: Alexander

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur après avoir abandonné ses études, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de pièces détachées, il a ouvert à cet effet sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « BRAVO ».  Il s’approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de Lomé. Son stock a baissé, voulant se réapprovisionner, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 1 carton de piston segment, 100 chambres à air, 20 pneus et 15 gentes.
Il est célibataire et subvient à ses propres charges grâce aux revenus de son activité.
texts.en:
After having left off his studies, this gentleman began selling spare parts. He opened his own store that he calls "BRAVO". He buys his merchandise in the local market of the autonomous port of Lomé. His inventory is low and, wishing to replenish it, he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 1 case of segmented pistons, 100 inner tubes, 20 tires, and 15 "gentes".

He is single and supports himself thanks to the income from his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spare parts for re-sale

loans.name: Laki

texts.en:
Laki is a member of the Jabia njema borrowers’ group. She is 39 years old, married and the mother of four children. Her children are 21,16,12 and 9 years old.

Laki started her own business selling wood two years ago. She works nine hours a day and earns approximately 100,000 TZS a month.

This is Laki`s second loan from BRAC. She requests 500,000 TZS to buy more wood to sell. With her profit from this loan, Laki hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda D. est une femme mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de perle, encens, beurre de karité et divers articles. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin de renforcer ses capacités d’autofinancement pour mieux participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Aïda D. is married and the mother of seven children. She sells pearls, incense, shea butter and various other items. She is requesting a loan to help her become self-sustainable to better cover her family expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell pearls, incense, shea butter and various other products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is twenty – five years old. He is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Mary is a trader. She trades in textile materials such as silk, wool, linen, etc. She supplies to tailors and dressmakers in her community. Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy textile materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda L. is living in Surallah, South Cotabato with rice farming and hog raising business since 2000.  She’s married and has 3 children, her eldest is 16 years old.  She has 1 sow, 10 piglets and a hectare rice field.  

She would like to ask for a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. worth Php 8,000.  She will use the loan to help support her business and could provide the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Jeanne Ann

texts.en:
Jeanne Ann, 26, has a three-year-old child with her husband, Randy. They have been happily married for two years. Jeanne Ann is a rice farmer in her town in Agusan Del Sur. She patiently tends her rice field. She said that her rice crops are still young and she makes sure to give enough attention to them. 

Jeanne Ann needs additional farm supplies to keep her crops healthy and growing. She requested from CEVI a loan of 12,000 PHP. She will buy fertilizers and other supplies for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 45 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos económicos en su hogar, le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas por las mañanas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado en su propia casa . Hoy en día ha ganando mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad y se hizo muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su local y es ella quien personalmente les deleita con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará arroz, azúcar y papas en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. Juanita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" Communal Bank, in the District and Province of Bellavista, in the San Martín area. She is a 45-year-old widow and the mother of 2 children who still depend on her. In order to generate her own income for the household, she got the idea of opening a small business to sell food in the mornings in the air-conditioned environment of her own home. Today, she has gained a lot of experience in this type of activity and she has made herself known and loved by her customers. Currently, she continues with the same business, tending to her customers who visit her daily and she herself delights them with her culinary gift and her friendliness. With this loan of S/ 2,500.00, she will buy rice, sugar, sacks of potatoes, various vegetables, eggs and chicken. She will also buy kitchen utensils in order to replace those that she currently has and therefore be able to provide better service and attention to her customers. Juanita, as they affectionately call her, feels very confident and desires to continue with her business and ensure a peaceful life for herself. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es: Marilú C. es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 38 años, madre soltera de un menor el cula es su motivo para seguir adellante con sus objetivos, ella se dedica al alquiler de cuartos y venta de desayuno. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, invirtió su crèdito para la venta de comida. En la actualidad Marilú necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado en la compra de madera para arreglar un cuarto el cual alquila. La meta de Marilú es tener una fuente de soda amplia para todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marilú C. is one of our enterprising and hardworking members who lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 38 years old and a single mother of a dependent child. Marilú is motivated to succeed in her objectives in order for her family to get ahead.

She manages rental rooms and sells breakfasts. Marilú joined the Communal Bank “Juntas hasta el Final” (Together until the End) five years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy food.

At the moment, Marilú is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy wood for remodeling one of her rental rooms. Her goal is to expand her business by adding a soda fountain for all of her customers to enjoy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to remodel a rental room

loans.name: Llenci

texts.es:
Llenci es una mujer trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 58 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad.
Llenci se dedica a la venta de frutas en el puerto de este distrito, actividad que realiza todos los días. 
Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” y actualmente necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà frutas al por mayor. 
La meta de Llenci es tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Llenci is a hard-working woman who lives in the district of Yarina Cocha, in the Ucayali region. She is 58 years old and is the mother of three children, all of them adults. Llenci makes a living selling fruits in the port of her district, an activity that she does every day. She is a part of the communal bank "Las Fresitas", and currently she needs a loan of 300.00 nuevos soles with which she will purchase fruit whole-sale. Llenci's goal is to have a well-stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit whole-sale

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona muy tranquila y responsable, tiene 45 años, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, junto a su esposa Carmen de 45 años, a quien desea dar una mejor vida.
Su puesto de venta de bicicletas está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca). Con muchos ánimos de progresar en la vida comienza sus días, ya que es muy optimista, él es un vendedor muy hábil y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle una bicicleta.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para encargarse de su negocio y ser su propio jefe, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, ya que esto lo cansa mucho. 
Para el futuro, espera poder tener una tienda donde pueda vender bicicletas totalmente nuevas, ya que actualmente se dedica a vender las bicicletas que arregla.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Carlos con MFP y espera tener la misma puntualidad que tuvo en sus dos primeros créditos, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y solidario. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más bicicletas para arreglarlas y así incrementar la cantidad que vende.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very calm and responsible person. He is 45 years old, and lives in the house inherited from his parents together with his wife Carmen, who is 45 years old, and to whom he wishes to give a better life. His bicycle sales store is located in the Explanada Laguna Temporal (marketplace in the city of Juliaca). Since he is an optimist, he begins his days with a lot of desire to progress in life. He is a very skilled salesman and always convinces his customers to buy a bicycle.

What he likes most about his work is the freedom that he has to deal with his own business and to be his own boss. He has been doing this work for six years and what he considers the most difficult is to have to remain all day under the harsh sun, since it makes him very tired. In the future, he hopes to be able to have a shop where he can sell completely new bicycles, since currently he is selling bicycles that he fixes.

This is Carlos's sixth loan with MFP, and he hopes to have the same punctuality that he had in the first two loans. He is a very responsible and supportive member of his community bank. With the 1500 soles requested, he will buy more bicycles to fix and increase the quantity that he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mercedes Natividad

texts.es:
Nuestra socia NATIVIDAD, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, la socia es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, pero radica más de un año en Pisac, situado en la provincia de Calca, Pisac es lugar obligado para parar si uno está camino al valle sagrado de los incas, este sitio tiene unos hermosos mausoleos inkas, y todos los días hay una feria típica en el centro del pueblo dónde venden todas las artesanías que los pobladores fabrican. 

Nuestra socia tienen 47 años y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, la socia es madre soltera ella tiene 3 hijos de (25, 20, 12) años de edad, la socia trabaja en el mercado central junto a la feria artesanal vendiendo frutas y verduras, en el poblado de Pisac, nuestra socia me comento que ella deseaba vender artesanía aquí a los turistas que visitan el complejo arqueológico de Pisac, pero el gremio de artesanos no la dejaba unirse a ellos, ella no encontró mejor cosa que vender sino frutas y verduras junto a los artesanos, esto fue una idea muy buena porque los turistas y artesanos eran un gran mercado para ella, ella se dio cuenta de que podía vender esto a ellos de lo contrario nadie lo haría, así que vió que este negocio era nuevo y trajo poco a poco a más mujeres con diversas variedades de productos a la zona, es así que hoy en día este poblado se hizo y hace cada vez más grande y diverso. 

Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar más productos de frutas y verduras al por mayor y venderlos en la gran feria de Pisac. 

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad de que ella pueda seguir reinvirtiendo en su negocio y de este modo seguir apoyando a sus menores hijos
texts.en:
Our member Natividad belongs to the community bank “INTIWATANA”. She is a native of the city of Cusco but has been living for more than a year in Pisac, located in the province of Calca. Pisac is an obligatory stop if one is on his way to the sacred valley of the Incas; this site has some beautiful Inca mausoleums and every day there is a traditional fair in the town center where handicrafts made by locals are sold. Natividad is 47 years old and alternates her household responsibilities with business; she is a single mother of three (25, 20 and 12 years old) and she works in the central market, next to the crafts fair in Pisac, selling fruits and vegetables. She shared with us that she wanted to sell handicrafts here to the tourists visiting the archeological complex of Pisac, but the craftsman union would not allow her to join them; she found no better way than selling fruits and vegetables next to the craftsmen. This was a good idea because the tourists and craftsmen were a big market for her; she realized she could sell these items to them since nobody else would; she noticed this was a new market and little by little it attracted more women with diverse products to the area; nowadays the area is growing and becoming more diverse. Natividad is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk and then sell them in the big fair of Pisac. She is grateful and values the opportunity to continue investing in her business and be able to support her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo vive en la “Avenida  Buenos Aires”  de la zona San Jose de Yunguyo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en un pequeño departamento el cual esta en alquiler junto su esposa, su pequeño hijo de 3 años y un bebe por nacer.
 
Trabaja como maestro mecánico en automóviles en un taller ubicado en la misma zona.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de una maquina compresora para el pintado de vehículos, puesto que la actual esta deteriorada y a punto de quedar inutilizable.
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Ubaldo lives on the Avenida Buenos Aires in the San Jose de Yunguyo neighborhood in El Alto. He lives in a small apartment, which he rents with his wife, who will soon give birth, and his three-year-old son. He works as a master mechanic in a workshop in the same neighborhood. This loan will be used to purchase a paint compressor for painting vehicles, as the one he currently has is very old and nearly unusable. This is his first loan with Impro, the evaluation they carried out qualified him to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Jancuk Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a paint compressor for vehicles

loans.name: Zoila Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cochapamba se encuentra formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que siempre buscan la manera de salir adelante, este banco está ubicado  en la comunidad Cochapamba en  la parroquia El Valle al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca localidad muy reconocida por su producción de maíz  y su gran atractivo turístico la laguna de Totora.

Zoila tiene 36 años de edad vive en la comunidad  San Isidro sector de Chilcapamba con su esposo de oficio albañil y con su única hija de trece años, con el esfuerzo y mucho trabajo pueden contar con su casa propia que era uno de sus sueños.

 Zoila  trabaja en  una empresa de limpieza desde hace un mes su  horario de trabajo es de  8 a 12h00,  anteriormente ya trabajó en ella por casi tres años pero renunció por una calamidad doméstica y como sus jefes sabían la situación por la que estaba pasando le permitieron regresar. Además de esta actividad también se dedica a la cría de cuyes, chanchos, gallinas tanto para el consumo personal como para la venta en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en el segundo ciclo gracias a su prima política la que la motivó a formar parte del equipo de mujeres emprendedoras y  con el crédito solicitado va a comprar cemento y arena para enlucir las paredes de su casa y construir un baño.

Su gran sueño es ver a su  hija salir adelante en los estudios y que llegue a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The Cochapamba Communal Bank was formed by a group of enterprising women who always look for ways to get ahead. This bank is located in the community of Cochapamba in El Valle Parish, which is southeast of the city of Cuenca. This area is known for its production of corn and its great tourist attraction, the Totora Lagoon.

Zoila is 36 years old and lives in the community of San Isidro in Chilcapamba with her husband, who works as a mason, and their three year old daughter. After much work and with great effort, she was able to fulfill her dream of owning a home.

Zoila has been working for a cleaning company for the past month. Her work schedule is from 8:00 to 12:00. She had previously worked for this company for almost three years, but resigned due to personal problems. Her bosses were aware of her situation, so they allowed her to return. In her addition to her job, Zoila raises guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens both for personal consumption and to sell in her community.

Zoila is participating in her second loan cycle thanks to her cousin who convinced her to join this team of enterprising women. With the loan she requested, she plans to buy cement and sand for plastering the walls of her house and to build a bathroom. Her ambition is to see her daughter get ahead in school and become a successful professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & sand to plaster the walls of her house and build a bathroom

loans.name: Mrs. Leang Tom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang T. is 48 years old and she is president of a village bank that consists of 22 people located in Prey Ampok village in Takeo province. These members will be using this loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Leang T. and her husband, Mr. Sothun Prak, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice on. Although they try to work hard with their farming, they still earn too little income to support their family. Now, Mrs. Leang T. wants to start a new business, thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and make a pigpen. The rest of the loan she will use to buy pig feed for her breeding pigs. 

This couple has five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other four are attending in local school and also help their parent with farming.

loans.use: To buy piglets and make a pigpen and buy feed

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 65-year-old mother of four who has been farming for 44 years. She has a mixed farm near Murang'a, in the Central Province of Kenya, and is also a dairy farmer. She sells cereals locally and, for extra income, she runs a small shop and rents out property. Through these endeavors, she is able to employ three people in the community. The challenge to her businesses is a lack of income for expansion and competition from other similar businesses.
Peris has requested her first loan of 53,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to buy and insure an additional dairy cow. The extra income from the milk will allow her to complete her ongoing construction projects and, in the future, she will be able to produce about 30 liters a day and expand into poultry farming. She says Juhudi Kilimo is really helping low-income farmers unlike other financial institutions.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Kruoch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of eight people who live in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Koem K. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes. 
Mrs. Koem K. and her husband, Mr. Phen Yorn, are farmers who own an one-hectare piece of land to grow vegetables to sell to support their family. Through this activity, the couple supports four children who are all attending the local public school. In the vegetable field, they have a problem because the soil is infertile and far from the irrigation system. Therefore, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Koem K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 47-year-old single mother to three children aged 26, 23 and 22. The eldest is now at university and she says it’s been a struggle reaching there. She dreams of educating all of them so that they can be helpful to themselves in their adulthood. 

Violet operates a bar in Masindi, Uganda which also has a takeaway services. She has been in the bar business for 10 years now and though it, she has been able to build her own house.

After the children complete school, Violet says she will be able to transform the bar business into a modern one with better facilities. The purpose of the loan is to pay tuition fees for her eldest son at university.

loans.use: paying tuition fees for her eldest son at university

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Tai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Cheung Loung village in Takeo province, fourteen people make up this village bank loan group. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. 

Mrs. Sokha T. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sokha T. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Chantha Phorn, is a traditional musician and aside from this, he is a fisherman too. She has four children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Claveles y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro, es socia hace muchos años y con sus ahorros construyo su casa, además que la capacitaron en temas de negocio, temas que le ayudaron mucho para crecer.
Julia es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Julia vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa que se encuentra a 30 minutos de la ciudad de AyaC., tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras y carnes. Además Julia se dedica a la compra de tara y cochinilla que acopia para venderlos a un intermediarios. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de cereales y trigo.
Julia sueña que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Claveles” (The Carnations). What she enjoys most is having the incentive to save. She has been a member for many years and used her savings to build her house. In addition, the business training she has received has helped her to grow.

Julia is married and has four children in school. She lives in the community of Huayllapampa, which is 30 minutes away from the city of AyaC.. Julia has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. She also sells tara and cochineal (natural sources of dye) that she collects and sells them to intermediaries. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of grains, such as wheat.

Julia dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom S., 50 years old, lives in Krang Ta Chan village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice while her husband, Mr. Men Mok, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children; one is a construction worker while the other two are seamstresses in the garment factory. In order to help her children, Mrs. Sokhom S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport them to their working place. Mrs. Sokhom S.'s husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children's transportation to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more millet and other ingredients to prepare more porridge to sell

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.en: Vilma D. is from the village of Dicoyong. She is 40 years old and is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Vilma is married and has six children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Catalina Maruja

texts.es:
Catalina nació en el distrito de Pucyura y tiene 58 años. Actualmente, Catalina vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. La ciudad de Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Catalina se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños, ella tiene un puesto de venta en el centro comercial el Molino de la ciudad del Cusco, donde la pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Catalina nos cuenta que hace 6 años vendía de forma ambulatoria en la avenida ejército de la ciudad del Cusco pero ahora tiene un stand en el centro comercial.  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, cuyes y gallinas, ella compra animales críos de la feria de Inquilpata y después de hacer engordar los animales, ella los vende en las ferias y mercados de Izcuchaca y Cusco. Ya son 3 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Eugenia que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar ovejas. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Eugenia pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Catalina, 58, was born in Pucyura district. Currently, Catalina lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and 5 children. Pucyura is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Catalina sells children’s clothing. She has a sales stand in the El Molino shopping center in Cusco. She can be found there seven days a week from 9am until 8pm. Catalina tells us that six years ago she was an itinerant merchant along Ejército Avenue in Cusco but now she has a stand in the shopping center. She also raises small farm animals like sheep, guinea pigs and chickens that she buys newborn at Inquilpata farmers market to fatten up and later sell at markets in Izcuchaca and Cusco. She has been in this business for three years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it. Eugenia expects to get 1000 new soles in her next loan that she’d like to use to buy sheep. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) has been in operation for three and a half years; Eugenia has been a member for three years and does well. The members of this communal bank are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and this is why they named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 30 años; vive en casa propia, es casada, vive con su esposo, de 40 años de edad, ella es vendedora de varias mercaderias como edredones, ropas, y otras mercaderias dependiendo de los pedidos o sugerencias que recibe de sus clientes, esta actividad lo ayuda con el ingreso de la familia familiar.
Tienen un hijo, de 10 años quien es estudiante esta en la escuela en el quinto grado.
Luisa emprendió su  actividad por iniciativa propia primeramente vendiendo los sus mercaderias a sus vecinos primeramente a pie casa por casa.

Actualmente posee clientela formada y recorre varios kilómetros en la moto con su sobrino quien trabaja con ella,  a quien le enseña la profesión y a la vez les remunera por sus servicios.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como el edredón, frazadas, pues posee varias demanda por la temporada.
texts.en:
Luisa is 30 years old. She lives in her own house and is married. She lives with her husband, who is 40 years old. She sells various merchandise such as quilts, clothing, and other merchandise depending upon the requests or suggestions that she receives from her customers. This business helps with the family income.

They have a 10-year-old son who is a 5th grade student in school.

Luisa began her business with her own initiative, first selling her merchandise to her neighbors on foot from house to house.

She currently has an established clientele and travels several kilometers by moto with her nephew who works with her. She teaches him the profession and at the same time pays him for his services.

She needs this loan for the purchase of merchandise such as quilts and blankets, since there are several demands due to the season.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of quilts and blankets

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce K. is a 42-year-old married lady and a mother of two children. She sells second-hand clothes to Malindi town dwellers and this is where her business is situated. This is the third time that Joyce is taking a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET LTD. She plans to use the money to expand her four-year-old business by increasing the stock that it already has.

The lady was introduced to KADET LIMITED by another client who is already a member of KADET LTD. She wishes to use the anticipated profit from her business to help educate her children and further expand her ever-growing business by opening a permanent boutique.

loans.use: To  purchase more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, pepper, salt, seasoning etc

loans.name: Claro's Group

texts.en:
Claro Q. is from the village of Amobocan, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 34 years old. Claro is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Claro is single. He owns and operates a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Claro has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month in these activities.

In 2010, Claro joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claro is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Claro from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional inventory; working capital

loans.name: Morine

texts.en: Morine J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut phase, beans and bread and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to to sell.  Morine is 30 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans to to sell

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es:
Israel de 35años de edad es soltero, vive en union libre con la Sra. Felicia Lopez con quien tiene tiene 2 hijos: Minerva de 15 años cursando el 1er año de secundaria y la menor Israelita de 3 añitos, que aun no estudia.  

Israel labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza desde hace 3 años. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de continuar con la construccion de su casa, pues el credito anterior le sirvio para iniciar los arranques y ahora quiere levantar las paredes, para de esta manera ir poco a poco haciendo su casita y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  

Sueña con que sus hijos estudien para que cuando sean mayores pueden trabajar y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Israel is 35 years old and single.  Felicia Lopez is his live-in partner, and they have two children.  Minerva, age 15, is in her first year of high school.  Three year old Israelita does not go to school yet.

Israel has been a cleaning workman for the city of Juigalpa for three years.

He is requesting his third loan to continue building his house.  He used the previous loan to start building, and now he wants to raise the walls.  This way he will, little by little, build his house and give his family better living conditions.

He dreams that his children get an education so that when they are grown they will be able to work and have better living conditions.

loans.use: Raise the walls on the house he is building

loans.name: Juamonie

texts.en:
Juamonie S. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old. Juamonie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juamonie owns & operates a business buying and selling personal products from NATASHA, AVON, BOARDWALK, & MSE in the local community. Juamonie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juamonie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juamonie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Juamonie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juamonie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Jesica Maria

texts.es:
la sra. Jesica Maria S. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la colonia Aurora y se dedica a la venta de golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado San Miguel de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. este es un buen punto ya que por aqui pasan muchas personas, su negocio esta abierto de Lunes a Sábado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus comidas, ya que si compra al  por mayor obtienen precios mas bajos.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs Jesica Maria S. is 36 years old.  She lives in Aurora district and sells sweet treats, breakfasts and lunches.  Her business is located in San Miguel market in the city of Tegucigalpa.  This is a good location because a lot of people pass through here.  Her business is open from Monday to Saturday.

She will use her loan to buy supplies for making her meals since if she buys these wholesale she can get them at a lower price.  She needs the profits from her business to get herself and her family ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, butter, oil, vegetables, rice, beans, eggs, chorizos, juice, bread, coffee, condiments, salt, cheese and margarine

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgencita de Cancharani” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos (01 independiente), realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Viene trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 08 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como labiales, colonias, etc.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como labiales, colonias shampoo, tintes, la cual vende a sus amistades y familiares, lo realiza sola, ya que su esposo tiene otro empleo.

Su sueño es superarse en el negocio para tener más ganancias.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la capacitación y el compañerismo.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the "Virgencita de Cancharani" community bank which is located in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 44 years old, married and has two children (one of whom lives independently).  She received a high school level education.

Adela has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 months.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling beauty products such as lipsticks, cologne, etc.

Adela is requesting a new loan for 600 Peruvian soles which she will invest in her business selling beauty products such as lipsticks, cologne, shampoo and dyes to her friends and family members.  She carries out her work on her own since her husband has another job.

Adela's dream is to make progress in her business so that she can make more profits.  What she likes about her community bank are the training sessions and the solidarity amongst the members.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Kol S. is a 40 year old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh Capital, in Cambodia. She is a local chef who is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and their other ceremonies, while her husband works repairing cars. The family includes three devoted children, three of whom are single. Two of their children are employed in different jobs. Currently, Kol S. is not comfortable, because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, es una mujer tímida pero trabajadora de 31 años; junto a su esposo Hernán, cuidan de sus 2 hijos: Hilder y Melina, en armonía, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de arveja, papa y flor, por lo que tiene 12 años de experiencia en este rubro. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cortar las flores de papa, ya que es señal de una pronta cosecha. La dedicación que le brinda a sus terrenos agrícolas le permiten obtener buenas ganancias en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, lugar donde comercializa sus productos; pero las flores de gladiolo los vende en el mercado central de la capital del país. Sus planes son sembrar flor de gladiolo y mantener en buenas condiciones su plantación de habas para que le proporcione buenos frutos en la temporada de cosecha. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde obtiene buenas experiencias para la mejora de sus sembríos. Haydee, cosechó flor de gladiolo, por ello con el dinero del préstamo desea comprar una bolsa de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirá en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Haydee is a timid but hard working, 31 year old, woman who together with her husband, Hernán, cares for their two children, Hilder and Melina, in harmony.  They live in their own house located in Patay.

She is a farmer.  Her main crops are pea, potato and flowers.  She has 12 years’ experience in this line of work.  What she likes best is cutting the potato flowers because this is a sign that harvest is near.  The care she gives to her fields allows her to obtain good profits at the city of Tarma’s wholesale market, the place where she sells her products.
