However, she sells the gladiolas at the central market in the nation’s capital city. Her plans are to plant gladiola flowers and keep her lima bean crops in good conditions so that good results will be produced during harvest time.

She is a member of the “Los Picaflores de Patay” (Patay Hummingbirds) communal bank and this is the 7th loan with MFP where she obtains good experiences to improve her crops.  Haydee harvested gladiolas and wants to use the loan money to buy a sack of pea seeds to spread among her fields.

loans.use: To buy a sack of pea seeds.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica, de 46 años,  es una mujer muy dedicada en sobresalir adelante, vive en su casa que es propia. A lo largo de toda su vida está trabajadora mujer, se ha dedicado a diferentes negocios como a la venta de ropa, productos de belleza, lavandería y la elaboración y venta de chocotejas, que las viene realizando de manera intercalada, hasta el día de hoy. De esta manera sus labores le  absorben casi toda su vida, y eso le hace muy feliz, ya que está segura que trabajado así podrá salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello, en sus mínimos horarios libres, no deja de elaborar sus chocotejas, que son muy solicitados por sus clientes, a pesar de la temporada de verano.  De esta manera, pudo ahorrar lo suficiente, ya que lo necesitaba para terminar de construir su casa, y acondicionar un lugar donde poner su lavadora y secadora; así evitará pagar el alquiler del local donde realizaba su negocio de lavandería. Esté es su 17avo crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado compromiso y comprensión con los integrantes de su asociación. Verónica, con el crédito que solicita, comprará detergentes, lejía, en frasco al por mayor y pagar la mudanza de sus artefactos hasta su casa.
texts.en:
Verónica is a 46 year old woman who is dedicated to getting ahead.  She lives in her own house.  Throughout her life this hard-working woman has worked at different businesses like selling clothes, selling beauty products, laundry, and making and selling chocolate candy.  She still alternates between these business activities.  This way her work takes up almost all of her life.  This makes her very happy because she is sure that by working this way she will be able to get ahead and improve her quality of live.

That is why she does not stop making her chocolate candy in her few free hours.  Despite the fact that it is summer time, her candy is in much demand by her customers.  This way she was able to save enough because she needed to finish building her house and to set up a place to put her washer and dryer.  That way she will avoid paying rent for the place for her laundry business.

This is her 17th loan with MFP.  She has always demonstrated commitment and understanding with the members of the association.  Verónica will use the requested loan to buy wholesale detergent and bottled bleach.  She will also pay to move her appliances to her house.

loans.use: To buy detergent and bottled bleach and to pay to move her appliances to her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Monh

texts.en: Monh C., 22, has been married to Chun Bunran, 31, for years and has a child who is still young and attends school. Monh C.’s family lives along the river. She earns a living by selling fish caught by her husband. Recently, the quantity of fish caught has declined due to the lack of fishing gear. Some of their tools were ruined. As a result, Monh C. has requested a loan. She will use the funds to purchase a new fishing machine that will connect fish nets with boats.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing machine that will connect fish nets with boats.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 46 años, es una valerosa madre soltera, que cuida de sus 2 menores hijas: Mabelia y Yelit, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huasahuasi. La hermosa sonrisa de Yolanda, es producto de la vida tranquila que lleva en el campo, pues ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura. En todo este tiempo logró obtener buenos resultados, pues ya tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas en el caserío de Huacas. Donde todos los días desde muy temprano sale a limpiar y fertilizar sus sembríos de papa y arveja, productos que son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Asimismo por las tardes se dedica a la venta de anticuchos a base de corazón de carnero, vendiendo un promedio de 50 unidades diarias. Su principal dificultad son los gastos que realiza en los estudios de enfermería de su hija, donde invierte mensualmente. Los planes que tiene es sembrar en mayores cantidades, para poder pagar los estudios superiores de sus hijas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente muy contenta, pues le apoyan en el desarrollo de su trabajo. Yolanda, cosechará gran cantidad de arveja, por ello con el crédito comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja que le falta para comenzar su sembrío.
texts.en: Yolanda, 46 years old, is a valiant single mother who cares for her two young daughters, Mabelia and Yelit, in her own home, which is located in Huasahuasi. Yolanda's beautiful smile is a product of the tranquil life she lives in the country. She has 20 years of experience in agriculture. All this time she has been getting good results. Now she has her own farm land in the small town of Huacas, where every day starting early in the morning, she gets up to water and fertilize her potato and pea crops. These products are sold in the main market in the city of Tarma. In the afternoon she sells kebabs made of ram's heart; she sells about 50 each day. Her main challenge right now is the expenses associated with her daughter's nursing school, which she is paying monthly. Her plan is to plant more crops so she will be able to pay for both her daughters' college. She belongs to the Progreso Carita Community Bank, and this is her fifth loan through Kiva partner MFP. She is very happy with the group because they have helped her develop her business. Yolanda will grow a large quantity of peas, so with this loan she will purchase the bag of pea seeds that she needs to start planting.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of pea seeds

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Shirley requested a 3,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have an emergency light source that is waterproof in case of heavy rains and floods. She is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La Sra. MatilD. B. D. 48 años, está casada con el Sr. Juan R. D. 55 años D. edad, ellos tienen 2 hijos que están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
Doña MatilD. posee una despensa y se dedica a este rubro desD. hace más D. 9 años, aproximadamente desD. el año 2002, ella para obtener el capital necesario para emprender su negocio tuvo que vender su automóvil, así pudieron habilitar una pequeña despensa que con el tiempo fueron ampliando.
En la actualidad tiene una despensa, un copetin y una fotocopiadora; su local se encuentra ubicado estratégicamente cerca del Mercado D. Abasto, lo cual hace que tenga buena concurrencia D. gente y más ingreso.
Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías (gaseosas, yerbas, vino, leche, caña, azúcar, etc), y mejorar su oferta D. productos.
texts.en:
MatilD. B. is 48 years old and married to 55 year-old Juan R..  They have two children who are in high school.

MatilD. owns a grocery store and has been in this business for more than nine years.  She started her business in around 2002.  In order to have the necessary capital to set up her business, she had to sell her car.  In this way, she was able to set up a small grocery store which, over time, she has expanded.

MatilD. currently has a grocery store, snack bar and a photocopier.  Her business is strategically located near the wholesale food market which means that she gets a lot of customers and more income.

MatilD. will use this loan to buy more merchandise (soda, yerba, wine, milk, brandy, sugar, etc.) and will improve the range of products she sells.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (soda, yerba, wine, milk, brandy, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de 03 enfants, Akouavi est âgée de 41 ans et est revendeuse ambulante de parfum et de déodorant elle s’approvisionne  au grand marché de Lomé. Vu son âge un peu avancée, elle ne lésine pas sur les moyens pour parfaire l’éducation de ses enfants. Ce prêt serait une grande aide pour elle car elle aimerait augmenter son stock pour avoir plus de revenu et subvenir au besoin de sa famille au quotidien.
texts.en: A widow and the mother of three, Akouavi is 41 years old. She works as a street vendor of perfume and deodorants, stocking up at the big market Lomé. As she is no longer the youngest, she does not spare any means for the education of her children. This loan will be a big help for her as she would like to expand her stock so as to increase her revenues and provide for the everyday needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy perfume and deodorants for resale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe, a 58-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family, is a farmer growing rice and corn to sell. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Both enterprises allow her to to help provide for her family.  Fe plans to use her loan to purchase farm fertilizers and pig feed and hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Lester Rolando

texts.es:
Lester de 30 años, es soltero,  vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con solo servicio de luz  en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertnece al departamento de Piura. La zona se caracteriza por ser de mucha actividad agricola, ganadera y artesana.

Lester se dedica  a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas son apropiados y espaciosos; se encuentran  en la parte posterior de su casa, los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño ideal las ofrece en el mercado de Tambogrande y Piura.  Con el dinero que va adquirir por sus ovejas podrá atender sus necesidades personales.  Su padre le a dado en herencia unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, es otra forma como se ayuda económicamete.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados    asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de sus animales.  También lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y su producto.  Lester es una persona responsable y trabajadora con la única intensión de ayudar económica a sus padres en la casa como para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lester, 30, is single living in his parents’ house which only has electricity in Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  The area is known for having much farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

Lester has raised sheep for several years.  The corral holding his sheep is spacious and appropriate and located in his back yard.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed like natural grasses and once they reach ideal size he sells them in the Tambogrande and Piura markets.  Money he gets from the sale of his sheep is used to cover his personal expenses.  His father has passed on some farmland to him where he grows lemons which are an additional source of economic help.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed thus insuring good growth and development of his animals.  He will also use it to buy fertilizer to improve his farmland and thus his crop yields.  

Lester is a very responsible, hard working person whose only aim is helping his parents his parents economically at home to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Sara

texts.es:
María Sara tiene 42 años, es casada vive con el esposo y  tiene 3 hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

María  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Su sueño es dar la educacion a los hijos y dar la alimentacion.

Le gusta pasear por el campo con la familia.
texts.en:
María Sara is 42 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and has three children.  She lives in Agua Clara, in Chillanes canton.

The Virgen del Huayco community bank has 14 members and is located in Loma de Guacalgoto, 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this bank work in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  Some sell flour or animals.

María is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes her sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help María to buy supplies for her crops.  The loan has supported her in increasing her crop production.  Her dream is to provide her children with an education and food.

María enjoys going for walks in the countryside with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crops

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi sells utensils, plastics bucket, bowls and others at Abura in Cape Coast the Central Region of Ghana.  Asi has received a junior high education.  

She is a widow taking care of 2 children. She has been in this trade for 20 years. The loan when received would be added to her initial capital to buy utensils, plastic buckets and others to sell.  She would want to build a shop from the additional profit.

loans.use: to buy utensils, plastic buckets and others to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Twenty-eight-year old Mary sells mobile phones and also offers mobile-phone money deposit and withdrawal services. She has been involved in this business for the past three years now in Mukono in Central Uganda. The happily married young mother of two says she began this business with help from her husband. She was at first an employee of one of the country's biggest telecommunications companies. She resigned and later began her own business. Per month, she says this business generates sales profits totaling 900,000 Ugandan shillings. With this Kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more mobile phones to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones to resell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 44 years old and married. Her spouse, Jaime, is a farmer and, in addition, owns a welding and vulcanizing shop. The couple is blessed with four children. The eldest finished his studies and is already working. Two others are in college level and the youngest is an elementary student. Though three of her children are still attending school, Dolores is so grateful because she and her husband can sustain the needs of their family. Like her husband, Dolores is into two businesses. AsiD. from the general store, she also manages a hog raising business. Dolores has been managing her general store for 25 years now and earns PHP 3,000 a month. She uses her income in the store for livestock feed and as revolving capital to buy commodities for her store.

Due to expensive basic commodities and expenses of her children, Dolores would like to ask for a loan amounting of PHP 30,000 to buy some additional groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, ingredients, shampoo and other kinds of groceries. 

In the future, Dolores hopes to expand her general store to sustain the needs of her children and send them into a higher level of education. She then hopes that she could avail her loan request so that she could supply all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, ingredients, canned goods, shampoo and baked breads

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rentals business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit for her videoke rentals business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years. Jocelyn earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and buy more farm lands in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional videoke unit.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 48 años de edad. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella es cosmetóloga y tiene un pequeño salón de belleza. En esta oportunidad Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar tintes, champús, tijeras, acondicionador y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Francisca was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and she is 48 years old. She currently lives in the same city where she was born and it is where she carries out her economic activities. She is a cosmetologist and she has a small beauty salon. At this time Francisca requires a loan to purchase hair dyes, shampoos, scissors, conditioners, and other products.

The communal bank "Virgen de Chapi" meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is a well-known touristic and commercial region. It is also known for the traditional feast of Inti Raymi, and it is also the location of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu.

loans.use: to purchase hair dyes, shampoos, scissors, conditioners, and other products.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 37 años, es un hombre entusiasta y trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Mariluz de 31 años y sus 02 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Oscar se caracteriza por ser runa persona humilde. Se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la producción y comercialización de cacao, café y árboles maderables, donde viene trabajando desde sus 20 años; recuerda que sus primeros años como agricultor no le fue tan bien, ya que los frutos de las plantas solo le alcanzaba para cubrir con los gastos de su canasta familiar, mas no para recuperar su capital. Continuó apostando por la actividad agrícola, fruto a su empeño y perseverancia tuvo su recompensa con el pasar de los años y hoy es uno de los mejores agricultores de su valle, debido a que produce productos de alta calidad, además obtiene buenos ingresos económicos. En tiempos de cosecha  y deshierbo de maleza trabaja sus tierras con jornaleros quienes lo ayudan a avanzar raudamente con sus faenas programadas. Con el crédito solicitado comprará abonos para mejorar sus sembríos. Oscar anhela en un futuro cercano adquirir más terrenos de cultivo con la necesidad de poder ampliar su producción y a la vez mejorar su condición de vida. Este será su primer crédito de Oscar con MFP y esta muy contento de saber que contará con el apoyo de los financistas para prosperar y mejorar su condición de vida. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará varios sacos de abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old and is an enthusiastic and hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his partner, Mariluz, 31 and his two dear sons, who are the reason for all of his efforts. He is a humble person. He works in agriculture, specifically the production and sale of cacao, coffee and timber trees, which he has been doing since his twenties.

Oscar remembers that his first years as a farmer did not go well since the income from his crops was only enough to cover basic family expenses but not enough to build capital. He continued betting on agriculture and as a result of his effort and perseverance over the years he began to be rewarded, and today he is one of the best farmers in his valley, since he produces high quality crops and earns a good income.

During the harvest and weeding, he works his land with day laborers who help him to rapidly do the required tasks. He will buy fertilizer with the loan he is requesting in order to improve his fields.

Oscar longs in the near future to acquire more land to cultivate so he can increase his production and at the same time improve his standard of living. This will be his first loan with MFP and he is happy to know he can count on the support of lenders to help him prosper. With the 3,000 nuevos soles, he will, as noted, buy bags of fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Gnek

texts.en: This borrower is from Baray District of Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia.  Gnek is 30 years old, married and has two children who are attending  school.  She and her husband are experienced rice farmers. This is a skill which they have learned from their ancestors. From this business sector, they can earn approximately $5USD per day. To expand their business, they would like to purchase a plowing machine but they lack the money so they are requesting a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner. They will use the loan funds to buy a plow and to plow their farm and will be employed to plow their neighbor’s farm. These funds will be very useful to their family. Their big hope for the future is that all of their  children will have a good education and have good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 31-year-old single man. He has been running a private primary school for the past three years with the monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Moses will use the loan to buy school desks, chairs and tables. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy another school field. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a school bus and a big piece of land where the school will develop fully. He'd like to see his school grow, which will cater to his future family.

loans.use: To buy school desks, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Aristides; La socia tiene 52 años de edad, el socio es soltero y tiene 2 hijos de 18, 15 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la artesanía, el socio trabaja con sus hermana en el taller de ella haciendo el mantenimiento del horno, y elaborando los moldes; el socio también realiza trabajos independientemente y alquila el horno de sus hermana para terminar sus trabajos, el socio desea invertir el crédito en la compra de arcilla, esmaltes, el socio desea invertir el crédito en la compra de arcilla, esmaltes y el alquiler del horno para realizar trabajaos para venderlos en navidad.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: This gentleman is a member of the ”IMASUMAC II” Communal Bank. The communal bank is based in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. Señor Aristides is 52 years old, single, and has 2 children, aged 18 and 15 years old. He works with his sister in her pottery workshop, taking care of the kiln and making moulds. He would like to invest the loan in buying clay, glazes, and in renting the kiln so that he can make pieces to sell at Christmas time. Señor Aristides is grateful for the loan and promises to complete his repayments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy clay and glazes, and to rent a kiln, to make items to sell for Christmas.

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Урозали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 32 года. Женат. Живет вместе с родителями. Его брат находится в России. Сам Урозали занимается растениеводством и скотоводством. Он берет кредит для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Urozali lives in the Yavan district.  She is 32 years old, married and lives together with his parents.  His brother is in Russia.  Urozali is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is a 30-year old single mother with two children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to educate her children and expand her business.She has been operating a craft shop for ten years and her challenge has been seasonal customers. Mwajuma needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 25 years old, married, and blessed with two children. They are all studying. Her business is a general store in their house. Mary Jane is borrowing the loan amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase inventory for her general store. She wishes that her general store would earn more to provide their family's needs and to support the financial education of their children. Mary Jane is a new member of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her general store

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a very loving and caring lady and always thinks positively for her family.  Although she is not financially supporting her family, she takes care of her family very well and tries to give comfort to them with her efforts.
She is the mother of four children.  Her first two sons are electricians by profession and operate an electric shop in the community.  They provide the services of repairing and selling electric items to the customers.
They have very good clientage and they serve them respectfully.
Rehana is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her second son.  He will use the loan to buy electric items such as tube lights, electric wires, bulbs, etc.  Selling these items will allow him to increase his profits.  He will also buy repairing tools which will allow him to provide better quality repairing services to his customers. 
She is very confident that her son will make full use of the loan amount and will be able to gain maximum profits from his business.

loans.use: To buy tube lights, electric bulbs, and repairing tools for an electric items sales and repair business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 38 años; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eulogio de 42 años y sus 03 hijos quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Marina, juntamente con su esposo, desde muy temprano se van a la chacra para poder ver sus plantas de cacao y frutas cítricas como: naranja, mandarina, etc. Gracias a sus cultivos puede sustentar los gastos escolares de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver a diario como va el avance de su cultivo para luego esperar la cosecha; lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir con la plaga de insectos que perjudican su producción. Pero aún así esta dispuesta a sembrar más plantas de cacao en sus tierras. Con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar plantas de cacao para incrementar su productividad y tener además productos de calidad. Este será su préstamo número 02 con MFP, por lo que espera de su colaboración para poder concretar sus planes. Con los 2,00 nuevos soles, podrá comprar plantas de cacao para ampliar la siembra, además comprará abono para asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Marina is 38 years old and lives in a home of her own, along with her husband, 42 year old Eulogio, and her three children who are her motivation for her efforts.  Marina and her husband go to the fields very early each morning, to trim their cacao and citrus fruit plants. (oranges, mandarin oranges, etc.)  Thanks to her crops, they can pay for their children’s schooling expenses.  What she likes the best about her work is to be able to see the daily progress of her crop while she awaits the harvest.  She’s been doing this for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be fighting the insects that damage her production.

Now she is ready to plant more cacao in her fields.  The money from this loan will allow her to buy cacao plants to increase her production and have quality products.  This will be her second loan though MFP and she awaits it to be able to solidify her plans.  She will use the 2,000 PEN ($750) to buy cacao plans to expand her production.  She will also buy fertilizer to ensure that she has a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño Jesus nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Viviana es la presidenta del grupo,  tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora  y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación y entusiasmo. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, fundas, sobrecamas, frazadas y demás artículos para el hogar. Ella desea poder seguir criendo para ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, sobrecamas y demás para poder tener más productos en stock para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesus communal bank was formed thanks to the support and management of a group of women working in the area. This group is from the city of San Lorenzo. The members' main goal is for each of them to grow individually and as business people.
Viviana is the group president. She is a hard-working 32-year-old who is very capable of leading a large group such as this one. She has demonstrated enthusiasm and a desire to succeed throughout all of these loan cycles. She tells us that she sells all sorts of products, such as sheets, covers, bedspreads, blankets, and other home items. She wants to keep expanding her business in order to help her family.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sheets, blankets, and other items so that she can have more products in stock in order to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, bedspreads and more.

loans.name: Fatogoma

texts.fr:
Monsieur  FATOGOMA  est né en 1980 à KADIOLO et vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses deux épouses et cinq enfants à KADIOLO, dans la  troisième région administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
Monsieur FATOGOMA mène des activités d’achat et vente des articles de quincaillerie il y a plus de 6 ans. Il s’approvisionne à  Bamako et à Conakry, acheminés à Kadiolo, les articles sont stockés dans une boutique au marché. Il vend en détail au comptant avec une clientèle composée d’hommes et femmes.
Il est en collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux  ans, il est à son deuxième pret et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Il compte acheter avec son prêt , des cartons de peintures, de colles, des serrures de sécurités, et des équipements d'électricités( câbles, disjoncteurs, prises).   
 Il compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux dépenses familiales,  une partie sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et le reste sera investis dans son activité.
Dans l’avenir il envisage d’être grossiste fournir les clients de Sikasso la capitale du Kénédougou.
texts.en: Mr. Fatogoma was born in 1980 in Kadiolo.  He lives in a traditional family with his two wives and five children in Kadiolo in the third largest region of Mali (Sikasso).  Mr Fatogoma has worked in the purchase and sale of hardware for over six years. He sources in Bamako and Conakry. After they are  transported to Kadiolo, the articles are stored in a shop at the market.  He sells retails for cash payment to customers who are both men and women.  He has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for the past two years and is on his second loan.  His prior loan was fully repaid.  With this loan, he plans to buy boxes of paint, glue, security locks, and electrical parts (cables, circuit breakers, sockets.)  He expects to earn an average monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA that will allow him to better take care of his family expenditures.  A portion of the profits will be used to pay the loan interest and the rest will be invested in his business.  In the future, he intends to be a wholesaler who supplies customers of Sikasso, the capital of Kenedougou.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Ma. Sally

texts.en: Ma. Sally is married and has four children. Ma. Sally is 40 years old. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Ma. Sally is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. In 2011, Ma. Sally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Ma. Sally wants to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Dalila, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre. Está separada de su esposo, pero vive con sus 03 hijos en casa de su padre. La actividad que realiza Dalila es la venta de comida rápida como salchipollos, pollos broasters y alitas fritas, además de menú y desayunos que da pensión a los trabajadores de un taller de mecánica cerca de su casa. Su puesto de venta lo instala en el frontis de su casa, desde donde viene atendiendo hace 05 años muy amablemente a sus clientes, contando además con la ayuda de su hermana para la preparación y atención al público, pagándole diariamente por su colaboración. Le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que en el pasado sufrió un accidente que le imposibilitó trabajar en una empresa y cuando se recuperó viendo la necesidad de tener un oficio se decidió por iniciare en éste negocio. Ahora ve que le es rentable, por ello decide continuar hacer crecer su negocio y con el tiempo abrir un restaurante en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles los piensa invertir en la compra de mesas y sillas, además de utensilios de cocinas como ollas, cucharas, platos para implementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Dalila, 47, is a hardworking and enterprising woman, as well as being pleasant and happy.  She is separated from her husband but lives with her three children in her father's house.  The work she does is selling fast food such as "salchipollos" [potatoes, sausage, and fried chicken], roast chicken, and fried wings, as well as a menu and breakfasts to feed the workers in a mechanic shop near her house.

She sets up her sales stall in the façade of her house, from where she has been waiting on her customers very pleasantly for five years.  She also has the help of her sister in food preparation and waiting on the public, and pays her daily for her help.

She likes her job because it allows her to have income to pay for the household expenses.  In the past she had an accident that made it impossible for her to work in a company.  When she recovered, seeing the need to have a trade she decided to get started in this business.  Now she sees that it is profitable for her, so she decided to continue making her business grow and in time open a restaurant in her house.

This will be her second loan with the MFP institution.  She hopes for a small loan so she can realize her goals.  In addition, she feels comfortable with her communal bank because she considers them to be good people.

With the requested loan of 800 PEN she plans to invest in buying tables and chairs as well as kitchen utensils such as pots, spoons, and plates, to be able to set up her business more.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs as well as kitchen utensils, pots, spoons, and plates.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 50-year-old married man. He has 9 children with ages ranging from 14 to 24 years. He describes himself as determined. He operates a firewood supply store where he sells firewood. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. 

Robert's business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are hotels. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to to buy a motorbike for use in his business. His business goal is to be a big supplier within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy one motorbike

loans.name: Alejandra Maria

texts.en:
My name is Alejandra. I have a stand where I sell sweets, burritas, chicken, refreshments, and others. My stand is located at the town’s market, and people visit it because its cleanliness and the tasty food I prepare for them. This is a family business. I have two employees who help me, and whenever my children are free in the afternoon, they come and help me prepare the food. Sales have improved quite a bit, and I hope to continue supporting my children’s education.

Loan Use: Purchase refreshments, vegetables, beans, cheese, butter, bread, and others.

Me llamo Alejandra y tengo un puesto de venta de golosinas, burritas, pollo, refrescos y otros. Mi puesto lo tengo ubicado en el mercado popular el que es visitado por varias personas y aprovechan visitar mi negocio por lo higienico y rica comida que les preparo. Este es un negocio familiar, tengo dos muchachas que me ayudan y por las tardes libres mis hijos vienen ayudarme a preparar los alimentos. Las ventas han mejorado bastante y espero poder seguir apoyando a mis hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Compra de refrescos, verduras, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, pan y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beatrice would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business of selling shoes.

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en: Mrs. Anekwze Amaka sells provisions and drinks to people in her community. She is 42 years, married, with children. She is from Asaba, Delta State in Nigeria. She hopes to get a loan of US$750 to expand her sales business by purchasing more provisions and drinks.

loans.use: Purchase of more provision and drinks for sale

loans.name: Lasme Lou

texts.en: Lasme Lou M. is a dynamic 41 years old single woman. She has 3 children and lives in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. She sells various products such as charcoal, yam, palm oil on the market of Port-Bouët, M. who take care to the education expenses of her children alone is seeking for a loan to ensure the payment of school fees and tuitions in September 2007 for her 3 children. She joined AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 and has been a good performer so far. She is very exited to get a loan from people she doesn’t know but who think about her life.

loans.use: Lasme Lou Madeleine will use the loan to pay school expenses for her 3 children

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
I am the mother of five children and a housewife. I am not allowed to go out and work as it is not considered acceptable in my family. My husband is an electrician and operates an electrical goods store where he provides goods such as tube lights, electric bulbs, fans, and so forth.

Earlier I took loans to finance his start-up business. The business is growing slowly since then. We need an additional investment of US$ 400 to buy some required inventory for our store. We will also use our savings to buy the needed stock.

loans.use: EXPAND ELECTRICAL GOODS STORE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Mr. Komla K., born on October 22, 1974 in Lomé, is married and the father of three children. After he was obliged to leave school because his parents could not afford to pay school fees, he set up a little shop where he sells motorcycle spare parts. He is presently asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 so that he can pay cash up front to purchase spare parts for his inventory, especially those frequently needed by his customers.

It will be much better if he does not have to purchase on credit the spare parts he resells and if he has a complete inventory of parts at any given time. In this way, he can improve the service he gives his clientele as well as improving living conditions for his family by earning a better profit from his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 22 Octobre 1974 à Lomé, Monsieur K. Komla est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il installa un petit comptoir de vente de pièces détachées moto après avoir déserté les bancs faute de moyens financiers de ses parents. A travers ce projet, il sollicite un prêt de $1000 pour lui servir de s’approvisionner en stock suffisant et au comptant d’autres pièces qui sont souvent demandées par les clients.

Ceci lui facilitera de ne plus acheter à crédit et aussi d’avoir un stock permanent à tout moment afin de mieux servir sa clientèle et aussi favoriser une condition meilleure de vie au sein de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of spare parts for re-sale

Approvissionnement et vente de pieces détachées

loans.name: Kabawo I(B) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Margret is 46 years old, married and has four children. Her husband heads a nursery school. Margret is a poultry farmer and also does some cultivation. She wants to use the extra profits to expand her business and improve her standard of living. Mary, B. and R. all have poultry businesses and want to use the loan to purchase more chicks. N. offers catering services and wants to use the loan to buy a refrigerator and purchase more furniture.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia Rodríguez is a single woman with the responsibility of maintaining her four small children who are of school age. She has been in the agriculture business since she was very young in the Achuapa municipality in the city of León.

The Achuapa municipality where Claudia lives has been facing the problem of having no electric power for a very long time and thus, they have no lighting. For this reason, she has acquired a solar panel for her home. After she acquired the panel, she now had a debt to repay, and she turned to Ceprodel to receive loans that will allow her to pay for it so she may do all of her household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia Rodríguez es una dama soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus cuatro pequeños hijos en edad escolar. Se dedica desde muy jovencita a la agricultura en el municipio Achuapa en la ciudad de León.

El municipio de Achuapa donde la señora habita, por mucho tiempo ha tenido una problemática como lo es la ausencia de energía eléctrica por lo que no cuentan con alumbrado y es por este motivo que la señora Claudia ha adquirido un panel solar en su hogar. Al haber adquirido este bien tiene la obligación de cancelar esta deuda y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan realizar el pago del panel y así lograr adquirir la luz eléctrica para realizar los quehaceres del hogar en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel so she may have electricity in her home.

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.ru:
Djamshed K. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 37 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary education. He does not have a job, but makes his living by animal husbandry. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves and small cattle which he sells after feeding. This brings in a good income for his family. Djamshed has been in this business for the past ten years. Right now the prices for cattle are a little bit lower so he wants to buy a few goats and sheep. He needs additional money and this is why he applied for a loan. He will be able to increase the number of heads of cattle which in turn will increase his profits from sales. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Карахонов Джамшед проживает в городе Яван.Возраст 37 лет. Женат, имеет пятерых детей.Образование среднее. Нигде не работает , но зарабатывает занимаясь животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник в котором разводит бычков и мелко рогатый скот. А потом после откормки их продает. Это дает неплохой доход его семье.Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 10 лет.Сейчас , когда цены на животных немного ниже клиент хочет купить овец и коз. Но для этого клиенту нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил получить кредит. Таким путем , он сможет увеличить поголовье скота, что даст возможность увеличить доход от продаваемых животных. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy small cattle

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Heritage and tradition have turned into a good option for making a living for Karina, a good mother of a family that lives to care for her 8 year-old son. She is an expert in the kitchen, and with her mother, she offers to their distinguished clientele the most exquisite plates in the region in a restaurant inside of her own house. Apart from this, she offers her cooking classes/ kitchen services to large groups according to their requests. Karina's wish is to become more well-known and to increase this business which has brought her great satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La herencia y tradición se ha convertido en una buena opción de vida para Karina, una noble madre de familia que vive para brindarle toda la comodidad a su pequeño hijo de 8 años, ella es experta en la cocina y en sociedad con su mamá ofrece a su más distinguida clientela los platos más exquisitos de su región en un restaurante que instaló en su misma casa, además adicionalmente ofrecen sus servicios de cocina a grandes grupos de acuerdo a los pedidos, el anhelo de Karina es hacerse más conocida y acrecentar este negocio que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones.

loans.use: Contracting public services and covering the costs of the store

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 33 year-old Eliza M.. She is married and has three children, ages 3, 7, and 13.

In 1990, Eliza established her butcher shop. Eliza needs a loan to buy a motorcycle, which she will use to pick up supplies and make deliveries to customers. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike, which she will use to pick up supplies and make deliveries to customers.

loans.name: Djima

texts.fr:
Unmarried with one person in his care, Mr. Djima O. was born on January 29, 1979 in Lomé. Since the year 2003, he has had a store selling pagnes (traditional print cloth) in the grand marketplace of Lomé. He accommodates his customers well and earns their loyalty. Itinerant saleswomen come to him to buy merchandise to resell. This initial loan that Mr. Djima O. is requesting will enable him to buy 30 bolts of GTP-brand pagne.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Célibataire avec une personne à charge, Monsieur O. Djima est né le 29 janvier 1979 à Lomé. Depuis l’année 2003, il a ouvert un magasin de vente de pagne dans le grand marché de Lomé. Il accueille bien ses clients et les fidélise. Les revendeuses ambulantes viennent chez lui pour acheter et revendre. Ce premier crédit que Monsieur O. Djima sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 30 pièces de pagne de marque GTP.

loans.use: To buy 30 bolts of pagnes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth Zeneyda S. used her Esperanza Bank of Hope loans to open her salon, Salon Belleza Grismary, two years ago.  Because of her loans and the help of her cousins, the salon is now able to offer both hair and nail services.  Ruth's ultimate dream is open more branches of her salon so that she can give her three children (aged 9, 13, 19) the best life possible.

loans.use: Salon Belleza Grismary (beauty salon)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seeks, plants, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christiana A. is a 32 years old. She is married and has two children who are in school. She is resourceful and supportive to her family. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like cooked rice with soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenditure. This has adversely affected production quality. She needs a loan to enable her to scale up production and maintain quality. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. 

Christiana is a member of a group called First Kings Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Mingboi

texts.en: Mingboi F. has a very big family -- 8 kids. He loves kids very much (maybe that is why he has so many kids). He is a high school teacher, but his teacher's salary isn't enough to feed such a big family. That's why he started his business of selling rice at the market.  First, he started with a small amount of money. Now he has analyzed that with more money he could have more profit out of his business. So he wants to borrow money to expand his business and better support his family.

loans.use: Purchasing more rice for greater sales.

loans.name: Mouv

texts.en:
Mrs. Mouv S. is a villager in Srae Vong Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Lach Phan, are farmers who own and cultivate rice on a small field to earn a living. On their plantation, they now face a small problem because infertile soil is badly affecting their crop. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Mouv S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to help her crops grow. 

Mrs. Mouv S. is 46 years old and the mother of six children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, two assist their parents on the plantation, and three are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Donatien Pierre

texts.fr: Né vers 1956 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur  K. Donatien  Pierre est marié et père de 6 enfants dont 4 scolarisés. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GM SENABLO DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 130 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1956 in the district of Kessounou in the town of Dangbo, Mr. Donatien Pierre K. is married and the father of 6 children, of whom 4 are enrolled in school. He is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GM Senablo of Glahounsa.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing the land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Donatien Pierre K. has requested a loan of 130,000 F CFA which will allow him to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Atsina

texts.en:
Atsina D. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale, at Bantama near Elmina. Atsina has received primary education. She is married and has one child; her husband is a fisherman.

Atsina has been selling fish since 2003. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her capital base.

Beside her are the fish undergoing preservation before sale.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S., 60, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Soun, 66, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1973 and have five children: two sons who are in school and three daughters. Two of their daughters are married but still live in the family home and the other daughter is a silk weaver.

Chan has been a silk weaver for 40 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who sells them at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been farming for 42 years. He grows many types of vegetables and other crops.

Chan is requesting her second loan of $1000 to purchase water pipe and a water pump machine for her husband's farm and to buy silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for the farm and to buy silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Léon

texts.fr: Léon E. est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis 7 ans à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agé de 48 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Pour donner plus de teneur à son activité, Léon souhaite avec ce crédit réapprovisionner son magasin afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa  famille.
texts.en:
Leon E. has been the owner of a variety store for the past 7 years at Avetonou, a village situated about 100 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. At 48 years old, he is married and the father of 3 children, who are all in school. To strengthen his business, Leon is requesting a loan to buy provision for his store to better meet the needs of his customers. This opportunity will enable him to keep up with the responsibilities of his family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions for his store

loans.name: John

texts.en: John S. is 41 years old and married with seven children. He sells crates of drinks.  He needs the loan amount of N120000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr:
A. Judith est née le 10 juin 1975 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du Bénin. Judith est originaire de DANGBO un village du département de l'OUEME dans le sud BENIN. Judith a divorcé de son mari depuis huit (8) ans et elle n'a pas d'enfant. Judith vit en location à kowegbo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Judith vend des tissus bazin riche. Judith est couturière de formation. Judith a laissé la couture parce que ça ne marchait plus bien pour elle. Judith a commencé la vente de tissus depuis onze (11) ans. Judith a une clientèle importante et elle pense diversifier son activité. Judith veut vendre en plus de tissus, des bijoux et colliers. C'est dans cette optique que Judith sollicite un crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
A. Judith was born on June 10, 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. She traces her roots to DANGBO, a village of OUEME county in southern Benin. She has been divorced for eight years and has no children. Judith rents a place in Kowegbo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells rich damask fabrics. She is a seamstress by training, though she left this trade because it was no longer doing well for her. She started selling fabrics eleven years ago and has a sizable number of customers. She's thinking of diversifying her business. She wants to sell more fabrics, some jewelry, and necklaces. With this in mind, Judith is requesting a loan.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics (rich damask)

loans.name: Los Cantaritos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los cantaritos es un grupo conformado por socias del mercado D. la zona D. Muy Unido, este grupo es D. personas muy alegres. Entre las actividades que se desarrollan en el grupo sonvariadas, D. las cuales se pueden mencionar: venta D. verduras, frutas, desayunos, comidas, cosméticos, lácteos, venta en bazar, chapería, venta D. carne y salón D. peluquería.
A todo el grupo le vamuy bien ya que tiene  ubicaciones estratégicas. El crédito lo utilizarán para renovar mercadería e incrementar su capital D. operaciones. En si el grupo es D. socias muy responsables ya que cumplen con el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The “Los Cantaritos” group is an association of very happy businesspeople from the market in the Muy Unido area. The activities of the group's members are varied, and incluD. selling vegetables, fruit, breakfast, food, cosmetics, meat, and dairy products, as well as running clothing stores, auto body repair shops, and beauty salons.

All of the businesses are doing very well as they are well-located. They will use this loan to replenish their merchandise and increase their working capital. This group is very responsible and punctual with loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zebra Juliet Madina Group

texts.en: Juliet M. is a single mother of four children, all of whom are going to school. She has been in her restaurant business for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase food items for her restaurant, such as soft drinks, maize flour, rice, bananas, meat and chicken. Her dream is to make more money and to buy a shop.

loans.use: To purchase food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Niaré un homme marié de 27 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme  et ses enfants dans le quartier Dialanicoro de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après l’école coranique, Monsieur Adama se lance dans le commerce. Il a fait la commercialisation des céréales pendant 4 ans au grand marché de Bougouni. Cette activité ne lui a pas réussie, c’est ainsi qu’il décida de commencer la vente des condiments alimentaires au même grand marché de Bougouni.
Avec 5 années d’expérience, Monsieur Adama Niaré maîtrise bien cette activité qu’il a appris auprès d’une  de ses sœurs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa nombreuse clientèle, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel et compte acheter,  une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au grand marché de Bougouni en détail au comptant et à crédit à une  clientèle majoritairement  constituée de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama Niaré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 26 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
 Il envisage dans les années à venir ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Niaré is a married man, 27 years old, and the father of two. He lives in a monogamous family with his wife and children in the Dialanicoro district of Bougouni City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After Koran school, he got started in commerce. He has been marketing grains for four years at the grand marketplace of Bougouni. This business wasn't successful, so he decided to begin selling condiments at the same marketplace. With five years of experience, he has a good command of this business, which he learned from one of his sisters. Concerned about satisfying his numerous customers, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan and intends to buy a sizable quantity of condiments of different types. Supplies are gotten in Bougouni and in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. And sales are made retail at the same marketplace, cash or credit accepted, to mostly women customers. With this loan, Mr. Niaré intends to realize a monthly profit of 26,500 francs CFA that will be used to expand his enterprise and to meet his family's needs. He envisions opening a shop in the years to come.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase watermelon seedlings, fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 25 años, es una madre muy amorosa y querida por su familia, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luis de 26 años y sus 2 hijos; Rosabel de 9 y Kevin de 5 años, quienes son su principal motivación. En Nuñoa (distrito de la provincia de Melgar departamento de Puno), se encuentra la tienda de Elena, la cual por su proximidad a la plaza principal de la ciudad es muy concurrida, ella abre todos los días a las 6 de la mañana y siempre que entra un cliente a su tienda lo recibe con mucha cordialidad y una amplia sonrisa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que al ser la administradora de su negocio, puede decidir qué horas trabajar y qué horas dedicarse a las tareas del hogar. Elena lleva 10 años atendiendo a la gente y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, aun así sabe que tiene que continuar trabajando duro para mejorar su vida. Para un futuro cercano, espera que su tienda crezca y se vuelva la principal de Nuñoa. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llega el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Elena is 25. She is a very loving mother who is well loved by her family. She lives in her own house with her husband, Luis, who is 26; and her two children, Rosabel, who is 9; and Kevin, who is 5. Her children are her primary motivation. Her store is in Nuñoa (district in the Melgar province, Puno department), and it is very busy because of its proximity to the main plaza in the city. She opens every day at six in the morning. Every time a customer enters the store she greets them very cordially with a wide smile. What she likes the best about her work is that, as the administrator, she gets to decide what hours she works and what hours she does the housework. She has been waiting on people for ten years. What she considers the most difficult is having to stay in her store all day. Even so, she knows she needs to keep working hard to improve her live. In the near future she hopes that her store grows until it becomes the best in Nuñoa. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She is always up to date with the agreements the group comes to in her Community Bank. She will use the 3,000 PEN she is asking for to buy more products to improve her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Ndevera is a member of the Muungano borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 36-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. Her children are ages 19, 16, 13, and 9.  

Ndevera started her own business selling soft drinks four years ago. She works six hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Ndevera’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,000 TSH in order to buy more drinks. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ndevera hopes to pay school fees, get more food, save money and expand her business. 

Bethania, another member of the Muungano borrower group, has also requested 250,000 TSH in order to support her own shop business.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 25 years old. Evelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 24 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter, who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to provide for her family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Vida is a trader. She trades in textiles, particularly underwear for ladies. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures her goods from Accra. Vida has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Irma Benita

texts.es: Doña Irma Es originarai de la comunidad de PAnquix su actividad principal es la agricultura ella viene realizando dicha actividad economica  desde hace quince años actividad que aprendio de su difunto padre en la venta de verduras y maiz sus principales puntos de ventas en la plaza de Totonicapan los dias sabados y martes y los dias domingo en San Cristobal Totonicapan hoy necesita de un credito  para remodelar su vivienda  para tener un hogar digno para poder vivir
texts.en:
Doña Irma is from the community of Panquix. For 15 years, she has worked in agriculture, which she learned from her deceased father. She sells vegetables and corn, and her principal points of sale are in the Plaza de Totonicapan on Saturdays and Tuesdays, and San Cristobal Totonicapan on Sundays. She currently needs a loan in order to remodel her house so that she has a decent home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu has been selling drinks and sachet water in wholesale and retail for long. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her family above poverty. She 49 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Delfina es casada, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos, Delfina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza 3 veces por semana, además vende desayuno todos los días.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 1300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Delfina son mejorar su negocio y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the communal bank "Hormigas." She is married, 56 years old and has 4 children. She travels to the different markets in the region where she sells food; she does this three times a week and also sells breakfast every day. Delfina needs a loan of 1300 soles to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Delfina dreams of improving her business and having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, pepper, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena N. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 44 years old. Lorena is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lorena sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Lorena's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Flamboyan Group

texts.es:
L. UD. “Flamboyan” Ubicado en el Barrio San Sebastián Municipio D. Tecpatán Estado D. Chiapas, México. Integrada por 5 acreditadas. Dentro D. este grupo se encuentra L. señora Orfanel Pérez Sánchez, es originaria D. Tecpatán Mezcalapa Chiapas, dice: “tengo un nombre talvez no muy popular, pero me gusta, mis padres decidieron llamarme así en reposición D. una tía muy querida”. Tiene 38 años D. edad, solo estudió L. primaria, su esposo se llama Rigoberto Bautista Narváez y trabaja en una mueblería. Poseen 3 hijos quienes aun van a L. primaria del mismo municipio.

Orfanel Pérez Sánchez, se dedica a confeccionar ropa como son: pantalones, vestidos, faldas y blusas. DesD. hace 18 años, aprendió por medio D. unos cursos que le impartieron en su misma localidad. Hoy lo hace con gran orgullo por que ayuda a sostener a su familia económicamente.

Por no contar con las herramientas necesarias, ha dejado pasar muchos trabajos, así que, decidió ingresar a Fundaciòn Realidad para hacer un préstamo y mejorar su establecimiento. 

Ya cuenta con sus clientes, generalmente los D. las escuelas primarias y jardín D. niños y niñas, para estos, les fabrica sus uniformes escolares. Una experiencia muy bonita que tuvo fue cuando realizó los trajes D. una graduación D. L. escueL. secundaria donD. recibió muchos halagos.

El sueño mas granD. que tiene es D. tener un establecimiento con maquinas actualizadas que le permita imprimir logotipos para así dar el servicio completo.

Las otras 4 mujeres que a continuación se mencionan también tienen su negocio, a excepción D. L. señora MariceL. García A., quien iniciará L. venta D. frutas y legumbres. Ma Isabel González Nañez, tiene un establecimiento donD. venD. telas para fabricar ropa. Maria Leida López D. L. C., venD. órdenes D. comida casa por casa en su misma comunidad. Maria Magdai Vázquez González, se dedica  a bordar bolsas y tapetes para venderlos.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Flamboyan," is located in the San Sebastián neighborhood in the city of Tecpatán in the state of Chiapas, México. There are 5 members in the group. Among them is señora Orfanel Pérez Sánchez, who is a native of Tecpatán Mezcalapa in Chiapas, who says, "I have a name that might not be very popular, but I like it. My parents decided to name me this after a very beloved aunt." She is 38 and only completed primary school. Her husband is named Rigoberto Bautista Narváez and works at a furniture store. They have 3 children who are all still in primary school in the same city. Orfanel Pérez Sánchez makes a living by making clothing like pants, dresses, skirts, and blouses. She has done this for 18 years and learned through some courses that she took in her area. Today she does this work with great priD. because it helps her sustain her family economically. Because she doesn't have the necessary tools, she has had to pass on a lot of work, so she decided to join Fundación Realidad to get a loan and improve her business. She already has customers, and generally she makes school uniforms for primary school and preschool students. She had a lovely experience when she maD. some suits for a high school graduation where she received a lot of praise. Her biggest dream is to have a business with updated machines that will let her make logos and offer complete service. The other 4 women who are mentioned next also have their own businesses, except for MariceL. García A., who will start selling fruits and vegetables. Maria Isabel Nañez has a business where she sells fabric to make clothing. Maria Leida López D. L. C. sells food from door to door in her community. Maria Magdai Vázquez González embroiders bags and tablecloths to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to be able to make clothing like pants, dresses, skirts, and blouses to later sell.  Also to make school uniforms and to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina  R., es una socia emprendedora y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es trabajador independiente.
Ella se dedica a la compra y  venta de maderas y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Yarina” desde hace cinco años. Karina empezó con un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizò en la compra de golosinas. 
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà madera para posteriormente venderla.
