Es una mujer muy sacrificada ya que todos los días se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para ir a comprar carne al por mayor que luego sale a vender casa por casa. Las bebidas las vende en su hogar y para ello cuenta con una congeladora en donde las pone a enfriar todos los días.

Su mayor sueño es montar algún día una despensa y carnicería. Sabe que no será fácil lograrlo pero mientras tanto está poniendo todo el empeño y esfuerzo para conseguirlo.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de más carnes y bebidas ya que tiene mucha demanda y desea cumplir con toda su clientela.

loans.use: purchase of meats and drinks

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia is a member of the Bonanza Communal Bank.

Teodosia is a 48-year-old widow with 7 children. She is from the Putaja community located two hours away from the city of Ayacucho, which she left due to political violence. Teodosia sells firewood from her home, which is located in the district of San Juan Bautista. She buys the firewood from suppliers that bring it to her house. She is assisted in her work by her children, some of whom are in college or in high school. During vacation periods, they work to be able to pay for school costs.

Teodosia needs a loan of 2,100 soles to be applied toward the purchase of firewood at wholesale prices.

Teodosia dreams of having a grocery store and a shoe store, and of her children being professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Teodosia es viuda, tiene 48 años y 7 hijos, Teodosia es de la comunidad de Putaja que se ubica a dos horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho de donde migro por la violencia política de esos años, Teodosia vende leña en su casa ubicada en el barrio tradicional de San Juan Bautista, la leña lo compra de los productores que le traen a su casa, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, algunos de sus hijos están en la universidad y en el colegio, durante las vacaciones ellos trabajan para poder costear sus estudios.

Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles, dinero que fue invertido en la compra de leña por mayor.

Teodosia sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes, una zapatería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Paulina María

texts.es:
La señora Paulina María Chávez M., tiene cuarentaicinco años y vive en el caserío Primavera calle Primavera, distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco departamento de La libertad Perú.
Cursó toda la educación primaria, pero ya no pudo continuar sus estudios por falta de medios económicos ya que no había educación secundaria en su distrito.
Se casó a los veinte años con el señor Segundo Ibáñez y tienen tres hijos, uno de ellos ya trabaja y los otros dos son estudiantes.
Tiene un negocio variable, se podría llamar de acuerdo a la estación, pero mayormente se dedica al negocio de productos lácteos, aunque también tiene una pequeña bodega.
Su primer préstamo que hizo a Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles con los que surtió su bodega, los devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará trigo y concentrado para sus vacas  con 500 soles y con los otros 500 surtirá su bodega.
Pertenece al Banco Mujeres de Trabajo desde hace cinco años y se siente muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos porque a aprendido a administrar bien su dinero y lo que es más importante a aprendido a ahorrar. 
El sueño más grande que tiene  Paulina es tener una gran tienda, al estilo superM..
texts.en:
Ms. Paulina María Chávez M. is 45 years old and lives in the Primavera country house, located in the Primavera street, in the Mache district of Otuzco, Perú. She finished all of her primary education but was unable to continue her studies for economic reasons, since there are no secondary schools in her district. When she was twenty years old, she married Mr. Segundo Ibáñez. They have three children: one is already working and the others are in school. She has a business that changes according to the season. The majority of the business is dedicated to selling dairy products; however, she also has a small store. Her first loan, which was given by Manuela Ramos, was for 300 soles and she used it to stock up her store. She paid the loan back in four months. She will use half of this 1000 soles loan to buy wheat and concentrate for her cows. With the other half of the loan (to be repaid in four installments) she will stock up her store. She has been a member of Banco Mujeres de Trabajo for the past five years and is grateful to Manuela Ramos because she has learned to manage her money very well; more importantly, she has learned to save her money. Her biggest dream is to have a large store in a supermarket style.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle food and articles to stock up her store.

loans.name: Nadra's Group

texts.en:
Nadra baji is a wife of Mr. S. and lives in a small area named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last two years. She has been married for the last 10 years. Nadra baji's husband is a government employee. Nadra baji's brother lives with her and works in the jewelery business. He buys jewelry from different jewelery shops and sells it in his community. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. Nadra baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and to take care of her family. She is applying for a loan for her brother's jewelry business so that he can expand his business and earn more money.

She is one of the six members of this group that is applying for a loan. Shakeela baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy sanitary supplies for their sanitary business. Tahira baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy artificial flowers for her decorative business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Reim

texts.en: Mrs. Reim I., 38 years old, is a villager in Trapaing Chrey Village in Takeo Province. She has a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Moung Vong, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Although Mrs. Reim I. and her husband work in different businesses, they still cannot support the family well. Therefore, Mrs. Reim I. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow. She is the mother of three children: one is employed in a garment factory; another is a construction worker; and, the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary L. is thirty-four years old. She is married with three kids who are currently in school. Mary is a dealer in electronic parts like electrical cables, transistors, transformers, screw drivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. She assists in providing good service to her customers. She buys her supplies from importers at wholesale prices and gives to her customers at retail prices. She requests the loan to enable her procure an increased stock of electronic parts. She hopes to increase her savings and expand her shop to include refrigerators and other electrical parts. She belongs to the community group called Boldness Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Uatimani

texts.en: Uatimani E., 18, is single with no children.  She has no experience in the elei (traditional fabric printing) \ clothes business, but she intends to start one up and sell to the village people and public 3 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala.  SPBD loans are Uatimani’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase materials to start up her business

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en: Mrs. Socheat N. lives in Roluos village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Khun Cheng, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They are facing problems because they do not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, or to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow on the field. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Socheat N. decided to ask for a loan for these purposes. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is a 36-year-old mother of four, one of whom is employed in garment factory, while two others attend the local school and the fourth is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, and hire a laborer

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica C. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon near the Elmina police station. Veronica has received a junior high school education. She is single and has no children. Veronica has been a hair dresser since 2005. She is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Her loan will be used to buy a variety of hair products to meet the demands of her customers who come to the salon. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build so that she can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: To buy a variety of hair products.

loans.name: Nils

texts.es:
La señora Nils I. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en el Jr. San Martín Nº 307, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inicio, con S/. 300.00 y fue por iniciativa propia, quien decidió emprender su pequeño negocio, vendiendo abarrotes. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes, en un local especialmente acondicionado en su propia casa. 

Con el prestamo de S/1,500.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, asimismo ahora que estamos en campaña escolar comprara  útiles escolares como lapiceros, lápices, plumones, correctores, borradores, cartulinas para mantener surtido su negocio y contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Nils, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nils I. R. is a member of the Banco Comunal "Picota". She resides at Mr. San Martin #307, Picota District, San Martin Department. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of two children, one of whom still depends on her. She started with 300 soles and by her own initiative began her small business selling groceries. Today she sells groceries from a specially designed area of her home. The loan of 1,500 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, will be used to buy more wholesale products, such as rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, canned fish, personal hygiene items, home cleaning supplies and, now that the school year is beginning, school supplies such as pencils, pens, markers, erasers, paper, etc. to stock her store and keep her clientele happy. She is solely responsible for all business decisions with respect to the store's profits. Personally, she states that she is more sociable, more sure of herself, and more responsible with regard to repayment of her loan. Nils is thankful to Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products (rice, milk, sugar, toilet paper, canned goods).  To purchase personal hygiene articles and school supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena has worked in agriculture for more than 5 years. She is a very hardworking housewife. She has 5 hectares of land and works it by seeding, weeding, and irrigating her plot in order to prevent the vegetables from drying. This year she has decided to increase the quantity of her produce because she will be helped by her son. Besides her work in agriculture, Elena has a job as a teacher of Romanian language at a school in the village. Elena is borrowing a loan from Microinvest to purchase seeds, as her teacher's salary is not enough to pay all her expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds to increase her produce yield

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema A., 32, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the taro and banana chips business. She sells to the general public five days per week.

This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala (about $150). SPBD loans are Tumema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase taro, bunches of bananas, vegetable cooking oil, fryer and salt

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase such as sugar, salt, soap, and other items for food products retail business

loans.name: Walim

texts.fr:
Cette femme est mariée et a 01 enfant. L’activité qu’elle exerce est le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle a démarré ce commerce en 2006 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Elle reçoit des commandes des coiffeuses et des esthéticiennes. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement ses clients. 
Voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 7 cartons de  crème « Afro chic », 5 cartons de crèmes « noble chic », 18 parfums de différentes marques et divers produits de beauté.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and has a child. Her work involves commerce in cosmetics. She started this business in 2006 and stocks up at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She receives orders from hairdressers and beauticians. Her current inventory prevents her from satisfying her customers appropriately. Wanting to resupply herself, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy seven boxes of "Afro Chic" cream, five boxes of "Noble Chic" cream, 18 perfumes of different brands, and various beauty products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams and various beauty products

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Абдулмумин Хафизов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абдулмумин более 4 лет занимается торговлей. Он торгует в основном овощами на рынке. До этого он работал "эпидемиологом". Клиент просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Abdulmumin H. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. Abdulmumin has been involved in sales for over 4 years. He primarily sells vegetables at the market. Previously, he worked as an epidemiologist. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase his product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 26 years old. She is married and mother of one child who is in school. She lives at Sefwi, in the western region of Ghana with her family. She is determined to provide for her child through hard work and commitment. To support her child, she has been selling cosmetics and perfumes with products like spray, powder, lip-gloss, blouses etc. and sells through hawking. She has been in business for four years now. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative. Therefore, she wants to use this loan to expand her inventory and enable her make a good income to sponsor her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells tailoring materials in her shop and has been in the business for the past four years. Rose has four children and she is 40 years old. She lives in Lagos and she is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase of more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Mr. Vy M., 34, and his wife, Mrs. Sothea Koem, 32, married in 1997 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a small village off National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vy has been a mason for 13 years. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. He is requesting his first loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorcycle to carry construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry construction materials

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the group coordinator of the group Minerva Mirabal, which is named after one of the three sisters famous for standing against the Dominican dictator Trujillo and becoming a martyr for the cause. At 61 years old, Carmen is old enough to remember the terror of the Trujillo era. She lives in a house with three other dependents in the northern slums of Santo Domingo, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

She has sought this loan as a means to continue improving her business with the goal of a becoming a prosperous ice cream vendor. She sees a strong market for this product as the Dominican Republic is hot enough to make anyone want ice cream. Finally, her goal is to use the money she makes to construct her own house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: purchasing ice cream

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sol” representado por la señora Gladis y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta D. ropa en forma ambulante, venta D. golosinas en porterías D. escuelas, venta D. desayuno en las  paradas D. trufis, entre los varones se dedican a la albañilería  y a la atención en cafés Internet. Como en toda actividad existe competencia, pero las señoras ponen todo D. su parte para salir adelante, además que confían en sus negocios y su capacidad D. venta D. productor ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para capital D. operación y para incremento D. su mercadería con la compra D. insumos para realizar masitas para vender, adquisición D. ropa al por mayor y también para la adquisición D. herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a realizar un trabajo mas eficiente. En general las socias no tienen mucha experiencia con grupos solidarios pero saben la metodología para la buena administración D. los fondos  y el trabajo en equipo.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Tamtamneh Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Tamtemneh group. They are small scale businesspeople in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each for the very first time to enable them improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve – they will be able to better support their school going children in terms of feeding, clothing and meeting schools expenses. 

Mariama L. (left) is the leader of this group. Mariama was born in Magburaka town, thirty-five years ago. She is married with four children.  Two of her children are in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II), the other is in JSS III and the other is nursery school. Mariama sells market food, rice, cooking oil etc. She has been in this business for more than six years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” Ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Barrio Porteño, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de aji.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ají,  por otro lado la señora se dedica también a la cría de ganado menor y mayor y también elabora artesanías a pedido.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan las reuniones,  y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de aji.

loans.name: Lili Elvira

texts.es: Doña Lili de 54 años de edad, vive en un barrio donde la delincuencia es abrumadora pero debido a los pocos recursos no se ha ido. Es madre soltera de tres hijos  los cuales los tres emigraron a otro país para buscar como ganar dinero ya que el desempleo esta mal en Nicaragua, pero gracias a la ayuda de las remesas que envían sus hijos logro primeramente poner una pulpería y hacer mejora a su casa y poderle dejar una vivienda digna a sus hijos,  ahora cambio de negocio, puso una tienda con venta de ropa, zapatos, juguetes y otros lo cual lo hizo con fondos que sus hijos dieron de su trabajo y de financiamiento para poder cubrir su negocio. Son ya muchos años de experiencia en las ventas que en los últimos meses debido a la crisis de desempleo, y de la sequía las siembras han sido bajas. Y con este crédito desea comprar ropa, zapatos, muchos juguetes para la temporada navideña que espera recuperarse ya que las ventas mejoran debido que mucha gente regresa a su casa y cumple con el sueño de sus hijitos. También espera que sus hijos pronto regresen y poder estar con ellos.
texts.en:
Lili is 54 years old and lives in a neighborhood where lawlessness is rampant. However, due to lack of resources, she is unable to move. She is a single mother of three children all of whom emigrated to another country in hopes of earning money since unemployment in Nicaragua is extensive. Thanks to the funds they send home she managed first to open a small grocery store and improve her home to leave a proper home for her children. Now, she changed her type of business and opened a store where she sells clothing, shoes and toys; she used funds that her children sent her as well as financing to cover costs. She has many years experience in sales but profits the last few months have been low due to the unemployment crisis and the draught. With this loan she intends to buy clothing, shoes and lots of toys for the holiday season and hopes to recoup since sales should be better because many folk return home and try to make their children's wishes come true. She also hopes that her own children will return soon so that she can be with them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and toys.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem S., 39, is married with four children. Three of her children are enrolled in a local high school. She resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, her husband is engaged in a business as a Tuk Tuk driver (a motorbike with a compartment attached), earning collectively an income of US $10 per day. He operates his business every day at a local market in the city. This primary source of income helps cover his household expense. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $500 to replace his old unreliable motorbike so that her husband will be able to operate his business efficiently.

loans.use: To replace the old motorbike

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Yessenia Solórzano tiene un pequeño negocio en el mercado Mayoreo uno de los mercados bien visitados. Vende productos ferreteros desde hace doce años, que junto con su esposo venden,   inicio con pequeños préstamos su venta. Tiene 32 años  de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Norte junto a sus tres hijos los cuales están estudiando. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa ya que quisiera embaldosar el piso por que es de tierra para mejor higiene y mejor comodidad para su familia. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compara CD, dvd y productos ferreteros para elevar el volumen de las ventas. Contenta por el apoyo del financiamiento por que gracias a estos préstamo eleva su inventario.
texts.en:
Señora Yessenia Solórzano has a small business at the Mayoreo market, which is one of the most frequented markets. She has sold hardware for 12 years along with her husband. She started selling with small loans. She is 32 and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood with her three children who are in school. Her plans are to be able to continue improving her home since she would like to tile her dirt floor so it will be more hygenic and more comfortable for her family. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of CDs, DVDs, and hardware to increase her sales volume. She is happy for this financial support and is thankful for this loan that will let her increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase CDs and DVDs to vary her sales and to sell hardware

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo, quien es policía, y con él tiene 2 hijos que son estudiantes.
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de comida típica de su región, lo hace los sábados y domingos en su vivienda.
Adicionalmente, ella es profesora de y viene trabajado en un colegio desde hace 10 años; ambos trabajos le gustan mucho porque la hacen sentir activa.
A su vez, la venta de comida le es muy rentable porque su casa está ubicada en una zona bastante transitada, por lo que cuenta con bastantes clientes.
Su deseo a futuro es lograr constituir un restaurante donde pueda vender más platillos y ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sí le encanta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe comprensión entre todos, y son muy responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mesas, sillas y mandará a construir un kiosco para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jenny is 37 years old. She lives with her husband, who’s a police office and they have 2 children who go to school. She’s been selling regional food at home for 6 years, on Saturdays and Sundays. She’s also a teacher and she’s worked for the same school for 10 years. She enjoys both jobs because they make her feel active. Food selling is very profitable because her house is located in a very busy area, so she has a lot of customers. Her dream for the future is to open a restaurant to sell more food choices and offer better accommodations for her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she loves working with her community bank because there’s a great deal of support among the members and they are very responsible with their payments. With the money, she will buy tables and chairs and will hire a contractor to build a small shop to provide a better service for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture and build a shop

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen E. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years-old and married with two school-aged children. Arlen owns and operates a business making and selling viand (food dishes) in the local community. Arlen has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arlen joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Arlen is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arlen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen K., 23, is married and lives with her only child in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. K. is a housewife, while her husband is a recycler who travels everywhere in the province to collect and buy recycling materials. He has been in this business since 2006. K. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family, and they are seeking a loan to improve their business. 
   
K. is requesting a loan of US $1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike and more recycling materials. When asked, K. said that the motorbike will help her husband transport his materials to sell at a factory so he can generate more income for his family. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy a motorbike and recycling materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: A. Chantal est née en 1975 à Dogbo mais vit depuis 10 ans à Gbodjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à AMESSIAMENOU K. Joseph, un transitaire, elle est mère de trois enfants et a trois autres enfants à sa charge.  Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Chantal vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure  ensemble les charges de la famille.  Chantal vend des vêtements et des sous-vêtements par le système de distribution. C’est à Lomé au Togo, pays à coté du Bénin, qu’elle s’approvisionne.  Chantal exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans, et est à son premier crédit à ALIDé.  Chantal sollicite ce crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle. Plus tard, Chantal ambitionne gagner une grande part de marché.
texts.en:
Chantal A. was born in 1975 in Dogbo, but has lived for 10 years in Gbodjè in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to K. Joseph Amessiamenou, a forwarding agent, she is the mother of three children, and has three additional children in her care. All of the children are in school. Chantal lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the family together. Chantal sells clothing and undergarments through the distribution system. She gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo, a country bordering Benin. Chantal has run this business for 5 years, and is on her first loan with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). Chantal is seeking this loan in order to strengthen her business and better respond to the numerous demands of her clientele. In the future, Chantal aspires to gain a larger market share.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 dozen sets of undergarments and one batch of clothing (infants' and children's outfits)

loans.name: Rehema Musa

texts.en:
Rehema is a 52-year-old woman married to Musa Konde who works as a driver and together they have seven children of whom five are grown up with families of their own and two are in secondary school. 

Rehema has been practicing subsistence farming for 30 years in Kibaoni-Malindi and sells her produce in Gongoni and Marereni centers which are in Malindi. She is able to make a profit of Kshs 3,000 a month. She also sells cereals as a secondary business.

Rehema is servicing her second loan and was introduced to Kadet by her group secretary. She had a previous loan with another Micro-finance Institution before joining Kadet. She plans to use this loan amount to prepare her farm and also buy seedlings and fertilizers. With the extra income from this loan Rehema plans to buy a grade-one cow for milk supply. 

Rehema describes herself as a diligent lady and she hopes to be self-sustainable through farming and milk production. She also wants to have piped water at her home.

loans.use: To prepare the farm and buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua A. B. is thirty-one years old. He and his wife have one sixteen-month-old child. His wife sells curtains and hand bags.  They hope to give their child a good education, up to the university level. Joshua's business is located in Kakamega. He sells sugar, flour, and soft drinks to the local people. He has been doing this business for the last six years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are very many people engaged in the same business as his, so customers are spoilt for choice. He works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of KES 40,000 to buy more bags of sugar, crates of soda, milk and other goods that he sells, to grow his business. He hopes to become a wholesaler in the future. He is very hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy sugar, crates of soda, milk, etc.

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes sells tuba, which is a coconut wine. It is famous not just in Praxedes’ town, but all over the Philippines. Having three children with her husband Ramo, she works hard to help provide for her family’s needs, especially her children’s education. She dreams of having them graduate from college in the near future. 

Praxedes applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. She will use it to increase her stock of tuba and containers.

loans.use: To purchase tuba and containers

loans.name: Marcia Gregoria

texts.es:
Marcia M. de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (llamado así por sus lomas, lugar muy humilde con calles de tierra y la mayoría de las casas son de caña) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad, ellos tienen dos hijos de 7 y 2 años.    

Cuando Marcia era pequeña su mama tenia una pequeña tienda ella le ayudaba y le compraba los víveres para venderlos. Cuando se caso invirtió sus ahorros víveres para vender y arreglo la parte delantera de su casa para ubicar su pequeña tienda. 

Por esa buena decisión ella ahora tiene su tienda, trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 21:00 pm todos los días, con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, enlatados y galletas para su pequeña tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket y tener a su cargo empleados para ella poder dedicarse a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia M. is 29 years old and lives in the periurban district of Fortín in Guayaquil. (Fortín is named after its hills. This humble place has dirt roads and most of the houses in the area are made of reeds.) Her husband works as a security guard and they have two children, ages 7 and 2.

When Marcia was a young girl, her mother had a small shop where she helped her buy and sell food. When she got married, she used her savings to remodel the front part of her house so that she could open a small store selling groceries.

That turned out to be a good decision. She now works at her store between 6am and 9pm every day. Her loan will be used to buy rice, canned goods, and cookies for her small store. In the future, she wants to open a mini-market and hire employees so that she can dedicate her time to raising her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, canned goods, and cookies

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
T. T. N. is 33 years old. She lives in Tien KH. village with her parents in-law, her husband and their three children. Her childen are young. She is a framer. Every day, she goes T. next village T. buy scrap-iron T. resell. Her husband is a builder. He has a daily income of about 70,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. They always try T. earn money T. raise the children. So, they are working hard. Mrs T. has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. She is a cluster leader and is the group leader of an 8-member loan group. In this loan cycle, she wants T. borrow 7,194,000 VND for her small business with hopefully T. have better life.

 About the other borrowers in her group:
 Tam T. D. is 54 years old. She grows vegetables and raises chickens. She wants T. borrow 654,000 VND T. buy fertilizer.
 Tinh T. T. ís 35 years old. She wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. breed pigs.
 T. T. T. N. is 28 years old. She grows vegetables. She wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. buy fertilizer.
 Uyen T. N. is 36 years old, she wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. grow vegetables.
 Mien T. H. is 51 years old, she wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. breed pigs.
 My T. N. is 42 years old, she wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. invest in her business.
 Do T. N. is 58 years old, she wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to invest in her small business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha N. is from the village of Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 60 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Editha is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Editha from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Chet S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is a midwife and earns USD 3 per day. Her husband produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning USD 6.60 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase rice to produce more rice wine. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce more rice wine

loans.name: Patrick Nepatao

texts.en:
Patrick Nepatao K. is 57 years old. He is married to Naitayiana Kuyioni and is a father of three school-going children. Patrick is a farmer, and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET from a market awareness effort conducted by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare his 10 acres of land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by renting a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

Patrick's dream is to be a large scale farmer with his own farm machinery. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend on land preparation, seeds and planting, and to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: C2158 Duhaguruke Group

texts.en:
Ester is 40 years old and married with three children who are 14, 12 and 10 years old. Ester takes care of one dependent who is 15 years old. Ester's husband works as a driver. Both, they work hard so that they keep progressing in their daily activities. Ester owns a business of selling eggs in the town. Her business is well organized because she employs one person so that her business runs smoothly. In this business, Ester has three years of experience. Ester is the leader of group which composed seven members; this group is called DUHAGURUKE in local language.

Ester and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business so that they satisfy their customers. This satisfaction will help them to earn more profits. With the extra money, Ester expects to create a new business of selling charcoal.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Pierrine

texts.en: Pierrine is 30 years old and engaged to be married. She has one child who is 2 years old, and her fiance is a businessman. She sells bed sheets, bed covers, and clothing in the local market. In the 8 years that she has had the business, she has become known for selling quality products. With some of the profits from her business, she has been able to purchase health insurance for herself and her child. With the loan she wants to buy higher quality bed covers and clothing.  ith the profits, she plans to buy more food and a greater variety of food for her family. She also hopes to invest some of the profits in developing her business.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets and bedcovers.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena J. is from the village of San Pablo Proper, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Ma. Elena is separated from her spouse and has 2 children. To make a living, Ma. Elena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Ma. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Ma.Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma.Elena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ma.Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase  livestock feed

location.town: San Pablo Proper, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh  T. L. is 40 years old and has 5 children. Two of them are at school. Ms Thanh is a  farmer. She grows rice in a paddy of 1,400 square meters. She also raises 400 chicken for eggs. She has run this kind of business for 5 years. Being a client of our credit program since 2005, she has  repaid very well. Currently, she needs a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy more chicken feed and also to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed and to improve her house.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng M., 61, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$ 5 each day, while her husband stays at home and helps her. Teng M. would like to request a loan of US$ 500 to expand her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To expand grocery inventory

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
femme de 43 ans, célibataire mère  de 4 enfants  dont l'âge varie de 3 à 18ans .
Elle débute dans la vente des sandales en 1996 quand elle n'a pu aller au lycée pour poursuivre ses études.
Elle achète des sandales au marché au près des grossistes, et elle revend avec des prix hors concurences pour vite écouler son stock.
Par jour , elle a des ventes de 20000f minimum et50000f maximum.pendant les périodes de fêtes et à la rentrée des classe, ses recttes journalieres doublent.
avec ce prêt , elle veut acheter des chaussures de sports  pour enfants (garçons et filles), des sandales hommes , des sandales femmes et des tangsde toutes les couleurs(10douzaines).
elle veut vendre beaucoup pour faire plus de bénéfices et réaliser son rêve de dévenir fournisseur afin de soutenir la scolarité de ses enfant.
Elle est très entreprenante et ambitieuse.
texts.en:
Antoinette is a 43 years old single mother of four children, between 3 and 18 years of age. 
She has been selling sandals since 1996, when she had to drop school and could not get a high school education. 
She buys shoes at the wholesale market and sells them at very convenient prices, in order to sell the entire stock quickly. 
Every day she gains between 20000F and 50000f, according to the season; she sells twice as much during the holiday season and at school begin. 
With this loan, she wants to buy sport shoes for children (boys and girls), men and women sandals and about ten dozen of flip flops in all colors. 
She hopes to increase her profit and achieve her goal to became a wholesaler and be able to provide for her children education. 
She is very enterprising and ambitious.

loans.use: Purchase of a stock of men, women and kids sandals.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita C. is from the village of Bungad. She is 46 years old. Rita is married and has ten school-aged children. To make a living, she sells vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Rita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak A. is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. Since March, 2010, Artak has operated his own woodworking workshop in Ijevan city. He takes orders from clients and sells his products by himself as well. He produces half-finished parquets and other semi-finished products. Thanks to his business income, Artak maintains his young family and bought a car for his business.

Artak asks for a 500,000 Armenian drams loan to buy calipers for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy calipers for his carpentry business

loans.name: Lara Marleni

texts.en:
Lara, 50, lives with her partner and their two minor children in Salas in the región of Lambayeque. She manages a small general store selling a variety of basic items including food, hygienic supplies and candy. She is proud to serve her community and increase their access to general items. He husband works as a field hand on local farms.

Lara plans to use the loan to purchase additional inventory in order to ensure that she has the proper quantity of products for the holiday season and expand her business. She hopes this will help her get nearer to her dream of running a large full-size store in the same town.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Nanecia

texts.en:
Nanecia B. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old, married and has 2 adult children. Nanecia owns & operates a specialized retail store where she buys and sells boiled duck eggs, also known as balot. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nanecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
la sra. Rosario L. M. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo, Rosario se dedica al servicio de moler maiz el cual comienza desde las 4:00 am hasta las 4:00pm todos los días de la semana, con una gran cantidad de clientas que llegan dos veces al día a moler el maiz.
Rosario ahora por ser epoca de navidad desea comprar ropa para vender ya que esta epoca es buena la venta de ropa y tiene una oportunidad de comprar ropa al por mayor a muy buen precio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario López Martínez, 39, lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood.  Rosario provides corn grinding services.  She starts work at 4am and goes until 4pm every day of the week.  A large number of customers come by twice a day to grind corn.

Because the Christmas season is near Rosario wants to buy clothes because clothing sales are very good during this time and she has an opportunity to buy clothes at wholesale at a very good price.

She will use the loan to buy the clothes.

She needs the profits to cover household expenses and to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She sells smoked fish for sale at Abura. She   Ekua has been in this business for eighteen years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used added to buy more fish for sale to expand her business. Ekua plans of reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Topoika

texts.en:
Topoika N. is 38 years old.  He is married and a father of ten children. He is in business construction, and he has been doing this for the last two years. His business is in a strategic place.

Topoika learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, with which he is planning to purchase paints and cement and pay for labor for ongoing construction.

He plans to use the profit from this loan to educate his children.  His hope and dream is to construct more rental houses.  He is a hardworking man, and with the right resources he can do great.

loans.use: to purchase paints and cement and pay for labor for ongoing construction.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Roció M. inició su negocio llamado “Tienda el Parce” hace tres años cuando decidió ganar dinero vendiendo para los cumpleaños  bandejas de pasabocas preparados con  harina de trigo, como deditos, pastelitos y empanadas, a las que agregaba queso, jamón, carne o pollo; con sus primeros intentos multiplicó la inversión y con los ahorros de su negocio y los de su cónyuge inició la venta de ranchos víveres y todo lo que consumen la familias colombianas en su canasta diaria, la que hoy es una gran tienda. Roció M. vive en el municipio de Soledad a 15 minutos de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 1, 2 y 6 años, por los cuales se esfuerza al lado de su conyuge para sacalos adelante, brindarles bienestar y lograr que se desarrollen como personas de bien. Su negocio maneja un capital de trabajo de  $2.463.730 cop, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 2 días y de inventarios de 14. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de un bulto de arroz uno de azúcar, dos pimpinas de aceite, una caja de sardinas grande y una pequeña, papel higiénico, paños desechables, gaseosas, crema dental y dulcería en general.  Su inversión será exitosa porque comprará de contado y obtendrá descuentos importantes, así mismo responderá oportunamente a  la venta de productos que sus clientes le han recomendado que venda y que ella podrá ofrecer un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Roció M. set up her business called "Tienda el Parce" three years ago when she decided to earn money selling trays of wheat-flour-based snacks such as 'deditos' (cheese fingers), cupcakes and empanadas (stuffed pastries) to which she added cheese, ham, meat or chicken.  She sold these to people hosting birthday parties.  With her first attempts, she increased her investment several times over and, with the savings from her business and her husband's savings, she started selling food products and other products with which Colombian families fill their daily shopping baskets.  Today her business is a large store.

Roció M. lives in the town of Soledad, 15 minutes from Barranquilla, with her husband and three children aged 1, 2 and 6.  She and her husband work very hard to get their children ahead in life, provide for them and make sure they grow up to become good people.  Her business has a working capital of 2,463,730 colombianos, her accounts receivable period is 2 days and her inventory turnover period is 14 days.

This is Roció M.'s first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, two 5 gallon cans of oil, one large and one small box of sardines, toilet paper, disposable diapers, soda, toothpaste and general sweet treats.  Her investment will be successful because she will pay cash and obtain good discounts.  She will also be able to start selling products that her customers have recommended she sell and will be able to offer them at a better price.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, two 5 gallon cans of oil, one large and one small box of sardines, toilet paper, disposable diapers, soda, toothpaste and general sweet treats

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture is Ton S.. She is a cloth trader; she buys pieces of cloth from garment factories and then sells them to the people who turn it into other products to sell. In addition, she also takes some pieces of clothes to weave mats, and sells them for extra-income to help support her family with daily expenses. She is married to Chomnan, a 31-year-old local farmer. The couple have three young children who attend school. In order to improve her business, Ton S. would like to request a loan to buy more pieces of cloth to weave mats to sell.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of cloth to weave mats

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth K. is 40 years old and married to Kipngetich Barmasai, who is a primary school teacher and supports his family with his salary.  They are blessed with two children: Kiplabat Ngetich and Jepkemoi  Ngetich.  Both children are in class eight. She does dairy farming and has been in this business for ten years with a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

She is borrowing a loan of 39,000 KES with which she plans to purchase dairy feed for the cows in order to achieve quality milk production. She plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to educate her children to a higher level.

This is her third loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan. Her dreams and hopes are to become a successful farmer and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed for cows

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo B. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 52 years old. Teofilo is married with six school-aged children. Teofi runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and beverages in the local community. Teofilo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Teofilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Teofilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and expand working capital. Teofilo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages. This will be his second loan from HSPFI.  

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 50 años, es una mujer noble y leal. Vive en su casa propia con su esposo José, de 60 años  y su hija que es madre soltera. Juntas se esfuerzan por salir adelante. María es una trabajadora mujer y madre de familia, toda su vida ha trabajado en diversos negocios de manera informal, y con estas ganancias, más la  ayuda de su esposo y la de ustedes, hace 6 años  instaló su tienda en el primer espacio de su casa, dedicándose a ella sólo por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de desayunos en el paradero de los buses, su primer negocio. Por ello con su hija se turnan en la atención, ya que su bodega es muy concurrida por estar en plena avenida. A María, le gusta mucho sus negocios que desarrolla, por generarle buena utilidades y es su única fuente de  ingresos económicos. Por ello, debe comprar más productos para diversificar su negocio y lidiar con sus competidores sin amilanarse. Está convencida que trabajando arduamente además de ampliar su negocio, podrá construir su casa. Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a su compañera de crédito con quien trabaja todo este tiempo, en busca de su desarrollo. María, cada fin de semana invierte en mercadería como galletas y gaseosas, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria, 50, is a noble, loyal woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Jose, 60, and a daughter who is a single mother.  Together they strive to get ahead.  Maria is a hard working woman and mother.  All her life she’s worked at various informal businesses and with her profits and help from her husband and from you six years ago she set up her store in her house’s front room.  She works at the store only in the afternoons because she spends mornings preparing breakfasts at the bus stop, her first business.  She and her daughter alternate taking care of customers because the store is quite busy being right on the avenue.

Maria likes the businesses she develops quite a bit because they generate profits and they are her only source of income.  Because of this, she has to buy more products to diversify stock and deal with her competitors fearlessly.  She is convinced that by working hard and expanding her business she will be able to build her house.

This is her 10th loan with MFP and she promises to repay her installments punctually because she does not want to disappoint her fellow loan member with whom she’s worked all this time seeking development.

Every weekend Maria invests in merchandise like cookies and soft drinks so will use the requested loan to buy more products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Naziko

texts.en:
Naziko T. lives in village Merissi, in mountainous Adjara. She is 48 years old and lives with her 22-year-old son. The main source of the family income comes from family agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and cheese from their milk is sold on the local market. They also have a plot with an area of 0.8 ha, where vegetables and fruits are grown. Naziko also works as a saleslady in a village grocery shop. Along with the above mentioned, Naziko and her son run a beekeeping business. 

With the requested loan Naziko plans to expand the bee-keeping business. She will purchase additional bee-hives and bee colonies. This will allow them to increase sales of honey and thus, improve the income of the family.

Naziko plans to use the increased income for payment of the study fees of her son, as well as to purchase some household items to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives and bee colonies.

loans.name: Nith

texts.en: Nith B., 45, is married and resides in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice product. B. and her husband sell Chinese noodles and food, earning an income of about USD 10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. B. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more supplements to expand her food selling business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more supplements to expand her food selling business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
El cliente tiene 34 años y radica en el trópico D. Cochabamba, desD. hace 10 años junto a su esposo.
Vivía en el departamento D. santa cruz en montero, ya que sus ingresos eran insuficientes para poder sobrevivir y vio una opción D. ir al trópico D. Cochabamba, aunque los primeros años fue difícil pero con esmero y muchos esfuerzos y con la ayuda D. su esposo lograron seguir adelante, trabajo en muchas cosas, hoy en día trabaja vendiendo comida, a la vez está emprendiendo  un taller D. costura,  poco a poco fue ahorrando y se compró su maquinaria.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar tela para su taller D. costura, poco a poco  en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y así poder sacar adelante a toda  su familia.
texts.en:
The customer is 34-years-old and has lived in tropic of Cochabamba (an area in Bolivia known for its tropical forest) for more than ten years together with her husband.
She lived in the department of Santa Cruz en Montero, but as their income was insufficient to be able to survive and she saw an option to go to the tropic of Cochabamba and although the first years were difficult, with care and much effort and with the help of her husband they managed to get ahead.  She worked in many things.  Today she works selling food and at the same time is starting a sewing workshop.  Little by little she saved up and bought herself a machine.
The loan that she is requesting is to buy fabric for her sewing workshop.  Little by little in the future she wants to expand her business and be able to get ahead along with her whole family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her work as a seamstress.

loans.name: Honeylee

texts.en:
Honeylee is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 23 years old. Honeylee is married and has 1 young child. To make a living, Honeylee owns & operates a motorela or habal-habal services business for local community members. Honeylee and her husband are also planting and harvesting corn. Honeylee has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Honeylee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Honeylee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorela service. Honeylee is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the service & to buy corn seeds for the farm. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Honeylee from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the service & to buy corn seeds for the farm.

loans.name: Llancasun De Arin Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Llancasun D. Arin” tiene 7 años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Huaran D. provincia D. Calca del departamento del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. Huaran que está ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad del Cusco. (Perú).  

En esta reunión conocimos al señor Juan Ariel que vive en la hermosa comunidad D. Huaran. Es el jubilado D. la policía y su esposa es jubilada D. educación por el Arte. Ellos con sus ahorros abrieron un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta D. comestibles en su domicilio en la misma comunidad donD. viven. Juan Ariel y su esposa son responsables, amables y trabajadores y por tener estas cualidades sus vecinos les invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Ya son varios años que empezaron con el negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, tarros D. leche y otras cosas más. Él es una persona con muchas ganas D. superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo D. brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Llancasun D. Arin" communal bank has been operating for 7 years. Its members are workers and entrepreneurs who seek every opportunity to get ahead and give their children a better future thanks to their work. The communal bank meetings are once a month in the village of Huaran, province of Calca, department of Cusco. Most members live in the village of Huaran, located one hour away from the city of Cusco (Peru). 

At one of the meetings we meet Juan Ariel, who lives in the beautiful village of Huaran. He is a retired policeman and his wife, a former art teacher, is retired as well. With their savings they opened a small food catering business which they run from home, in the same village where they live. Juan Ariel and his wife are responsible, pleasant and hard working and because of these qualities their neighbours invited them to join the communal bank. They started the business several years ago and it's going well thanks to their hard work. In this occasion, he needs the loan to buy more merchandise, such as rice, sugar, milk and other things. He is a very eager person and wants to run a successful business, always wanting to proviD. the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as rice, sugar, milk and other things

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: La señora Máxima, oriunda de Temporal de la ciudad de  Chuquisaca, su actividad es la venta de ripio y flete de su camión en la zona del torno, lleva ya varios años dedicándose a la venta de material de construcción, esta es su sexta operación crediticia, la señora esta agradecida con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ella y brindarle un apoyo para obtener una motocicleta para el uso personal ya que las distancias que recorre la Sra. desde su casa a otros lugares es muy alejada y una motocicleta le será muy útil y se sienten agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en:
Máxima is from Temporal in the city of Chuquisaca.   Her business consists in selling gravel and in leasing her truck in the El Torno zone.  She’s been selling building materials and supplies for several years.  

This is her sixth loan transaction.  She is grateful to our firm for having trusted her and granted her help to acquire a motorcycle for personal use because the distances she travels from home to other places is very long and a motorcycle would be very useful.  They are grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia tiene 53 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. crianza D. pollos, ella venD. pollos en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como Anta e Izcuchaca, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
She belongs to the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". It is located in the district of Cusco, and it belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

She is 53 years old, married, and she has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business raising poultry. She sells the poultry independently, offering them at various locations such as Anta and Izcuchaca. She wants to expand her poultry business. She requests a loan to purchase poultry and poultry feed.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and poultry feed.

loans.name: Messie

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Messie. She is married and has three children, aged 28, 25 and 22. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she is her mother. In 1990, Messie established her timber business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in the running of the home, and that is her major source of income. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Messie requires a loan in order to buy a power saw. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Messie plans to get more power saws, educate her children and to own a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a power saw.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is trading in fruits and vegetables from a rented booth. He has been engaged in this business for two years. Armen would like to increase the variety of products and develop his business further. This loan will help him to increase his sales and get more income. 

Additional income will help Armen expand his business by opening a new shop. He will also provide better living conditions for his family. Armen lives together with his wife and school-aged son.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old; married to Nelson.  She supports a family of five people.  She has been in her business for nine years.  Her monthly income from her business is KES.36,000.  This is her third loan.  She has been loaned KES.40,000, which she will use to purchase more stock of second hand clothes for sale.

The anticipated profit that she will get from her business will be used to buy more mitumba clothes (second hand clothing).  Her hopes and dreams for her future is to educate her children and to become a well off person in the society.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her second hand clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory, create marketing, and invest in advertising materials.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.es:
Bernardita integra el Banco comunal “Amaican” perteneciente a la comuna de Pudahuel, ciudad de Santiago. Ella se dedica al rubro de los servicios específicamente peluquería, desde hace 30 años. Bernardita comenzó como ayudante en un salón de belleza y desde hace 11 años se independizó como trabajadora, por lo que ahora cuenta con un local, el cual arrienda, está ubicado a 15 minutos de su casa. Comenta que le va muy bien, a pesar de la competencia dentro del sector donde vive.  
Sus horarios de trabajo son todos los días de la semana, desde las 11ºº horas de la mañana, hasta las 21ºº horas de la noche, el único día libre o de descanso es el día lunes. 
Sus insumos los,  compra en locales comerciales y distribuidoras dedicadas solo a la venta de productos cosmetológicos y para el cabello. 
Con el crédito comprará un vaporizador (uso post masajes y tinturas para el cabello) y una esculpidora (tijera para entresacar el cabello).
Sus metas en su negocio son ampliar y remodelar su peluquería, además comprar nuevos productos para realizar más servicios, como el de depilación (cama y olla para depilación).
Bernardita vive junto a su hijo de 19 años de edad, quien estudia la carrera de laborista dental. Sus sueños a nivel personal son adquirir su vivienda propia, para esto postuló al subsidio habitacional por lo que además integra un comité de vivienda. 
Fondo esperanza ha significado una gran ayuda para su negocio, especialmente al momento de invertir en nuevos productos, que no podría costear sola. Es por esto que Bernardita se encuentra muy agradecida de los servicios otorgados por la institución. 
Las relaciones interpersonales al interior del grupo del Banco comunal, son muy buenas, ya que existe respeto, compromiso y confianza. 
Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), región Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como “lugar donde se juntan las aguas” o “lugar de charcos”, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el río Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carén y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la producción agrícola por la existencia de abundante agua subterránea.
texts.en:
Bernardita is a member of the Communal Bank "Amaican", which is located in the community of Pudahuel in Santiago city.  She has been working providing services, specifically hair-dressing, for the last 30 years.  Bernardita started as an assistant in a beauty salon, and then 11 years ago become independent.  She now has her own premises, which are leased and located 15 minutes from her home.  She comments that it is going very well for her, in spite of the competition in the area where she lives.

Her work schedule is every day of the week, from 11 in the morning until 11 at night.  Her only days off are Mondays.  She purchases her supplies from commercial premises and distributors who solely sell cosmetology and hair products.

With the loan, she will purchase a vaporizer (for use after massages and hair coloring), and sculpting scissors (scissors for thinning out the hair).

Her goals for her business are to expand and remodel her hair salon.  Additionally, she would like to buy new products to introduce more services, such as waxing (a bed and wax melter).

Bernardita lives with her 19-year-old son, who is studying for a degree as a dental technician.  Her dreams on a personal level are to acquire her own home; she has applied for a housing subsidy, as she is also a member of a housing committee.

Fondo Esperanza has been a great help for her business, especially when needing to invest in new products that she would not be able to afford on her own.  This is why Bernadita is very grateful for the services offered by the institution.

The interpersonal relationships between the group of the Communal Bank are very good, as they have respect, commitment and trust.

Pudahuel is a community in the western part of Santiago (the capital of Chile), in the metropolitan region.  The name is from Mapundungun (the Mapuche language), and translates as "the place where the waters meet", or "the place of the pools", due to its wide river network composed of the Mapocho river and the Lampa, Carén and Las Cruces estuaries.
